La señora silvia trabaja dia a dia con mucho esfuerso ya que su deseo es tener su casa propia y el poder terminar sus estudios de primaria ya que la Sra. Sivia recien aprendio a leer y escribir fue duro para ella pero tiene muchos deseos de superacion y ganas de seguir adelante asi mejorar su calidad de vida, es una persona responsable y trabajadora desde muy pequeña la Sra Silvia trabajo Ya que quedo huerfana de Padre y tubo que salir a buscar trabajo para ayudar a los gastos de su familia.

La Sra. Silvia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia is single, and she has been selling groceries for 5 years; she lives alone in the neighborhood of Cupesi, which is also where her store is located. In her store, she offers all basic necessity products; her store is well stocked but she needs to expand her business. With the money from the loan, she will buy more merchandise in order to have a better income and fulfill her planned objective. Mrs. Silvia works hard every day since her wish is to have her own house and finish her primary school studies; she recently learned to read and write. It was difficult for her, but she really wants to get ahead in life and continue forward in order to improve her quality of life. She worked from a very young age, since her father died and she had to find work to help pay for household expenditures. Mrs. Silvia is very grateful with Emprender and Kiva for their trust in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su menor hijo de dos años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su menor hijo hizo que sintiera la necesidad de iniciar un negocio que le permitiera obtener ingresos con los que pueda salir adelante. Por eso decicidó instalar una bodega en casa de sus padres desde hace dos años. Empezó vendiendo pocos productos y poco a poco, gracias a su esfuerzo, el negocio ha ido creciendo; actualmente ofrece abarrotes, productos de belleza, ropas para damas y caballeros, gaseosas y cerveza, entre otros. La variedad de productos que ofrece y el buen trato que brinda hacen que su negocio tenga mucha acogida.

Raquel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mercadería de manera que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y también obtener mas ingresos que le permitan seguir adelante y apoyar a los gastos de su hogar. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que ha luchado por salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Raquel is a 28 year old single mother. She lives with her two year old son in her parents’ house. It is located in the Zaña district, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get her minor son ahead made her feel the need to start a business, which would allow her to get income to get ahead. Therefore, two years ago she decided to set up a convenience store in her parents’ house. She started selling a few products, and thanks to her efforts, the business has been slowly growing. She currently sells groceries, beauty products, women’s and men’s clothing, soft drinks, and beer, among other things. The variety of products she sells and the good service she offers make her business very well received. Raquel wishes to expand her business by purchasing merchandise so that she can satisfy her customers’ demand. She also wants to get more earnings that will allow her to get ahead and help with the household expenses. That is why she has seen the need of asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,500 PEN. This will help her achieve her objective. She is a very hard-working woman who has fought to get ahead in spite of being a single mother. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to expand her convenience store

loans.name: Together Women Group

texts.en:
Regina B. is the leader of a five-person borrowing group called Together Women. She is 35 years old, single and has five children aged 6 to 15 years old. Regina also cares for her mother and father.
 
Due to the war and having children, Regina was only able to attend school through 8th grade. For 15 years, she has been selling fried doughnuts at the Omega Community in Paynesville, Liberia. She says she keeps customers returning to her by making sure to prepare the doughnuts excellently.

Regina plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more flour, sugar and oil. Her goal is to have her children finish school and build a house for them.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Regina is the one holding the sign. Rebecca K. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and oil to make doughnuts

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Née en 1968, H. Cécile vit depuis 32 ans environs à Djassin Houinvié, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo au Bénin. Mariée à DOTOU Allodé, un matelassier, Cécile est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Cécile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Cécile mène comme activité, la vente d'huile de palme et d'huile d'arachide à Djassin Tokpa à Porto-Novo. C'est au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, que Cécile s'approvisionne. C'est la première fois que Cécile sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Cécile H. has been living for the past 32 years in Djassin Houinvié, in the third borough of Porto-Novo in Benin. Married to Allodé DOTOU, a mattress manufacturer, Cécile is the mother of six children, all having attended school. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple shares the various family expenses. To meet her needs and those of her children, Cécile sells palm and peanut oil in the Djassin Tokpa area in Porto-Novo. She gets her supplies from the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. This is the first time Cécile requests a credit loan from ALIDé, to increase her stock supply and improve her response to high customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jerrycans of palm and peanut oil

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka owns a shop where she sells foodstuffs like beans, rice and maize. She has been in this business for over 8 years. She does this to sustain herself and her family. She wants to expand her business so she is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell to maximize her profit.

She is 35 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Lagos. She thank all lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more feed for his animals

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati K. lives and works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. She is 45 years old, married to a taxi driver, and has one child. Mrs. K. has been running her business from home since 2002. She sells a variety of grocery products as well as charcoal. This will be her first loan from WAGES which she will use to replenish her supply of groceries and charcoal.  Approximately 75% of the total amount will go towards the purchase of charcoal and the remainder will be used to purchase any groceries needed for resale. With this loan, Mrs. K. will be able to keep her shelves full of food and her tins full of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and grocery supplies

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, es un cliente antiguo de nuestra institucion solo tiene creditos con emprender se dedica a la Cerrajeria elaborando canaletas, Tinglados , rejas y Protectores de ventanas, han  mejorado su negocio junto con su esposa y 4 hijos, es una familia creyente muy apegados a Dios, asisten a una iglesia Evangelica, La familia vive en alquiler pero ya estan en proyecto la compra de su casita  propia dicen que tarabajando duro y con la ayuda de Dios lo lograran. Por el momento el Sr. Santos requiere de este credito para la compra de una Maquina de Soldar que le hace falta y lo demas para la compra de activos para su casa. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender Y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Santos is married and has four children. He is a long-standing client of our institution. He has loans only with Emprender. He is a locksmith but makes all kinds of metal objects: gutters, sheds, gates and window grills. Together with his wife and four children he has improved his business. They are a devout, very close to God, family; they belong to an Evangelical church. They rent their house but are negotiating the purchase of their home; they say that with hard work and God’s help they will accomplish this. For the time being, however, Santos needs funds to buy a welding machine that he needs as well as some assets for his home. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rouguiyata S.

texts.fr: Madame Rouguiyata S. D. est une femme mariée  ayant   6 enfants.  Elle habite dans la localité  de Ouakam et  est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis 5 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 02 prêts antérieurs. Madame D. évolue  dans le secteur du commerce depuis 20 ans. Elle est bien connue dans la vente de produits détergents  (Omo), de henné, de thiouraye  et souvent de tissus. Elle a démarré  avec la vente de beurre de karité  et de produits locaux.  Sa stratégie consiste a diversifier ses produits vendus conformément   aux besoins de la clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but de programmer un voyage en Mauritanie  et acheter des marchandises. Les crédits consentis lui permettent d’avancer dans ses projets, de participer dans les dépenses  quotidiennes et d’aider ses enfants à progresser.
texts.en:
Madame Rouguiyata S. D. is a married mother of 6. She lives in the town of Ouakam and has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit association for five years; she has already received two loans. Madame D. has been developing her business for twenty years, and is well-known for selling detergent products (Omo), henna, thiouraye (a type of incense) and sometimes fabric; she began by selling shea butter and local products. Her strategy lies in adapting her product range to her customers' needs. She is seeking a 200 000 FRS loan in order to plan a trip to Mauritania to buy goods; the requested loan would allow her to proceed with her business projects, to meet everyday living costs, and to help her children to get on in life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase business funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
Juan M. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es divorciado pero tiene 2  hijos que viven con el de 17 y 14 años.
 
Juan inicio con la panadería hace mucho tiempo con la ayuda de una amiga que le presto un horno  y le enseño con paciencia hacer pan y dulces. Después de tener ingresos se compro una vitrina y con la ayuda de su ex cuñado compraron un horno industrial.  

Ahora el trabaja desde las 04:30 am hasta las 22:00 pm, haciendo panes enrollados, dulces, alfajores, roscas de harina, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, mantequilla, una panificadora para su negocio.

En el futuro el quiere tener una panadería-tienda y poder construir en su casa una loza.
texts.en:
Juan M. is 38 years old, and lives in a semi-urban area in the perimeter of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has all the basic services. He is divorced but has 2 children who live with him, they are 17 and 14 years old. Juan started at the bakery a long time ago with the help of a friend who loaned him an oven and taught him with patience how to make bread and sweets. After earning some income he bought himself a showcase and with the help of his ex brother-in-law, they bought an industrial oven. Now he works from 4:30 am until 10:00 pm, making rolled bread, sweets, cookie sandwiches, rolls, etc. With this loan he wants to buy flour, butter, and a bread machine for his business. In the future he wants to have a bakery shop and be able to build crockery in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy flour and a bread machine

loans.name: Marie-Madeleine

texts.fr: Née en 1962 au Bénin, S. Marie-Madeleine est mariée à HOUNKOUNOU Noel et est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais seulement trois enfants sont à sa charge. La famille vit au quartier Adjinan, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Marie-Madeleine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses charges, Marie-Madeleine prépare et vend des beignets (faits à base de farine de blé et du sucre) à son domicile. A côté de cette activité, Marie-Madeleine vend également des biscuits, bombons, etc. à son domicile. C'est au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, que Marie-Madeleine achète ses produits. Marie-Madeleine a bénéficié auparavant de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Marie-Madeleine voudrait agrandir son activité et accroître sa clientèle. Mais elle manque de moyens financiers nécessaire à l'aboutissement de ce projet. C'est pourquoi, Marie-Madeleine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Bénin, S. Marie-Madeleine is married to HOUNKOUNOU Noel and is the mother of five children, who have all been provided with schooling. But only three of the children are in their care. The family lives in the Adjinan quarter, in the third district of the city of Porto-Novo. The couple jointly ensure that their various family expenses are covered. Marie-Madeleine never attended school. To support herself, she makes and sells beignets (made from wheat flour and sugar) out of her home. Aside from this work, she also sells cookies, candy, etc. out of her home. She buys her goods at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She benefited before from two ALIDé loans and has repaid both of them. She would like to expand her business and to grow her customer base. But she can't afford to complete this project. This is why Marie-Madeleine is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of cookies, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es: El Sr. Marvin C. es trabajador activo de la alcaldía municipal desempeñándose como operario de proyectos tiene cinco años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado tiene 3 niños menores de edad en edad escolar, el dinero lo necesita para cambiar el techo de su casa y si le sirvió de mucho el primer crédito ya que con eso completo para comprar los materiales de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin C. works for the city as a project manager. He has done this work for 5 years. He is married and has 3 school-age children. This loan money is needed for a new roof. His first loan was very helpful; with it, he completed the purchase of materials for his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheets of metal roofing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años tiene instalada en la vivienda en donde vive una bodega en la que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. La idea de este negocio nació ante la necesidad de agenciarse de una fuente de ingresos adicionales con los cuales poder solventar la economía de la familia ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no con suficientes para mantenerlos.

Elizabeth trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su negocio, por ello trata de ofrecer productos de calidad y brindar a sus clientes un buen trato; pensando en satisfacer efectivamente la demanda de sus clientes y también percibir mas ingresos, ella se ha propuesto ampliar su negocio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Elizabeth es una mujer bastante emprendedora que siempre lucha por salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de darles una mejor educación. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in her parents' house, which is located in the Cayaltí district, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the past six years, she has operated a general store in the house where she lives, offering groceries and basic necessities to her customers. The idea for this business arose from the need to create a source of additional income to cover the family's expenses, since her husband works as an agricultural laborer and his wages are not sufficient to support the family. Elizabeth works as hard as she can to succeed with her business; she tries to offer quality products and provide excellent service to her customers. In the hope of satisfying her customers' needs more effectively and also increasing her income, she has decided to expand her business. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Elizabeth is a very enterprising woman who has always worked hard to get ahead. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and offer her children the opportunity to get a good education. She has previously worked with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic goods to expand her store

loans.name: Mayra Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Mayra Rafaela tiene  51 años de edad, actualmente es madre soltera y tiene solamente un hijo, de una edad de 25 años que vive aparte. La señora tiene un negocio de mercadería en general, ella ofrece los productos y distribuye de manera ambulante, generalmente por encargos. La señora comenzó su negocio hace 30 años, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, sin embargo poco a poco fue ahorrando lo suficiente para viajar al mercado oriental de Managua y comprar ropa, fue hasta hace 3 años que empezó a traer electrodomésticos por encargo. El crédito será invertido en la compra más mercadería para aprovechar las festividades de semana santa que se acercan. Ella sueña que su negocio siga creciendo para algún día poder dejarles a sus nietos un negocio bien establecido y que no dependan de un trabajo para sobrevivir sino del negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra Rafaela is 51 years old. She is a single mother and has just one son who is 25 years old and lives on his own. Mayra has a business selling general merchandise. She offers products and travels to distribute them, generally through orders. Mayra started her business 30 years ago. She began selling fruits and vegetables. However, little by little, she began saving enough to travel to the oriental market in Managua and buy clothing. It was 3 years ago that she began to sell household appliances by order. The loan will be invested in purchasing more merchandise in order to take advantage of the festivities around Holy Week that are nearing. Mayra dreams that her business will continue growing so that one day she will be able to leave her grandchildren with a well-established business and that they will not need to depend on a job other than this business to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: La Sra. Karla Fabiola E. es profesora de secundaria tiene 24 años de ser maestra, es casada tiene dos niños menores en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para la terminación de su casa va a comprar materiales de construcción como cerámica, cemento, pago del transporte del traslado del material y pago de la mano de obra, y todos los créditos que ha tenido con ceprodel los ha invertido en la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karla Fabiola E. has been a junior high school teacher for 24 years. She's married and has two small school age children. She is requesting this money to finish her home. She will purchase construction materials such as ceramic tile and cement, and will pay for the transportation of the materials as well as for the labour. All the loans she has had from Ceprodel have been invested in the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and blocks

loans.name: Rosaline Sourou

texts.fr: Z. Rosaline Sourou est née le 14 Mars 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Rosaline Sourou réside depuis sa naissance au quartier Djassin Daho, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Mariée à GBETOHO Godonou, un maçon, Rosaline Sourou est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Rosaline Sourou vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. Rosaline Sourou n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis 15 ans environs, Rosaline Sourou vend du pain sucré à Djassin Tokpa à Porto-Novo, ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'apporter une aide financière à son mari. Rosaline Sourou s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosaline Sourou voudrait élever le niveau de son activité afin de  mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C'est la raison pour laquelle Rosaline Sourou sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Rosaline Sourou was born on March 14, 1980 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Since birth, she has been residing in the Djassin Daho quarter, in the 3rd district of the city of Porto-Novo. Married to GBETOHO Godonou, a mason, she is the mother of four children, who are all in school. She helps out her husband with regard to the various family expenses. Rosaline Sourou never attended school. For fifteen years, she has sold sweetened bread in Djassin Tokpa in Porto-Novo. It enables her to support herself and to do her financial part for her husband. She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin, and also from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rosaline Sourou would like to raise her level of business in order to satisfy her customers further and to earn more income. For these reasons, she's requesting a loan for the first time from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sweetened bread in bulk

loans.name: Buntuuse Farmers Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Betty has been a fishmonger in Busaale, Lugazi district, for a period of four years. She calculates that in a week she currently makes more or less 120,000 shillings. Her experience in this business has taught her that, with good communication and customer skills, one can succeed in any customer-oriented enterprise.

Betty’s dream is to own her own retail shop in the near future and also to build her own rental apartments. For now, though, her prime focus is principally on getting a loan, which she reckons will enable her to see these dreams come to pass as she buys more fish for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dioma

texts.fr: Madame Dioma D. gère  une boutique de  ou elle vend des denrées  alimentaires chez son père. Elle évolué  dans le commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Mais elle a une activité  secondaire de tricotage. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs pour renforcer le stock de produits dans sa boutique. Ses bénéfices  lui permettent d’augmenter son fond de commerce et de supporte les charges de  certains de ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ms. Dioma D. manages a store in which she sells food items at her father's place. She has been advancing in commerce for over three years. But she has a secondary business involving hand-knitting. She is married and the mother of three children. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for bolstering her stock of goods in her store. Her profits enable her to increase her capital and to cover some of her personal needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA : MARCELINA, ES NUEVA CLIENTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU ESPOSO Y ELLA TRABAJAN  EN AGRICULTURA  EN LA ZONA SUD VILLA PAGADOR. ES UNA  FAMILIA DE BAJOS   RECURSOS ECONOMICOS QUE SE DEDICAN A LA SIEMBRA DE ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD COMO CHOCLO, CEBOLLAS, ETC. LA CLIENTE SOLICITA EL EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS  PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA Y DESPUES DE COSECHARLOS LO COMERCIALIZA EN LOS MERCADOS DE LA ZONA Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, LA SEÑORA VENDE PAPA POR MAYOR. ES MUY TRABAJADORA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a new client of our institution. She is married and has 3 school-age children. She and her husband work in agriculture in the southern part of Villa Pagador. Their family has few financial resources and they work at growing much needed products, such as corn, onions, etc. The client requests the loan in order to buy seeds to grow potatoes for harvesting. She sells them in the local markets and thus can increase her work capital. She sells potatoes wholesale. She is very hardworking and very grateful to EMPRENDER and Kiva for the trust demonstrated by granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica  tiene 35 años, no es casada, pero vive con el padre de sus 4 hijos, que son aún pequeños, en una casa de tripley, ubicado en un espacio de terreno que comparte con su hermano. En años anteriores trabajaba como cobradora de pasajes en el carro que conduce su esposo, sin embargo anhelaba tener su propio negocio, es así, que desde hace  tres años, emprendió la venta de caldo de gallina, de manera ambulatoria, siendo difícil el primer año, ya que lo hacia sola, luego conseguiría un  ayudante, que hasta el día de hoy que cuenta con su apoyo. Desde entonces, Yesica instala su puesto de venta a la 3am, cerca de un paradero de buses, siendo un lugar muy transitado, lo que le da más ventaja en la venta, ya que son mucho los clientes que tiene, en especial los chóferes que van continuamente a su establecimiento, logrando aumentar sus ganancias. Es por ello que se encuentra muy feliz con lo que hace, y espera ahorrar lo necesario para construir su casa y mejora la calidad de vida de hijos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a ser bien responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, asimismo le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, por ser personas muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias cajas de huevos y paquetes de fideos para continuar preparando sus platos suculentos.
texts.en:
Yesica is 35 and unmarried. She lives with the father of her four small children in a house located on a plot of land that is shared with her brother. In previous years, she worked as a ticket collector in a coach operated by her domestic partner. Nonetheless, she dreamt of having her own business. As such, she undertook to sell chicken soup by way of transient sales. The first year was difficult because she was working alone. She later acquired an assistant, whose help she has relied on ever since. Yesica sets up her sales stall at 3 am near a bus stop, a location that receives a lot of traffic and therein an advantage in making more sales. She has many clients, including drivers who regularly come to her establishment and drive up her earnings. She is very happy in this vocation and hopes to save enough to build a house and improve her children's quality of life. This is her 7th loan with Kiva partner MFP and she is ready to be responsible for making her loans payments. She likes to work with her communal finance group, as the members are very supportive. With this loan, she will buy crates of eggs and packets of noodles to continue making her succulent dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs and noodles to prepare chicken soup.

loans.name: Celinda Victoria

texts.es:
Celinda tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus hermanos y una sobrina en el distrito de Zaña, una zona ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Por más de 30 años se ha dedicado a la preparación y venta de dulces típicos y gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante. Ella prepara diversos dulces típicos como turrones de ajonjolí,jaleas, chocotejas y conserva de frutas para venderlos en su establecimiento a los turistas que visitan la zona para observar algunas ruinas coloniales. El negocio es su unica fuente de ingreso por lo que ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para seguir adelante.

Celinda desea ampliar su negocio y empezar a distribuir los productos en otros establecimientos de la zona, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar mas dulces y asi lograr su objetivo.

Celinda es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Celinda, age 62, is single and lives with her brothers and a niece in the Zaña district, an area located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 30 years she has been involved in the preparation and sale of traditional candies, and, thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead.

She makes several types of sweets including turrones de ajonjolí (nougat with sesame seeds), jellies, chocotejas (a candy made from a mixture of chocolate and caramel), and fruit preserves. She sells them in her shop to tourists who visit the area to see some colonial ruins. The business is her only source of income. She tries to improve it so that she can continue to progress.

Celinda wants to enlarge her business and begin distributing her products in other shops in her area. That’s why she has seen the need to apply with Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 new soles. She plans to invest this in the purchase of raw materials for preparing more sweets in order to meet her objective. Celinda is a very hardworking woman who enjoys her work. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her an honorable and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the preparation of sweets.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta  vive en la zona Villa Alemania, ubicada en una zona de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es casada y vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo el cual posee una panadería  ubicada en su mismo domicilio; gracias a sus ahorros lograron adquirir una movilidad de transporte interprovincial la  cual por el trabajo constante requiere reparaciones.

Trabaja  en la venta de pan, que ellos mismos elaboran. 


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de un motor a medio uso y otros repuestos que necesita para el normal funcionamiento de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Vicenta lives in the Villa Alemania region, which is located in an area of the city of El Alto. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband. He has a bakery, which is located in their house. Thanks to their savings they were able to acquire a vehicle for inter-province transportation. It needs repairs because it is constantly used. She works selling bread that they both make. The loan is to buy a used motor and other replacement parts that they need for the normal functioning of their vehicle. It is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor and other replacement parts for the minibus they bought for inter-province transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wooden planks

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuerza está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que en búsqueda de un mejor futuro laboran incansablemente y aprovechan cada oportunidad para crecer como personas. Tal es e caso del proceso de capacitación y formación que ofrece Adim donde según comentaron es un espacio en el que pueden  aprender y relacionarse con las otras beneficiarias lo cual les ha ayudado mucho. 

La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Ana Julia R. quien desde hace diez años vende gaseosas, cosméticos, bisutería y piñatas entre otros productos. R. de 33 años  casada y con tres hijos de 12, 8 y 7 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio sueña con poner una pulpería ya que su lugar de origen no hay de este tipo de comercio por los alrededores.

Mientras la señora María Bertha A. se dedica a comercializar todo tipo de productos en el mercado  esta según comento  inicio vendiendo chicha donde un cuñado pero con el tiempo y nos unos pequeños ahorros instalo su propio negocio. Su otra compañera Raquel del Socorro Barrios Vazquez vende yoltamal, atol, arroz de leche, güirilas entre otros postres tradicionales a base especialmente de maíz. 
 Ellas invertirán el crédito para acrecentar sus negocios con la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de productos o materia prima.
texts.en:
The group "Fuerza" is made up of three enterprising women in search of a better future. They work incesantly and take advantage of every personal growth opportunity. Such is the case with the training process that is offered by Adim and where they feel they can learn and relate to other women, which has help them a lot. The coordinator for this group is Mrs.Ana Julia R. who has been selling soft drinks, cosmetics, trinkets, and piñatas among other products. R. is 33 years old, is married, and has three children aged 12, 8, and 7 who help her with her business. She dreams of starting a small grocery store since there are none where she lives. Meanwhile, Mrs. María Bertha A. works selling different products in the market. She started selling chicha at her brother in law's but with time and some savings she started her own business. Her other partner Raquel del Socorro Barrios Vazquez sells yoltamal, atol, rice pudding, güirilas among other traditional desserts made from corn. They will invest the proceeds from the loan to grow their businesses by purchasing more and better products and ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, cosmetics, trinkets, and piñatas

loans.name: Marietou Tabaski

texts.fr: Madame Marietou Tabaski F. habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle est agee de 40 ans et évolue  dans le commerce et la vente de vaisselles. Elle capitalise une expérience  de 5 ans dans son activité. Elle gère  un magasin situe juste à cote de la caisse de l’U- IMCEC Camberene ou elle expose ses ustensiles de cuisine. Elle sollicite  un crédit de 150 000 frs en vue de renforcer son magasin en activité marchandises. L’élargissement de son  lui permettra de mieux subvenir a ses besoins sociaux, car elle est mariée et mère  d’un enfant de 3 ans. Madame F. est sociétaire de la caisse de Camberene depuis septembre 2009.
texts.en:
Ms. Marietou Tabaski F. lives in the town of Camberene. She is 40 years old and works in the business of selling dishes. She capitalizes on five years of experience in her work. She manages a store located right next to the U-IMCEC Camberene credit association where she displays her kitchen utensils. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for enhancing her store with merchandise. This expansion will enable her to meet her societal needs better, since she is married and the mother of a 3-year-old child. Ms. F. has been a member of the Camberene branch since September 2009.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Dávila Group

texts.es:
El grupo D. está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras e innovadoras las cuales se dedican al comercio de cosechas. Una de ellas es Meyling Francisca D. R. de 25 años la cual desde el 2005 compra y venta de cosechas actividad que ha ido creciendo; ya que con los préstamos puede según mencionó copra mayor cantidad de producto y obtiene mejores precios.

Sus compañeros de grupo son  Ervin S. M. y Milagros de Jesús D. quienes como se menciona anteriormente desde hace tiempo se dedican también a este tipo de comercio. Estos invertirán en la compra de producciones de  tamarindo y mangos.

Por otra parte cabe mencionar que ellos han sido participes de la oferta no financiera de Adim, es decir del proceso de capacitación y formación sobre género y desarrollo empresarial. En este según comentaron aprendieron a administrar sus negocios de manera más efectiva  y hubo un intercambio de viviendas  e ideas de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
The group "D." is made up of three hardworking and innovative peope who work selling crops. One of these people is Meyling Francisca D. R. who is 25 years old and who has been buying and selling crops since 2005. With the loans she obtains she can purchase a greater quantity and get better prices. Her fellow group members are Ervin S. M. y Milagros de Jesús D. who, as previoulsy mentioned, have been working for a long time in this kind of trade. They plan to invest in the purchase of tamarind and mango. It is also worth mentioning that they have participated in the non-financial arm of Adim, that is, in the training offered on business development. They mentioned that is how they learned how to manage their businesses more effectively and where they received useful ideas.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetables in season

loans.name: G. Lazare

texts.fr: Né en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. G. Lazare est marié et père de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Lazare vit depuis 5 ans à Sèkandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Lazare a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis trois ans, afin de faire face à ses différentes charges, Lazare vend des produits congelés (poissons, ailerons, etc.) à son domicile. La clientèle de Lazare s’accroît au jour le jour et il n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients. C’est pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire les nombreuses demandes de sa clientèle, que Lazare sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mr. H. G. Lazare is married and the father of three children, who are all in school. He has been living for five years in Sèkandji, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, with his family. The couple jointly ensure that their various family expenses are covered. Lazare halted his studies in secondary school. For three years, in order to cover his various expenses, he has been selling frozen foods (fish, wings, etc.) out of his home. His customer base grows from day to day, and he is no longer able to satisfy all of his customers. To bolster his business and to satisfy the numerous demands of his customers, Lazare is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying frozen foods (fish, wings, etc.)

loans.name: Women Of Progress Group

texts.en: For 12 years, Joeana D. has been selling dried fish at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. She is 40 years old, married, and has seven children, age 2 to 22 years old. Joeana also cares for a sibling. She did not have the opportunity to go to school because her parents refused to send her. Joeana sells good quality dried fish and and talks to her customers in a nice manner which keeps them returning. Joeana plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more fish. Her goal is to expand sales to other markets within Paynesville. Joeana is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Women of Progress". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Joeana is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Jardines De Paz Group

texts.es:
Milagro del Socorro P. José, Felipa de los Ángeles Vivas y Alba Luz P. son tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que conforman al grupo Jardines de Paz. La coordinadora de este agrupación es la señora P. José de 56 años quien en 2003 invirtió sus ahorros en ropa y calzado. Ella es ese tiempo compro pequeñas cantidades actualmente con los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo y puede adquirir mayor mercadería.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Alba Luz P. quien en empleó su liquidación en el comercio de ropa interior y Felipa V. la cual en 2006 decidió poner su propio negocio que es una tortillería y rellenitas esta en un comienzo era poca la producción hoy en día seis medios de maíz diarios.
texts.en:
Milagro del Socorro P. José, Felipa de los Ángeles Vivas y Alba Luz P. are three hardworking and enterprising women who make up the group Jardines de Paz. The coordinator for this group is Mrs.P. José who is 56 years old and who invested her savings in the purchase of clothing and shoes in 2003. At the time, she purchased a small quantity but currently, thanks to loans, her business has been growing and she has been purchasing more merchandise. Her fellow group members are Alba Luz P. , who works selling undergarments, and Felipa V. who started her own business in 2006 selling corn-base food like tortillas and "rellenitas". She prepared a small quantity in the beginning but now uses a much greater quantity of corn daily.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Sébastienne

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, O. Sébastienne vit depuis 18 ans environs à PK12, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Sébastienne est mariée à DJOSSOU Paul, un mécanicien auto et est mère de six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Sébastienne a un autre enfant à charge. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Sébastienne n'a pas féquenté l'école. Depuis près de 15 ans, Sébastienne mène comme activité, la vente de boissons et divers produits cosmétiques au marché Dégakon à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sébastienne s'approvisionne. Sébastienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié auparavant de deux crédits, qu'elle a bien remboursés. Sébastienne sollicite un autre crédit, afin d'agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. O. Sébastienne has been living for about eighteen years in PK12, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. She is married to Mr. DJOSSOU Paul, an auto mechanic, and is the mother of six children, some of whom are in school. The family lives together, and the couple jointly ensure that house expenses are covered. Sébastienne never attended school. For nearly fifteen years, she has been running a business selling beverages and a variety of cosmetics at the Dégakon market in Cotonou. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having benefited before from two loans, which she has repaid. She's requesting another loan in order to expand her business further and to respond better to the numerous demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying drinks, liquor, and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es: La señora Maria Felicita tiene varios créditos con Fundación, por lo que su experiencia no es la primera vez. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, ya que esa era una excelente fecha para aprovechar a vender más. Aduce que el crédito ha influido positivamente en su negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que este se ha ampliado considerablemente, gracias en parte a que la señora es buena ahorradora y ha reinvertido la mayoría de las ganancias por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan entre otras cosas. Por lo que siempre sueña con mejorar su actividad.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Felicita has had several loans with Fundación; so this experience isn’t her first. Her business is a small general store, and the loans were an excellent way for her to profit by selling more.

She says that the loans have had a positive influence on her business. She has always worked very hard to increase her earnings. These have grown considerably thanks, in part, to the fact that the lady is very thrifty and has reinvested most of her earnings.

This financing is for working capital that will be used for the purchase of sweets, soft drinks, juices and bread, among other things. She has always dreamed of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy healing products

loans.name: Kany

texts.fr: Madame Kany G. habite Camberene. Elle est âgée de 49 ans et a adhéré  a la caisse depuis aout 2009. Elle évolue  dans le commerce et vend des légumes  au marche de Camberene. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs pour renforcer son commerce. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices  lui permettra de mieux participer a la gestion des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs.Kany G. lives in Camberene. She is 49 years old and a member of the credit union since August 2009. Her business is selling vegetables at the Camberene market. She is seeking a loan of 250,000 West African Franks in order to boost her business. An increased revenue will allow her to take better care of the family budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing business capital

loans.name: Casa Hamaqueras Group

texts.es:
El grupo la “Casa de las Hamaqueras” está integrado por  tres mujeres trabajadoras las cuales se dedican a la fabricación de hamacas o su material desde muy pequeñas. Las familias de estas han laborado en ello desde  hace siglos. Este producto artesanal es de gran trayectoria y demanda en Nicaragua por su gran variedad de estilos y colores por ser versátiles, livianas, transportables, cómodas, económicas, duraderas y vistosas.

La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora  Evangelina  L. Gonzales quien elabora y vende manila artesanal la cual es utilizada especialmente para la elaboración de hamacas. El negocio en sus inicios era pequeño y no contaban con suficiente  productos ya que no disponía de capital para invertir. Este en la actualidad ha ido aumentando y con el préstamo lo surtirá con más colores e hilos. 

Las otras integrantes son Amalia V. y Ana S. quienes realizan hamacas desde hace años según comentaron el inicio de su negocio fue difícil ya que no contaban con recursos necesarios hoy en día este ha mejorado significativamente.
texts.en:
The group "Casa de las Hamaqueras" is composed of three hard working women who have been making hammocks and hammock material since they were very little. Their families have worked in this industry for centuries. This artisan product has an important history and is in high demand in Nicaragua because of the variety of styles and colors making hammocks versatile, light, transportable, comfortable, economic, durable and pleasant to look at. The coordinator of this group is señora Evangelina L. Gonzales who makes and sells the thick yarn which is used for making hammocks. At first, when the business was small, without available capital to invest, they didn't have enough products. Now, it has grown, and with the loan they are requesting they'll be able to offer more colors and thread. The other members are Amalia V. and Ana S. who have been making hammocks for years. They say that at the beginning, running a business was hard since they didn't have the necessary resources, but today it has significantly improved.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Colored thread

loans.name: Geremias

texts.es:
Geremias tiene 44 años D. edad, es separado y vive junto a sus tres hijos en L. ciudad D. Chepén, perteneciente a L. provincia del mismo nombre, en L. región L. Libertad. Ubicada a una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace quince años se dedica a L. reparación y mantenimiento D. llantas y neumáticos D. todo tipo D. vehículos (servicio D. vulcanizado). Este negocio es L. unica fuente D. ingreso por lo que siempre da todo D. si para salir adelante. El establecimiento queda ubicado en los exteriores del mercado D. L. ciudad D. Chepén y cuenta con todos los permisos para su funcionamiento.

Geremias desea adquirir unos repuestos y dale mantenimiento a las máquinas que utiliza D. modo que pueda realizar su trabajo D. un modo mas eficaz. Por ello se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Geremias es una persona muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos, ellos dan buenas referencias D. el y lo consideran una persona bastante responsable, trabajadora y que siempre da todo D. si para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Geremis is 44 years old. He is separated and lives with his three children in the city of Chepén. Chepén belongs to the province of the same name, in the L. Libertad region, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For fifteen years he has worked at the repair and maintenance of wheels and tires of all types of vehicles. This business is his only source of income because he puts all his effort into it. His business site is located outsiD. of the Chepén city market and has all the permits that are required. Geremias wants to purchase some spare parts and service his business machinery in order to work more efficiently. For this reason, he realized the need to request for the first time a loan of $700 from Edpyme Alternativa. Geremias is well-known and respected by his neighbors and acquaintances. They give him good references and consider him very responsible, hard-working, and a man who gives everything to his business and the hope of greater prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and maintenance of equipment to improve his tire repair business

loans.name: François

texts.fr: Né en 1976, D. François vit depuis 6 ans environs à Tchonvi dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. François est marié et est père de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. François vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. C'est François qui assure l'essentiel des charges de la famille. François n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a près de 12 ans, afin de répondre aux exigences de sa famille, François achète et vend divers produits électroniques (ampoules, fils électriques, postes téléviseurs, etc.) à son domicile. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que François achète ses produits. C'est la première fois que François sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, Mr. D. François has lived for six about years in Tchonvi in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin.  He is married and the father of three children, some of whom are in school.  He lives together with his children and wife.  François is the one who covers the bulk of family expenses. François did not attend school.  For nearly the last twelve years, in order to meet the requirements of his family, he has been buying and selling various electronic products (light bulbs, wiring, TV sets, etc.) out of his home.  He buys his goods from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  This is the first time François is requesting a loan from ALIDé for bolstering his business and coping better with customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical wire, light bulbs, DVDs, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 34 years old, a single mother of three children aged 11, 14 and 17 years. She takes care of her family in a rented house which holds five people in all.  She aims to complete her house and educate her children. She operates a salon in Hoima town, Uganda, a business she has operated for 10 years now, having started plaiting hair with no premises. She has a dream of expanding her salon to higher standards so as to keep up with competition. The purpose of the loan funds is to buy cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: cosmetics for a beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cow hides

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD”

La Alcancía Comunal “SANTISIMA TRINIDAD” trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más D. 1 año y medio, esta formada por mujeres dinámicas y solidarias que tratan D. apoyar a sus amigas y familiares en todo lo que puedan, así como la señora Catalina D. 41 años y 2 hijos, D. los cuales solo el mayor es independiente, ella también cría a su hermanita D. 4 años como si fuera una hija mas en su hogar.
Catalina se dedica a la creación y venta D. joyería por más D. un año, su sobrina le recomendó ese negocio, le enseñó y capacito en la creación D. pulseras, collares, etc. ella trabaja en una tienda, junto con un artesano D. joyería, donD. exhibe y venD. sus productos.
Catalina sueña con tener una tienda propia y terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Savings group "Santisima Trinidad"

The savings group "Santisima Trinidad" has been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than a year and a half. It is comprised of dynamic, supportive women who try to help their friends and relatives every way that they can. For instance, Catalina is 41 years old and has two kids of whom only the oldest has left home. She also looks after her 4 year old little sister as though she were one more daughter in her home.

Catalina has been making and selling jewelry for more than a year. Her niece recommended this business to her and taught her to make bracelets, necklaces, etc. She works in a store where she exhibits and sells her products along with another jewelry artisan.

Catalina dreams of having her own store and of finishing building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Julia Balbina

texts.es:
La señora Julia A. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad  San Miguel, en la parroquia El Valle ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta localidad  es reconocida por su importante producción de maíz, y por sus atractivos turisticos como las lagunas de Chochapamba llenas de Totoras.

Julia  tiene 61 años de edad se divoció hace 25 años porque su esposo bebia mucho, con él procreo tres hijos que se encuentran de 42, 33, 26 años ellos ya son casados e independientes pero vive con 12 nietos quienes le hacen compañía, tres de ellos ya trabjan, y sólo tres nietos de los doce estan a su cargo porque su madre viajó al exterior en busca de un mejor porvenir,  los nietos restantes viven con sus padres pero siempre le hacen compañia,  su vivienda es propia por lo que vive tranquila.

Julia es negociante de frutas, granos tiernos y hortalizas, labora en esta actividad hace 30 años, anteriormente contaba con su puesto propio pero debido a su avanzada edad ha tenido que venderlo y  ahora labora solo los días miércoles y sábados y el resto de la semana se dedica a su casa, también  nos comenta que tenia una tienda pero la cerró por falta de tiempo pero esta pensando en reabrirla.

Se encuentra ocho años trabajando con los créditos de la fundación y éstos le  han beneficiando en sus negocios, con el nuevo crédito  va a  comprar  cerdos y alimento  para engordarlos y venderlos  y tiene como meta montar nuevamente su tienda de viveres.
texts.en:
La señora Julia A. is a member of the communal bank Los Talvos. She lives in the San Miguel community, El Valle parish, which is located southeast of the city of Cuena. This area is known for its important production of corn and its tourist attractions such as the Chochapamba lakes full of bulrushes. Julia is 61 years old. She divorced 25 years ago because her husband drank a great deal. She had three children with her husband, and they are now 42, 33, and 26 years old. They are married and independent, but Julia has 12 grandchildren who always keep her company. Three of the grandchildren already work, and only three are in her care because their mother left the country in search of a better future. The rest of the grandchildren live with their parents but always spend time with their grandmother. Her dwelling is her own, which makes her life calm and peaceful. Julia has sold fruits, fresh grains, and vegetables for 30 years. She had her own sales site, but because of her age she had to sell it. Now she only works Wednesdays and Saturdays, and the rest of the week is spent in her house. She also told us that she had a store but she closed it because she couldn't spend enough time in it. Nevertheless, she is thinking of reopening it. She has borrowed money from the foundation over the last eight years, which money helped her business. With this new loan, she will buy pigs and food to fatten them. Then she will sell them. Her goal is to reopen her supply store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and pig food

loans.name: Youth For Progress Group

texts.en: Pervis G. currently attends nursing school. He is 30 years old, single, and has three children, ages 3-14 years old. For four years, Pervis has been selling phone recharge cards at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to purchase more recharge cards. His goal is to expand and improve his business. Pervis is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Youth For Progress". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Pervis is on the left. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards

loans.name: Arona

texts.fr: Monsieur Arona D. est un jeune couturier qui habite a Camberene. Il exerce ce métier  depuis plus de 7 ans. Il expose et vend sur commande. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de garniture pour confectionner ses commandes. L’acquisition de ce crédit lui permettra de mieux  gérer  ses commandes et accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Arona D. is a young clothier who lives in Camberene. He has been in this business for over seven years. He displays and sells his products by special order. Arona is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for buying trim for fulfilling his orders. Acquiring this loan will enable him to manage his orders better and to grow his profit margin.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing

loans.name: Amada Liliana

texts.es:
Amada tiene 25 años de edad, es una madre de familia separada y vive junto a sus dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad, en el sector Villa Los Martires de la ciudad de Chepén, en la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus pequeñas hizo que empezara a trabajar como obrera agrícola. Ella trabaja en labores asociadas al campo en diversos cultivos de la zona y lo que gana lo utiliza para el mantenimiento de sus menores hijas. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano hasta muy avanzada la tarde, sus hijas quedan al cuidado de su abuela mientras ella se encuentra trabajando.

Amada desea brindarles a sus hijas la oportunidad de irse formando desde pequeñas en una Institución educativa especializada en el cuidado y educación de niños menores, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para adquirir los materiales y utiles que se le solicitan al momento del ingreso de sus hijas a la Institución, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Amada es una mujer responsable y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es esforzarse para darle lo mejor a sus menores hijas. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y la consideran una mujer de confianza. En la imagen aparece junto a sus hijas, su motivación para esforzarse diariamente.
texts.en:
Amada is 25 years old, the mother of a separated family, and living with her two daughters aged 5 and 3. They reside in the Villa Los Martires (The Martyrs) sector of Chepén City, Chepén Province, in the La Libertad (The Liberty) region, an hour from the capital of the Lambayeque region, Chiclayo. The need to advance her little ones led her to begin working in agriculture. She labors at rural tasks in the zone's various crops, and what she earns she uses to maintain her minor daughters. Her work begins very early and continues until very late in the afternoon. Her daughters remain in the care of their grandmother while she is at work. Amada wishes to offer her daughters the opportunity to continue their education while they are very little in an educational institution specializing in the care and education of minor chldren. But she lacks sufficient capital to afford the means and materials required upon her daughters' entry into school. For that reason, she is applying for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 400 New Sols to help her achieve her objective. Amada is a woman who is dedicated and responsible for her family. Her greatest wish is to exert herself to give her minor daughters the best. Her neighbors and those who know her have much esteem for her and consider her a woman worthy of confidence. In the picture she appears beside her daughters, the motivation for her daily efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING UNIFORMS AND MATERIALS FOR THE EDUCATION OF HER DAUGHTERS

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, M. Delphine est mariée à AKISSOE Jérémie, un peintre, et est mère de deux enfants. Delphine a un autre enfant à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Delphine s'est installée à Agongo, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Delphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Delphine vend divers produits (liqueurs, lait, piles, bougies, café, sachets, conserves, couscous, mayonnaise, sucre, farine de manioc, etc.) au marché Abattoir à l'entrée de Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Delphine achète ses produits. Delphine exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits de ALIDé. Delphine désire rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et satisfaire un peu plus sa clientèle. C'est donc pour renforcer son capital et augmenter son stock de produits que Delphine sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. M. Delphine is married to Mr. AKISSOE Jérémie, a painter, and is the mother of two children.  She has another child to support.  Some of the children are in school.  About ten years ago, Delphine settled in Agongo, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, with her family.  The couple jointly ensure that their various family expenses are covered. Delphine never attended school.  To meet her needs, she sells a variety of goods (liquor, milk, batteries, candles, coffee, small plastic bags, canned foods, couscous, mayonnaise, sugar, cassava flour, etc.) at the Abattoir market at the entry to Cotonou.  She buys her goods from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for seven years and has already had five ALIDé loans.  She would like to enhance further the level of her work and to satisfy her customers a bit more.  Delphine is therefore requesting another loan for boosting her capital and increasing her stock of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying liquor and various goods (canned foods, couscous, sugar, milk, batteries, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Maria Elizabeth tiene 22 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene una excelente experiencia. Pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos con su hijo.  Por lo que su actividad económica le ha brindado lo necesario y necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes, colonias. Ella sueña  en el futuro tener una actividad más sólida con mejores ingresos, lo cual para ella seria en establecer una tienda en su lugar de habitación para no tener que dejar a su hijo al salir a ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Srta. Maria Elizabeth is 22 years old. She operates a business selling general merchandise, work for which she has long experience. She is always looking for ways to improve her income so that she can better raise her son. The business has allowed her to provide him with the things he needs. She will use the loan to buy stocks of underwear, cosmetics, perfumes and colognes. Her greatest wish for the future is to have a more reliable source of income, a store that she can operate at home so that she doesn't have to leave her son while she goes out to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly tiene de 53 años,  es casada, y tiene tres hijos, siendo los dos mayores independientes y con familias, quedándose con el último, quien junto a su esposo viven en su casa que es propia. Desde hace mucho años se dedicaba a la venta de pescados  y mariscos, negocio que le ha ido bien, sin embargo cayó enferma, dejando así éste negocio. Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzados en el mercado de su barrio, por lo que ya lleva 7 años en esta actividad. Poco a poco fue ganando clientela,  dando como resultado buena ganancias, debido a la diversidad de prendas que posee. Es así que desde las 11.00am  de la mañana hasta las 3.00pm de la tarde, trabaja sin parar, y en donde su hijo la apoya los fines de semana. Ella está muy contenta con lo que hace, ya que esto le servirá de sostén para su familia y por ello desea en el futuro ampliar su negocio, para generarle más ganancias. Este será su 24 crédito con MFP, a la vez dice sentirse cómoda con los miembros de su grupo comunal por ser personas muy responsables. Entretanto con el crédito que solicita, comprará zapatos para colegiales, por estar en temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Merly, 53, is married and has three children, two of whom are married and independent. She lives with a daughter and son-in-law in a house that she owns. For many years, Merly operated a business selling fish and other seafood, a business that she knows well but had to leave when she became ill. For the past 7 years, she's made a living in her local market selling clothing and footwear. Little by little, she's built a customer base. Her earnings have climbed because she can offer a wide variety of merchandise. She works non-stop from 11:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon. Her son helps her on weekends. She is very happy with the business because it has helped to support her family and, in the future, she wants to expand it and increase her income even more. This will be her 24th MFP loan. She says that she is very comfortable with the other members of her community bank because she considers them responsible. She will use the loan to buy school shoes for the new school year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel N. es maestra de secundaria, es casada, tiene dos niños menores los dos en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para construcción de su casa compra de materiales como arena, cemento, bloque, hierro y cerámica y si los crédito que ha tenido con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido lograr poco a poco la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Raquel N. is a high-school teacher. She is married and has two school-age children. Raquel is requesting a loan for construction work in her house. She would like to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, concrete blocks, and ceramics. The prior loans from Ceprodel have been a great help, and little by little have allowed Raquel to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sand and cement for construction of an additional room

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: G. Tété est née le 14 Juin 1967 à Pobè dans le département de l'Ouémé. Tété vit depuis 25 ans au quartier Agbokou, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à KOYE Noel, Tété est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Tété a un autre enfant à charge. Tété vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Tété n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis 24 ans environs, Tété mène comme activité la vente de fagots de bois au marché de Agbokou, une activité qui lui génère des revenus lui permettant d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. C'est à Adjarra, à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, que Tété s'approvisionne. Tété est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Tété sollicite un autre prêt afin d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Tété G. was born 14 June 1967 in Pobé in the Ouémé Department. For the past 25 years she has lived in the Agbokou neighborhood, in the second borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Noel KOYE, Tete is mother of six children, who have all attended (or are attending) school. She herself has only attended school at the primary level. She also takes care of another child, and lives together with her husband and children. The couple shares responsibility for family expenses. Tete has been selling bundles of wood at the Agbokou market for approximately 24 years. This revenue-generating activity ensures her family’s needs are met. She gets her supplies from Adjarra, a few kilometers from Porto-Novo. Tete is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted two loans that were correctly reimbursed. Faced with increasing requests from her customers, she is applying for another loan so that she can increase her stock supply and better meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood bundles wholesale

loans.name: Mary Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mary Mercedes tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, los cuales están a su cargo. La señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella trabaja con la Avon, con Zermat, además de esto, ella para obtener precios más baratos viaja al mercado de Managua a comprar mercadería. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 6 años esto fue con el propósito de obtener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, ya que en ese tiempo se acababa de separar de su esposo. Con el tiempo ha ido ahorrando y ha establecido un buen negocio, gracias a sus clientes que nunca le han fallado a sus pagos. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 con el propósito de realizar compras de productos Avon, ya que es ahora cuando tiene bastantes encargos de artículos, por la época de verano y las vacaciones que se acercan. Es importante mencionar que la señora realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante distribuyéndoles a sus clientes los encargos, por lo que su deseo es establecer una tienda en su casa de habitación para que sus clientes puedan acercarse confiadamente a buscar los productos que deseen.
texts.en:
Sra. Mary Mercedes, 36, is married and has two children, 8- and 10-years old, both in her care. Mary Mercedes makes a living selling cosmetics, working with Avon and Zermat products, among others. To get the best prices, she goes to a market in Managua. She started the business 6 years ago because she needed a source of income to support her children after she separated from her husband. Over time, she has saved up and, thanks to customers who are diligent about paying her, she now has an established business. She is applying for a loan from Fundacion Leon 2000 so that she can stock up on Avon products, merchandise that will be much in demand now that summer and summer vacations are coming. It's important to mention that Mary Mercedes works as a street vendor now, but she would like to set up a store in her house so that her customers can easily find her to buy the products that they want.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hada Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Hada Luz N. es comerciante, es casada tiene tres, dos de ellos están casado con ella vive solo una hija que aun no está casada y es su brazo derecho es la que la apoya bastante en este negocio, el dinero lo solicita para capital de trabajo compra de granos básicos como azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón y cosméticos. Los créditos le han ayudado mucho  ya que ha crecido más en su negocio y ahora tiene más utilidades.
texts.en:
Hada Luz N. is a shopkeeper. She's married and has three children, two of whom are married, so only one daughter lives with her. She is still single and is her mother's right arm. She supports her significantly with the business. Hada Luz is requesting the money for working capital with which they will buy basic supplies such as sugar, rice, oil, soap and cosmetics. Loans have helped Hada Luz very much, so that now her business has grown and is more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic supplies for sale in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: La señora Rosa Isabel es casada, tiene 40 años de edad y posee dos hijos de 13 y 17 años de edad respectivamente, los cuales aun viven con ella y están estudiando ambos en secundaria. La señora es dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, pese a que también en su casa ofrece la mercadería. Ella también elabora comida los fines de semana para vender en su casa, además de esto también realiza destace de cerdos en su casa. Ella inicio con este negocio primeramente trabajando en una zona franca, allí comenzó a venderles a sus compañeras de trabajo las mercaderías de ropa hasta que se dio cuenta que el negocio era rentable y decidió dedicarse solamente a esto. Ella viaja a Managua, a comprar las mercancías para distribuirlas luego. Trabaja por pedidos, es decir que cuando tiene una buena cantidad de pedidos es que viaja a comprar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa nueva, con el objetivo de ofrecer nueva mercancías y capitalizar su negocio. Su sueño, es que a través de las ganancias ofrecidas por el negocio pueda brindarles una educación universitaria a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Isabel, 40, is married and has two children, 13- and 17-years old, both in school and both of whom she supports. Rosa Isabela operates a business selling new clothing. Although she normally works as a street vendor, she also sells merchandise from her house. In addition to her clothing business, she makes prepared meals at weekends that she also sells from her house and raises and slaughters pigs. She started the clothing business while working at a job in a free-trade zone, first selling clothing to co-workers and then going on to selling full-time when she found that it was profitable. She travels to Managua to buy merchandise to sell later. She works to order, that is to say that she makes buying trips to Managua when she has a good number of orders. She will use the loan that she is applying for to buy merchandise that she will resell. Her dream is to generate enough income from the business to put her two children through college.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira M.
