S. es profesora de secundaria de un colegio de la zona de san Rafael, es casada y tiene dos hijos ya mayores, el dinero los solicita para la elaboración de un pozo de agua compra de materiales como: bomba de agua, tubería y pago de la mano de obra de la instalación de la bomba y sus tubería ya que en el lugar que ella vive casi no hay agua potable entonces ella requiere de un pozo. Ya ha tenido 13 crédito con nosotros y le han servido muchísimo ya que ella con estos financiamiento construyo su pequeña casa y siempre le está haciendo mejoras.
texts.en:
Yadira M. Sanchez is a junior high school teacher in a school in San Rafael. She's married and has two grown children. She is requesting this money to install a well by purchasing such materials as a water pump and tubing, as well as by hiring the labour for the installation of the pump and tubing. The place where she lives has almost no potable water, so she needs a well. She has had 13 loans with us in the past, which have been very helpful, enabling her to build her little house, and she is always making improvements to it.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a water pump and PVC tubing

loans.name: H. Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. H. Justine est mariée à AHOLOU Marcel, un plombier. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Justine vit depuis 12 ans environs au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Justine n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a près de 15 ans que Justine mène comme activité, la vente de produits cosmétiques (mèches, lotion, savons, lait corporel, etc.) et des cannettes dans sa boutique à Cotonou. Justine achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo, et aussi à Cotonou. Justine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Justine sollicite un autre prêt en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et d'élever le niveau de son activité, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, H. Justine A. is married to Marcel AHOLOU, a plumber. The couple has three children who are all at school. Justine has lived for around 12 years in the Avotrou district of Cotonou with her children and her husband. The couple cover the various family expenses between them. Justine has not been to school. For nearly 15 years she has run a business selling cosmetic products (hairpieces, lotions, soaps, body milk etc.) and canned drinks in her shop in Cotonou. She buys her products in Lomé in Togo, and also in Cotonou. Justine has already had two loans which she has repaid without incident. She is applying for another loan with a view to increasing her stock of products and expanding her business; this will allow her to make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products (body milk, soaps, cream, hairpieces)

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María T. es otra de las socias del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad  San Miguel en la parroquia El  Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser una de las productoras  de maíz y por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y en su mayor parte los jóvenes han migrado a otras ciudades o al extranjero para brindarles un mejor porvenir a sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, chanchos, vacas,  vendiendo sus animales solo cuando tiene alugna necesidad de dinero, también  cultiva sus tierras sembrando principalmente maíz, estas actividades las coordina con la atención en su pequeña tienda de víveres en la que lleva cuarenta años pero no ha crecido porque no sabe administrarla.

Ana María tiene 60 años de edad enviudó hace 12 años porque su difunto esposo tenía un tumor en el cerebro, en su unión conyugal procrearon  diez  hijos de los cuales ocho  ya son casados y viven independientes solo tiene dos hijos solteros que se encuentran de 20 y 17 años que trabajan en construcción ayudando un poco económicamente a su madre, por la noche esutidan en un colegio de la localidad, nos comenta  con mucha nostalgia que su hijo de 20 años tiene una enfermedad que  no saben que es  y como es sola le ayuda comprando los medicamentos cada mes para calmar un poco su enfermedad.

Se encuentra once años trabajando con su banco comunal, con el dinero recibido de los créditos ha solventado los gastos de las recetas de su hijo y otros gastos propios del hogar, con el dinero del nuevo crédito va a  comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal,  jabón, etc., para abastecer su tienda de víveres y tiene como meta dedicarse un poco más a éste negocio para hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Ana Maria Tacun is another member of the Los Talvos community bank. She lives in the San Miguel community in the parish of El Valle. The parish is known for maize production and for the beauty of the surrounding countryside. The majority of its people make a living farming and raising livestock. Many young people have migrated to cities and other countries in the hope that they can help their families secure a better future. Our member makes a living raising animals--chickens, pigs, cattle--that she only sells when she needs money. She also farms her land, growing maize mostly, work that she has done diligently for forty years. The business hasn't grown, though, because she hasn't known how to do it. Ana Maria, 60, has been a widow since her husband died of a brain tumor 12 years ago. She and her husband had ten children, eight of whom are married and independent. The other two, who are 20 and 17 years old, work at construction jobs, helping their mother when they can. They also study at a night school. Ana Maria is worried about her 20 year old son who is ill with no-one knows what and they have to spend money every month to buy the medications they hope can help him. Ana Maria has been a member of her community bank for eleven years. She has used loans to pay for her son's prescriptions and other household expenses. She will use the new loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap, etc. to stock her store. Her goal is to spend more time on the business so that she can expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Nora Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Nora del Socorro C. B. profesora de secundaria, tiene 27 años de ser maestra de educación, soltera, tiene un hijo menor en edad escolar, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como hierro, soldadura y pago de mano de obra, es el sexto crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel y si le han ayudado muchísimo porque solo así ha podido salir adelante con su familia y su casa.
texts.en:
Nora del Socorro C. B. is a high-school teacher. She has 27 year of experience in education. Nora is single; she has a school-age son. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction materials such as iron as well as to pay for labor and welding services. This is her sixth loan with Ceprodel. The previous loans have been a tremendous help since they were the only means to move forward for her family and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone blocks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es: La Sra. Jennifer B. O. es el cuarto crédito con nosotros el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como arena cemento y hierro, dice que los créditos que ha tenido con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha podido lograr todos sus proyectos como de tener un techo digno para su familia. .
texts.en:
Mrs Jennifer B. O. is requesting a third loan with us. The money will be used to purchase construction materials such as sand. cement and iron. She says that the loans that she has had with Ceprodel have been of great help to her, through them she has been able to complete all her projects such as provide a decent home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand and gravel and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es: Yulissa tiene 34 años,  es madre soltera, con dos hijos que mantener y en etapa escolar, por lo que viven juntos en la casa de su abuela. En años anteriores trabajaba como empleada de hogar, pero al quedar embarazada de su segundo hijo dejó su trabajo. Por lo que tuvo que incursionar en la venta de comida rápida, es entonces que vende salchichas y papas fritas, en el exterior de la casa de su abuela, lugar muy transitado de su distrito. Es así que su actividad empieza desde las 5pm de la tarde hasta altas horas de la noche, atendiendo a sus clientes, mientras prepara las frituras que le piden. En este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo Carlos, de 15 años, quien la ayuda a pelar  las papas y cargar el paquete de gaseosas a su stand. Su afán inmediato es extender su negocio, es por ello que quiere comprar cajas de cervezas, para aumentar sus ganancias. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, asimismo espera integrarse a su grupo comunal, y contar con nuevos créditos futuros. Con los mil soles que solicita, se comprará sillas y cervezas, para incrementar sus ingresos que le serán muy útiles para sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Yulissa is 34 years old, a single mother with 2 children of school age to care for. They live together in her grandmother's house. In previous years she worked as a housekeeper, but when she became pregnant with her second child she left her work. Because of that the had to go into selling fast food, like sausages and fried potatoes outside her house which is in a well traveled part of the district. Her work starts at 5 PM of the afternoon and goes until the late hours of the evenings, attending her clients while she prepares the fried foods they request. In her work she counts on the help of the son Carlos, of 15 years, who helps her to peel the potatoes and load the packet of soft drinks onto her stand. Her immediate enthusiasm is to expand her business and it is for that reason that she wants to buy cases of beer to increase her earnings. This is her first credit with MFP, for which she agrees to make all her payments punctually, as well as to integrate herself into the communal group and look forward to new credits in the future. With the 2000 soles she requests she will buy chairs and beer to increase her income which will be very useful to maintain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs and beer

loans.name: Sidonie

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Atchoukpa à Avrankou, dans le département de l'Ouémé, D. Sidonie vit depuis 9 ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Sidonie est mariée à MISSIKPODE Barnabé, un revendeur, et est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. La famille vit ensemble à Ekpè et le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Sidonie n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Sidonie mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, piles, savons, huile de palme, tomates fraîches, oignons, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sidonie achète ses produits. Sidonie a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Sidonie envisage renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande des clients. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Sidonie sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé pour rehausser son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Atchoukpa, Avrankou in the "département" (administrative district) of Ouémé, Sidonie D. has lived for the past nine years in Ekpè, in the municipality of Sèmè-Pödji. Sidonie is married to Barnabé MISSIKPODE, a retailer, and is mother to two children, one of whom is at school. The family lives together in Ekpè and the couple cover the various expenses between them. Sidonie has never been to school. For around ten years she has run a business selling various products (pasta, batteries, soaps, palm oil, fresh tomatoes, onions etc.) from home. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Sidonie has had one loan from ALIDé and repaid it without problem. She is planning to strengthen her business and to meet customer demand more readily. In view of her limited financial means, she is looking for financial support from ALIDé in order to increase her activity.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (pasta, cans of palm oil, fresh tomatoes etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy welding material

loans.name: Vicente Agrecio

texts.es:
Vicente Págalo de 53 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es viudo con 2 hijos. 
 
Vicente comenzó como empleado de un almacén de calzado haciendo zapatos, zapatillas, cuando lo despidieron el decidió que la mejor forma de tener sus propios ingresos era teniendo su propio negocio de calzado. 

Cumplio su meta hace 30 años atrás siendo zapatero y teniendo su local pequeño. Trabaja desde las 07:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm todos los días. El hace zapatos pero también los arregla. Con el préstamo quiere comprar almidón, suelas, espuma por metro para elaborar más zapatos. 

Vicente quiere en un futuro tener un local grande con maquinas industriales y tener empleados que le ayuden con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Vicente P., 53 years old, lives in a peri-urban area on the perimeter of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has all basic services. He is a widower with two children. Vicente started out working for a shoe store, making shoes and sneakers. When he was let go, he decided that the best way to ensure his own income was to have his own shoe business. He reached his goal 30 years ago, becoming a shoemaker and maintaining a small shop. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day. He makes shoes but also repairs them. With the loan, he wants to buy starch, soles, and foam to produce more shoes. In the future, Vicente wants to have a large shop with industrial machines and employees to help him with the work.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Starch, soles, foam

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “SAN RAFAEL”

“SAN RAFAEL” es una alcancía comunal que trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más D. un año y medio, esta formado por 11 mujeres carismáticas, una D. ellaS es L. señora Luisa que tiene 68 años D. edad y ha logrado demostrar una gran determinación a través D. su vida, elL. nos cuenta que está felizmente casada con su pareja, él se dedica a L. construcción civil, con quien tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes.
Luisa tiene un taller D. corte y confección D. ropa, cuenta con empleados para los procesos D. fabricación y es elL. quien se encarga D. supervisar el negocio, que le trae ingresos según los pedidos que tenga.
Al tener una casa amplia tomó L. idea D. poner el primer piso en alquiler, así que recibe un ingreso mensual fijo, también cuenta con un auto el cual alquiL. para tener un mayor ingreso mensual fijo.
Los planes D. Luisa son los D. comprar una combi para dedicarlo a L. movilidad escolar, y L. D. construir su tercer piso así también ponerlo en alquiler.
texts.en:
The San Rafael Community Bank has worked with Kiva partner Edaprospo-Prosperidad for more than a year and a half. The group consists of eleven charismatic women. One of them is 68-year old Sra. Luisa who has shown great determination throughout her life. She is happily married to her husband who works in civil construction. They have four children who live independently. Luisa has a dressmaking business. Her staff do the actual sewing while Luisa herself supervises the work. The amount of money she earns depends on the orders she gets. Once her house was built, she decided to rent out the first floor so she would get a fixed amount of rental income each month. She also has a car that she rents out to earn more money. Luisa would like to buy a combi van to use to transport students to school, and also to construct a third floor on her house to rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: A. Agnès est née le 23 Janvier 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DJOUDA Francis, un enseignant, Agnès est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Agnès vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis sept ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Agnès a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Agnès mène comme activité la vente de boissons alcoolisées et de sucreries à Sèkandji. Agnès s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Agnès avait obtenu un prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Agnès envisage rehausser le niveau de son activité et reconstituer son stock de produits, afin d'accroître sa clientèle et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est pourquoi Agnès sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Agnès A. was born on 23rd January 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Francis DJOUDA, a teacher, Agnes is mother to two children, one of whom is at school. Agnès has lived together with her children and her husband in Sèkandi in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji for the past seven years. The couple covers the various family expenses between them. Agnès left school at secondary level. For almost five years she has been running a business selling alcoholic drinks and sweets in Sèkandji. She gets her supplies in Cotonou. Having had a loan which she repaid without incident, Agnès is planning to increase her level of activity and to rebuild her stock of products, in order to expand her customer base and increase her turnover. It is for this reason that she is applying for a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic drinks and sweets

loans.name: E. Germain

texts.fr: Né en 1986 à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé, D. E. Germain vit depuis près de 16 ans à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Germain est célibataire et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Germain vit donc seul et assure seul ses différentes charges. Germain a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la patisserie. En effet, depuis trois ans, Germain fabrique et vend des gâteaux faits à base de farine de blé. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Germain achète ses matières premières. Germain voudrait renforcer son activité et produire davantage de gâteaux afin de se faire plus de clients et plus de revenus. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1986 in Dangbo in the "département" (administrative district) of Ouémé, E. Germain D. has lived for almost 16 years in Sèkandji in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. He is single and has no children yet. He therefore lives alone and covers his various expenses himself. Germain left school during secondary level and afterwards learned the art of "patisserie" or confectionery. In fact, for the past three years, he has been making and selling cakes made from wheat flour. He gets his basic products at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Germain would like to strengthen his business and produce more cakes in order to get more customers and make more money. It is for this reason that he is applying to ALIDé for a first loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bagsof wheat flour to make cakes

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, tiene 42 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos (Ingrid y Gonzalo), él pertenece al banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde confecciona nacimientos de navideños de tipo cusqueño, él distribuye sus productos a los centros comerciales y a las tiendas de artesanías. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio cuenta que las ventas han bajado hasta un  60&#xpo;r falta de turismo. Cesar requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo, esmaltes, pinturas. El anhelo del socio Cesar es implementar una tienda de abarrotes. El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
42-year old Cesar is married and has two children (Ingrid and Gonzalo). He is a member of the Arariwa Association’s Sacsayhuaman Community Bank. Cesar has a small workshop in his house where he makes Christmas ornaments typical of the Cusco region. He sells them in shopping centres and craft stores. He’s been doing this for 15 years, and all has gone well thanks to his hard work. Cesar says that sales have dropped some 60% because of a lack of tourists in the area. He would like a loan to buy materials such as glaze and paint for his work. One day he would like to open a grocery store. He is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy glaze and paint

loans.name: Aracely Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Aracely Del Socorro,  tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Hace más 20 años de dedicarse a una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para establecer la pulpería. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de granos básicos que es lo que esta priorizando la gente al realizar las compras de sus viviendas. Su deseo es de poseer un mini súper que pueda surtir de todos los granos básicos a las personas que viven cerca de ella y que le brinden mayores ingresos a ella.
texts.en:
37-year old Sra. Aracely Del Socorro has two children. For more than 20 years she has run a convenience store located in her home. She started the store out of necessity because the family needed more money. So with a great deal of effort she used her own money and with support from her family she opened the corner store. The loan will be used to buy basic grains, the first items that people buy when they are grocery shopping. Aracely’s wish is to own a mini-market stocked with basics items required by the people who live nearby. In this way she will have a bigger income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kanyansheko Bakyara Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
T. Margaret appears in the small photo at the top right and she also appears in the big group photo as the group leader. She is a married woman with three kids, all going to school.

Margaret is one extraordinary woman, who has chosen a predominantly male occupation - farming. For the last twenty years she has gone through this farming mill in Kanyansheko village, Ibanda district. It’s with her experience and sense of hard work that she has been able to make successful strides in a male-dominated field.

Currently, Margaret is making profits to the tune of 40,000 shillings a month. It’s apparent that these profits are minimal by her standards, and also going by the status quo. Her future plans, on getting a loan, are to expand her business and to improve her family’s welfare.

loans.use: To improve her farm with mulching and more manure

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 62 años, es casada, de los cuales tenía cinco hijos, el mayor falleció y los cuatro restantes son independientes y tienen familia. Por lo que vive con su esposo y su nieta en su casa, ubicado al sur de la ciudad de Lima. Desde hace quince años, que se dedica a la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, por lo que cuenta con un horno parrillero pequeño a carbón, una mesa pequeña y sillas. Sin embargo muchas veces se enferma, puesto que se expone a las bajas temperaturas, por estar vendiendo a la intemperie, durante las noches que trabaja. Su actividad empieza en la mañana, en donde va al mercado a comprar los insumos necesarios para sazonar previamente los anticuchos y a las 5.00 de la tarde empieza a freírlos, en donde empieza conjuntamente la venta, hasta pasada las 11 de la noche, esperando se acabe toda la comida. Rosalía está feliz con lo que hace, puesto que las ganancias que obtiene las comparte con su esposo, siendo chofer no le da abastos para mantener su hogar, ya que su anhelo es mejorar su casa. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, asimismo desea participar de las reuniones de su grupo comunal, e integrarse a ella. Con el crédito que solicita, se comprará mesas y sillas, para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a 62-year-old married woman. She had five children, but the eldest passed away. The remaining four are now independent and have their own families. She lives with her husband and granddaughter in their house, which is located in South Lima. She has been selling anticuchos (Peruvian beef skewers) in front of her house for 15 years. She has a small charcoal grill, a small table, and some chairs. However, she often gets sick since she is exposed to low temperatures as a result of her working outside at night. She starts work in the morning, when she goes to the market to buy the ingredients she needs to season and marinate the meat. Then at 5:00 pm, she starts to fry the kabobs and sells them until 11:00 pm, hoping that she will sell all the food that she has prepared.

Rosalía is satisfied with what she does because she shares her profits with her husband, who does not earn enough money to support the household because he is a driver. Their greatest wish is to improve their home. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time and participating in the group meetings. With this loan that she is now requesting, she will purchase tables and chairs to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs to expand her food stand

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, tiene 25 años, tiene una hija de un año y cuatro meses. Nancy es una mujer responsable y trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de artesanía, ella esta casada con un pintor y ayudaba a su esposo en sus horas libres pero ahora ella aprendió el trabajo y se dedica al negocio, ella nos cuenta que acomodo una habitación de su domicilio para abrir e implementar su propio taller de pintura donde pasa varias horas haciendo pinturas. Ya son 4 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nancy requiere el préstamo para comprar bastidores, tela, pintura y oleos.  El anhelo de la socia es tener su propia tienda de pintura donde pueda vender sus productos  pero este año por el momento alquilará una tienda en la Plaza de Armas del Cusco donde venderá sus pinturas.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 25-year-old woman with a daughter who is a year and four months old. Nancy is a hardworking and responsible woman who sells handicrafts and is married to a painter. She used to help him out during her free time, but now that she has learned this skill, she devotes her time to her business. She states that set up a room in her house as her very own paint studio, where she spends hours making paintings. She has been in business for 4 years, and it has been very prosperous thanks to the efforts that she puts into her work. Nancy needs this loan to purchase stretcher bars, canvas, paint, and oil paint. Our client's greatest wish is to own an art gallery in which she can sell her products. This year, however, she will rent a gallery in Cusco's Plaza of Arms, where she will sell her paintings.

Our client is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her by the institute, and she is committed to making her payments according to the loan terms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stretch bars, canvas, paint, and oil paint

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 36 years old and married, with three children who go to school. He has been running a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, mobile phone airtime cards, and maize flour. He also rents out residential houses to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to support his family, and his business has really grown. He has previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya and successfully paid. He is determined to expand his shop into a wholesale shop. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to stock maize flour, cooking fat, mobile phone airtime cards, and five bags of sugar.

loans.use: To stock maize flour, sugar, mobile phone airtime cards, and cooking fat

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 33 years old and is married, with two children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she sells general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She has been in this business since 2004. She also sells foodstuff, such as chips, next to her retail shop. Together with her husband’s salary, they are able to meet their family's basic needs and pay school fees for their children. She is a very hardworking and focused lady. She previously took out a loan of 60,000 KES, which she used to expand her business and repaid successfully. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to stock maize flour, bags of sugar, potatoes, and firewood.

loans.use: To stock sugar, maize flour, potatoes, and firewood for cooking

loans.name: Aku Eunice

texts.fr: Cette dame de 42 ans est très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 03 femmes, elle a commencé en 2007 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, ce qu’elle gagne  de ce commerce lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en produits d’alimentation générale
texts.en:
This 42-year old lady is very dynamic. She is married and mother to three children. She began a business selling general food products in 2007 and the money she earns from this business allows her to contribute to her household expenses. In light of a fall in her stock of general food products, she is applying to WAGES for a loan in order to rebuild this stock.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a boutique where she sells clothes and cosmetics to earn money to pay school fees for her children and assist her husband with the household expenses. She has been in this business for eight years and has one employee who assists her in the business. She also earns some revenue from rent, which she gets from letting her rental houses. She hopes to grow her business and open more branches in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To stock clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Kihani Turise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
M. Peruth, shown at the top right in the small photo, also appears in the group photo and is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a friendly and evergreen married woman with nine children. She also has seven dependents. All these kids are going to school.

Peruth’s main source of income is selling produce in Kihani, Ibanda district. She has relied on this business’s trivial round for the last ten years and it’s with these minimal earnings that she and her family have been making ends meet. Since she began, she has been able to generate profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings per week. She attributes her success in this business to hard work, persistence and the support her customers offer her.

Peruth’s future plans are to expand her business and send all her children, plus the dependents, to school. She is looking forward to making her plans bear fruit after she gets this loan.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell in addition to the produce from her farm

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old and married with two children who attend school. He farms, growing vegetables and horticultural products for sale. He has been in this business for over 13 years. He has three employees to assist him with the business. 

Daniel has previously taken out a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business. He hopes to open up a shop and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George runs a store where he sells cereals to earn a living. He is 28 years old and married with one child who goes to school. He is married to a business lady and together they are able to provide their family with the basic needs. He has been in his business for ten years now and has one employee. 

George has previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business and successfully repaid. He hopes to expand his business and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested  a loan of 43,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals and household goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy cereals and household goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has been running a chemist shop for two years. She is 33 years old and married with one child. She buys drugs on a large scale to benefit from buying the goods in bulk and sells them to prescribed patients. She is hardworking and committed to her business. 

Janet has previously taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business. She hopes to increase her capital and earn huge profits to be able to support her family and also educate her children. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of medicine.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: Ruzinga Tukwatanise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Lawrence, shown in the small photo, also appears in the group photo and he is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is the married father of three and also has two dependents, under his auspices.

Lawrence sells milk in Makerere village, Ruzinga, Ibanda district, to cater for his family and himself. He has been plying his trade for the last fifteen years. Currently his business brings him close to 250,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. His longevity in this business, he says, is due to his work ethic and experienced decision making.

Lawrence’s business future plans are to expand the distribution of his milk products to cover the whole of western Uganda. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan. This loan he figures will render him that help.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell to his customers

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.en:
Leopoldina says that the freedom of running her own business is therapeutic. Originally from Ecuador, she now lives in the Bronx, NY, with her thirteen-year-old daughter and seventy-year-old mother.

After many years as a factory worker, Leopoldina found a flexible job housekeeping. Eight years ago she decided to start her own business to earn extra income. She came to ACCION USA for a loan in 2002 to start her home-based jewelry sales business. As the mother of a special-needs daughter, running her home-based business allows Leopoldina more time to spend with her daughter. 

Recently Leopoldina came to ACCION USA for a loan to purchase more inventory. With her loan she will purchase jewelry from her native country, Ecuador. She has been a long-time client of ACCION USA. She says that she is grateful to have a relationship with ACCION USA for so many years because she has improved her credit score and has been able to provide for her daughter.

Leopoldina is a skilled saleswoman who, despite the economic challenges, continues to prosper. She has seen everyone around her affected by the economic downturn; however she has been adamantly persisting in continuing her business. She loves the freedom it provides her.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry from Ecuador

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent sells used clothes to earn a living. She is 36 years old and married with two children who go to school. Her business is located in Kiserian, on the outskirts of Nairobi city. She has been in her business for five years. She also keeps poultry to get enough money to provide her family with basic needs and pay school fees for her children. Thanks to her customer care skills, she makes a good turnover, though it is not much money due to her limited capital. She hopes to grow her business and improve her standard of living in the future. Millicent has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR EDSON SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA Y EN ESPECIAL POLLOS A LA BROASTER, EL SEÑOR EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE DE COCINA EN UN RESTAURANTE MUY CONOCIDO DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA (LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, ES LA CAPITAL DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA Y DE LA PROVINCIA CERCADO SIENDO EN LA ACTUALIDAD LA TERCERA CIUDAD EN IMPORTANCIA ECONÓMICA DE BOLIVIA. SE ENCUENTRA SITUADA EN EL CENTRO DEL PAÍS, LOCALIZADA EN EL VALLE DEL MISMO NOMBRE EN MEDIO DE LA CORDILLERA DE LOS ANDES.)

CONSIDERADA COMO LA CAPITAL )EL VINO A NUESTRA INSTITUCION EMPRENDER SOLICITANDO UN CREDITO YA QUE NUNCA ANTES HABIA TRABAJADO CON NINGUNA INSTITUCION, Y DESPUES DE REALIZADA LA EVALUACION DE LE OTORGO UN CREDITO CON TAZA PREFERENCIAL CON EL PRIMER CREDITO ABRIO UN PEQUEÑO PUESTO DE VENTA DE COMIDA, TRABAJANDO CON NOSOTROS SE HIZO CAPÌTAL PROPIO Y AMPLIO SU PUESTO DE COMIDA QUE AHORA ES UNA TIENDA DE VENTA DE POLLOS, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR UNA BROASTERA GRANDE QUE MUCHA FALTA LE HACE AL SEÑOR EDSON.  EL SE SIENTE FELIZ DE TRABAJAR CON EMPRENDER YA QUE LE ABRIMOS LAS PUERTAS PARA TRABAJAR CON NOSOTROS Y ESTA AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Edson sells food and specializes in broasted chicken. He started as a kitchen assistant a well-known restaurant in Cochabamba. (Cochabamba is the capital city of the Cochabamba department and the Cercado province. It’s the third most important city in Bolivia. It’s located in the center of the country, in the valley of the same name, in the Andes corridor.) He came to our institution, Emprender, to request this loan. He had not worked with an institution before, but after our evaluation, his loan was approved and given preferential status. He used the money from his first loan to open a small food stall. Working with us, he was able to create his own capital and he expanded his stall, which is now a store that sells chicken. He plans to use the money from this loan to buy a large broaster which he needs. He is happy to be working with Emprender, since we opened our doors to him. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him when granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a chicken broaster

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El comite de mujeres solidarias se conformó mediante el deseo de superación de 15 mujeres, quiene actualmente se encuentran trabajando con mucha esperanza y deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de las integrantes.  
Una de las integrantes es la señora la Señora Lidia S. quien posee una cantina o pequeño comercio gastronómico, el cual es muy concurrido y además con mucha demanda de alimentos rápidos así como platos principales de desayuno, almuerzo, etc. 
Para seguir brindando buen servicio y adecuada alimentación, la misma tiene interés en aumentar la variedad del menú, para lo cual debe abastecerse de mas mercaderías y productos gastronómicos, como son panificados, verduras, productos lácteos y cárnicos, así como herramientas de cocina y para atención del cliente y así mejorar sus ingresos y por consiguiente su estilo de vida, briendando buen servicio a los consumidores, para cubrir esta necesidad ha solicitado el préstamo el cual se le concedio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Solidarias Committee was formed because its 15 members wanted to better themselves. They are all working with hope and the desire to improve their living conditions.

One of the members, Ms. Lidia S., owns a small eatery that is well-frequented by customers who order fast food for breakfast, lunch, etc. In order to continue providing good services and nutrition, she would like to offer a wider selection of meals on her menu, which means she needs to stock up on more ingredients like breads, vegetables, dairy products, and meat, as well as cooking utensils. By improving customer service, she will boost profits and in so doing, improve her lifestyle. She is requesting this loan in order to get started with these plans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, starch, eggs, lard, cheese, cooking oil, rice, noodles, sugar, salt, herbs, pork, beef, chicken, tapioca, fruits, vegetables, drinks, candy, and other products

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 37 años, su actividad económica es la venta de calzado y fajas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su esposo estableció un lugar en el mercado en donde podían ofrecer sus productos, por lo que después hablo con todas las personas que realizaban la elaboración de fajas y calzado, de esta manera su esposa Marisol comienza a realizar este trabajo, además ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que tiene hacerse cargo. Por lo que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para obtener la compra de materia prima que se utiliza. Ella sueña con mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 37-year-old woman who sells belts and footwear for a living. She has been in business for over 6 years. Her husband set up a space in the market where they could sell their products. He then got in touch with people who make belts and footwear, and that is how his wife, Marisol, got her start in this skill. Additionally, she has to look after her 2 underage children. She is looking for a way to boost her income, which is why she is requesting this loan, which will be used to purchase the raw materials she needs. She dreams of improving her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La señora es casada, la misma es dueña de una costurería donde produce todo lo que sea refernte a costura recta, su especialidad son las confecciones de sabanas, sobrerecamas, forros para fundas, cortinados en general, trabajos en croches, etc.
 La misma posee muchos cleintes, envia sus trabajos a la argentina, paises de europa, como ser Italia, españa, portugal, etc;  situado en la ciudad de Pilar, sobre la calle Paolo Alberzoni y 1 marzo de esta ciudad. 
Ella realiza estos trabajos desde hace más de 15 años en el Ramo de la cofección. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia,  donde vive con su marido, quien es jubilado.
Para satisfacer la demanda de productos con crédito que solicitó para su pequeña empresa, adquirirá insumos como telas, forros, hilos, agujas, etc. y así mejorar sus ingresos mediante la calidad de sus productos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya, por los buenos servicios brindados a su microempresa.
texts.en:
Ms. Benitez is a married woman who owns a sewing workshop. Her specialty is making bed sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases, drapery, crochet, etc. She has many customers, and she sends her work to Argentina and European countries like Italy, Spain, Portugal, etc. Her business is located in the city of Pilar, on the corner of Paolo Alberzoni and 1 Marzo Street.

She has been involved in sewing for over 15 years. She and her retired husband own their house. In order to meet customer demand, she will purchase materials like fabric, lining, thread, and needles with this loan, thus improving her income via the quality of her products.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the services it has given to her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lining, thread, curtain accessories, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es:
MUJERES POSITIVAS
La Alcancia Comunal MUJERES POSITIVAS está representado por su presidenta Honorata que es una persona responsable, puntual y organizada ya que se preocupa por el bienestar del grupo.
Honorata se dedica a la venta D. tuberculos en un Mercado cerca a su casa. Con su negocio pueD. apoyar en casa y  en la educacion D. sus hijos.
Gliceria se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales Omnilife. Ella consumio estos productos que mejoraron su salud y es por eso que pueD. recomendar y vender a sus vecinas y otras personas que padecen D. algun malestar, ella esta contenta con el prestamo pero su mayor sueño es conseguir un puesto en el Mercado para  poder exhibir sus productos. Con sus ganancias pueD. aportar con los gastos familiares.
La venta D. comida le ha traido muchas satisfacciones a Josefina quien tiene un puesto en un mercado informal D. Huaycan. Este negocio la ha ayudado  a mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa ademas en la educacion y la manutencion D. sus 8 hijos. Josefina es casada y juntamente con su esposo siguen trabajando para el bienestar familiar. 
Con el prestamo obtenido todas las socias invertiran en la compra D. productos e insumos que necesitan para sus diferentes negocios
texts.en:
The Mujeres Positivas Communal Bank is represented by president Honorata, a very responsible, punctual and organized person who cares about the group's well-being.

Honorata sells tubers in a market near her home. With this business, she is able to support both the household and her children's education.

Gliceria sells Omnilife natural products. She consumes these products, which have improved her health, so she can recommend and sell them to her neighbors and other people who have some ailment. She is happy with the loan, but her greatest wish is to obtain a stand in the market so that she can display her products. With her profits, she is able to help pay for the family expenses.

Selling food has brought much satisfaction to Josefina, who has a stand at a flea market in Huaycan. This business has greatly contributed in her home improvement projects. It has also helped her support her 8 children and pay for their education. Josefina is married, and she and her husband continue working for their family's well-being.

The members will invest this loan in purchasing the products and supplies they need for their different businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Felix Eladio

texts.es:
Félix Ramírez de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 16 años que estudia.   
 
Félix inicio como ayudante en un taller mecánico haciendo reparaciones de carros, arreglo de motores y todo tipo de arreglos para carros, gracias a este trabajo pudo aprender como ser un mecánico profecional. Con sus pocos ahorros alquilo un local para independizarse como mecánico. 

Ahora el trabaja desde las 08:00 am hasta las 20:00 pm todos los días. Hace reparaciones de motores, válvulas, inyectores etc. Una de las complicaciones que hasta ahora tiene es el clima muy lluvioso. Pero con el préstamo quiere comprar hierro para su negocio.

En el futuro quiere una ferretería (lugar donde hay herramientas de venta) para asegurar el futuro de su único hijo. Y tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Félix Ramírez is a 58-year-old man who lives in a peri-urban area of Perimetral de Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has the basic utilities. He is single but has a 16-year-old son who is currently in school.

Félix started out as a mechanic's assistant, fixing cars, repairing engines, and performing all types of automotive repair tasks. Thanks to this job, he was able to learn how to become a professional mechanic. With his little savings, he was able to rent a garage and became a self-employed mechanic.

He now works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm every day. He repairs engines, valves, fuel injectors, etc. One of his biggest problems is the rainy season; however, he would like to purchase sheet metal for his business.

In the future, would like to have his own garage and a hardware store where he can sell hand tools so that he can ensure his only son's future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheet metal

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
Olga Isabel P. A. tiene 26 años, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad en San Jacinto, Departamento de Bolívar, donde se dedica desde hace 4 años  a elaborar y vender artesanías como hamacas, mochilas y también prepara y vende un delicioso refresco congelado, elaborado con frutas naturales  llamado boli. En la actualidad solicita un crédito  $ 1.500.000  el cual será invertido en la compra de hilaza para hamacas, hilo fino para bolsos y lana para elaborar mochilas y comprar mercancía como ropa, cosméticos y calzado que adicionará a su negocio. 
La mayor parte de la niñez de Olga la vivió en un corregimiento de San Jacinto Bolívar llamado Bajo Grande hasta sus 10 años, de donde fuè desplazada y huyéndole al conflicto armado que ocurrió en ese momento, se vino a vivir a San Jacinto, pero hoy todo eso es parte de su historia. La señora Olga ha recibido dos créditos con la fundación, los cuales ha pagado muy bien. Su negocio ha servido de mucho a su familia, debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no son muy altos y ella siempre ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Olga sueña con tener su casa propia, ampliar su negocio y con ello  aumentar los ingresos familiares.  Su desafió más grande ocurrió cuando tuvo que  salir de su población  de origen para salvar sus vidas; soportar algunos momentos de situaciones económicas difíciles y en estos momentos vivir separada de su esposo por asuntos laborales. Gracias a Dios están superando esta situaciones y espera un futuro más promisorio para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Olga Isabel P. A. is a 26-year-old woman with a 6-year-old son. They live in San Jacinto, in the department of Bolívar, where she has been making handicrafts, such as hammocks, backpacks and bolis (frozen juice pops) for the last 4 years. She is currently requesting a $1,500,000 COP, which will be invested in purchasing hammock cord, fine thread to make handbags, and wool to make backpacks. She will also buy such merchandise as apparel, cosmetics and footwear to expand her business.

Olga spent a large part of her childhood living in a small town in San Jacinto Bolívar called Bajo Grande, until she was 10 years old and was displaced while fleeing from the armed conflict at that time. She then came to live in San Jacinto, but this is all a part of her history. Ms. Olga has obtained two loans, which she has already repaid, from this institute. Her business has been very beneficial to her family because her husband's income is insufficient and she always helps with the household expenses. Olga dreams of obtaining her own house, expanding her business, and in so doing increasing the family income. Her greatest challenge was having to leave her town in order to save her life because she had to withstand difficult moments and financial hardships. She and her husband now live in apart for job reasons. Thank God that they are now overcoming these difficulties, and she now hopes for a more promising future for both her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cord, thread, wool, clothing, cosmetics, and footwear

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El  señor es casado, tiene 57 años de edad, el mismo es dueño de una verdulería donde produce infinidades de productos  agricolas en forma artesanal,  situado en la ciudad de Pilar, sobre la Avda.  Federico Shiavon c/ Mbocayaty., en dicho local se comercializa productos variados en general, como ser lechugas, zanahorias, cebollas, frutillas, etc.
Es un importante productor de la zona de este barrio, que desde hace más de 15 años en el Ramo, con gran cantidad de clientes. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia en el barrio Mbocajaty,  donde vive con su Señora, quien es costurera, de ropas.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su  huerta, así como estiércol para utilizarlo de abono, herramientas para uso en la huerta, etc. y así mejorar la calidad de sus productos, para de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. T. is a 57-year-old married man who owns a farm in which he grows a number of different types of produce on a small scale. This farm is located in the city of Pilar, on Ferderico Shiavon Avenue c/Mbocayaty. He sells produce like lettuce, carrots, onions, strawberries, etc.

He is a very important grower in this neighborhood, with over 15 years of experience and a large clientele. Mr. T. owns a house in the Mbocajaty neighborhood with his wife, who is a dressmaker. He is requesting this loan so that he can purchase supplies, such as manure (for fertilizer), tools, etc. for his farm. That way, he can improve the quality of his produce and increase profits. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the good services they have provided for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana tiene 58 años de edad. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costura. Ana tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha gustado este tipo de trabajo ya que ella siempre está brindando la mejor calidad a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus diversas prendas. El deseo de Ana es mejorar cada día y obtener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana is a 58-year-old married woman with 3 children under her care. She provides dressmaking services for a living. She has been working with Fundación León 2000 for many years. She has been in business for over 9 years because she has always liked this job, and she always gives the best to her customers. She is currently requesting a loan which will be invested in purchasing the raw materials she needs to make different outfits. Ana's wish is to improve each day and to obtain bigger profits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amaris Del Rosario

texts.es:
Amaris E. Gómez tiene 55 años y vive en San Jacinto, municipio del centro de Bolívar conocido por la elaboración de artesanías, tales como hamacas, bolsos y mochilas. Amaris es comerciante y productora de artesanías, actividad tradicional heredada de su madre. Los productos que más fabrica son las mochilas, las cuales elabora en horas de la noche y las hamacas que las elabora con sus hermanas y su mamá. Además, Amaris trabaja en una empresa en las horas de la mañana, mientras su esposo se dedica a labores del campo. Ha tenido 2 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo los que le han aumentado su ingreso familiar e hicieron que pudiera mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. El crédito que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilaza para producir hamacas tejidas en telar vertical y también para la elaboración de bolsos y mochilas.

Manifiesta que ha visto tiempos difíciles durante tiempos de violencia cuando su esposo no podía trabajar en el campo debido a aquella problemática y entonces a ella le tocó encargarse de la mayor parte de los gastos del hogar; gracias a Dios la situación se ha cambiado y ahora los sanjacinteros pueden trabajar en el campo de nuevo. Más adelante, Amaris sueña con mejorar su vivienda, la cual es una casa propia y con ayudar a uno de sus tres hijos para que realice sus estudios universitarios el año que viene.
texts.en:
Amaris E. Gómez is 55 years old and lives in San Jacinto, a municipality in the Bolívar town center known for the production of artisinal goods like hammocks, purses, and backpacks. Amaris is shopkeeper and producer of artisinal goods, a traditional activity inherited from her mother. The products that she makes the most are backpacks that she makes at night, and hammocks that she makes with her sisters and mother. Additionally, Amaris works in a company in the morning, while her husband does field work. She has had two loans with Fundación Santo Domingo which have improved her family income and allowed her to improve her living conditions. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of thick yarn to to make woven hammocks on a vertical loom, and also to make purses and backpacks. She expresses that she has seen difficult times during periods of violence when her husband could not work in the countryside, when it was up to her to take charge of the majority of household expenses; thank God the situation has changed and today most sajacinteros[those from San Jacinto] can work in the countryside again. In the future, Amaris dreams of improving her home, which she owns, and of helping one of her three kids finish their university studies this coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of thick yarn to produce hammocks woven on a vertical loom and to make purses and backpacks.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El Cliente es dueño de una carpintería, es casado, cuenta con  más de 15 años en el ramo, realiza todo tipo de trabajo en maderas, como sillas, mesas, muebles todo tipo, trabajos muy finos y de buena calidad con gran cantidad de clientes. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia en el barrio San Francisco,  donde vive con su señora, quien es ama de casa.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su  taller, como maderas, clavos, cementos para madera, algunas herramientas, para de esta forma mejorar la calidad de sus productos y por ende incrementar sus ingresos. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Pastor F. owns a carpenter's shop, is married, and has more than 15 years in the business. He does all kinds of woodworking, such as chairs, tables, and all kinds of furniture. He does very fine, highly quality work for a large number of customers. He has his own house in the San Francisco neighborhood, where he lives with his wife, who is a housewife. F. is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for his workshop, such as wood, nails, wood glue, and some tools, in order to improve the quality of his products and thus increase his income. He thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the good services it has offered his enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies such as wood, nails, glue, and some tools

loans.name: Ghokale Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
W. Monica, shown at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the big group photo and she is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 48 years old and married with five children in both primary and secondary sections.

Monica has operated a business buying and selling goats and cows from Ivunamba village for six years from which she is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. Her biggest challenge is the scarcity of animals, hence making them expensive for her customers to buy from her.

Monica’s hard work, and ensuring that she has the necessary stock, attracts her customers and her dream is to ensure that she is able to supply the whole of Jinja town as well as educate her children to the university level. Monic needs a loan to be able to buy more goats for resale and this will increase her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio es casado, su unidad familiar esta compuesto de tres personas, en su residencia se demuestra que cuentan con todas las comodidades para el desarrollo de su actividad, el mismo es de Pilar , vive en el Barrio Villa Aurora, se dedica al comercio, a la  compra y venta de animales vacunos, como comisionista. Es también constructor de obras, realiza trabajos de construcciones civiles.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su  negocio, así como balanceados, comederos y otros que le permitan mejorar la calidad del ganado a coemrcializar. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Rogelio is married and his family unit is composed of three people. At his house he has the things he needs for the development of his work. He is from Pilar and lives in Barrio Villa Aurora. He is in commerce, and works on commission buying and selling cattle. He is also in construction and works on civil construction projects.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his business such as cattle food, feeding troughs, and other things that will improve the quality of cattle he has for sale. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the good services they have offered to his enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to fatten for market

loans.name: Minex

texts.es: La  Sra. Minex Méndez R.  su profesión es  de Maestra de educación primaria tiene veinte y tres años de ser maestra, es madre  de dos hijos uno en edad escolar, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera llegar a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno
texts.en:
Sra. Minex Méndez R. has been a primary school teacher for 23 years. She has two school age children and is currently married. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL and each one has made it possible to make improvements in her home. By means of these loans she will finish building her house, They are her only means of obtaining a decent dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	La  Sra. María Clementina S. Pérez  su profesión es  de Maestra de educación primaria tiene treinta y dos años de laborar como maestra, tiene bajo su cargo cinco hijos de edades escolares, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación  y de esta manera ha  llegado  a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno.
El crédito lo esta solicitando para terminar de construir un cuarto para uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. María Clementina S. Pérez has worked as a primary school teacher for 32 years. She takes care of three children of school age and is currently married. She has had six loans with CEPRODEL and each one has made it possible to make improvements in her home. By means of these loans she will finish building her house. They are her only means of obtaining a decent dwelling. The loan she is applying for will be used to finish constructing a room for one of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, cement, piedrin (a type of stone used for building) and payment for laborers.

loans.name: Lilliam Victoria

texts.es: Lilliam Victoria tiene 36 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 que realiza este negocio, con la ayuda de su esposo que le brindaba todo su apoyo mejoro lo suficiente en sus ingresos para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día y poco a poco fue logrando obtener más productos para vender. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de ropa usada,  bolsos, calzado y cosméticos, ya que tiene bastantes pedidos. El sueño es llegar a tener una tienda grande y si Dios lo permite, convertirse en una distribuidora de productos al por mayor de sus productos.
texts.en:
Lilliam Victoria is 36 years old, married and has 2 dependent children. She works selling general merchandise. She has been working in this business for 10 years. With the help of her husband who has given her his support, she has improved their income enough to provide for their daily necessities. Little by little she was able to get more products to sell. The loan will be invested in purchasing mainly used clothes, pocketbooks, shoes and cosmetics since she already has a lot of orders. The dream is to have a big store and god willing, become a wholesale distributor of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maximo Cesar

texts.es: El  Sr. Máximo Cesar Venegas P.  El es trabajador activo del Instituto Nicaragüense de Turismo él se desempeña como ayudante de mantenimiento tiene once años de trabajar para esta empresa, es padre  de un hijo en edad escolar, es Acompañado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera llegar a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo Cesar Venegas P. has worked for the Nicaraguan Tourism Institute as a maintenance assistant for 11 years. He has a school-age son and has a partner. He has had three loans with CEPRODEL and with each one he has made home improvements, thus being able to finish building his home as this was the only way of being able to have a home with a decent roof.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a truck load of stone

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Benjamin C. A. de 46 años de edad es de profesión carpintero muy conocido en la zona de Villarrica, se dedica a la preparación de puertas, ventanas, marcos y variedades de muebles. Empezó hace mas de 5 años con la ayuda de su señora, trabaja con su hijo Walter Gustavo C. de 20 años de edad, la carpintería es de su popiedad y lo tiene en su domicilio ubicado en la ciudad de Villarrica departamento del Guairá.

Solicita el préstamo para la  compra de materia prima, especialmnte madera e insumos como clavo, lijas,  además quiere aprovechar una oferta en la zona en cuanto a la madera y con estos materiales y herramientas podrá mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 46 years old and is very well known as a carpenter in the Villarrica area. He works making doors, windows, frames, and a variety of furniture. He began doing this more than five years ago, with the help of his wife. He works with his son, 20 year old Walter Gustavo. He owns the carpentry business and runs it from his home in the city of Villarrica, in the department of Guairá.

He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials, especially wood and supplies such as nails and sandpaper. He also wants to take advantage of an offer available with regard to the wood, and with these materials and tools he will be able to improve the quality of his products and so increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials (wood), supplied (nails), and tools

loans.name: Sonia Maritza

texts.en:
Sonia Maritza G. M. lives in Pococi, Limón, a rural area located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Sonia lives on a farm where she is involved in various productive activities including animal rearing (and selling), harvesting crops such as bananas, plantains and peppers, and the production of organic fertilizer. This loan will be used to make general investments in the expansion of her various productive activities. For example, Sonia plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of chickens and animal feed as well as nutrients to use when working with her crops.

The daily routine in Sonia’s family consists of an early wakeup followed by tending to the animals and then working on fertilizer production and tending to the crops. Her goal is to everyday improve her productive methods and to integrate her family into the farming process.

Sonia has lived on the farm in Pococi for the past six years. She is described by the loan consultant that has been working with her as a hardworking, organized woman with an entrepreneurial spirit. Sonia is dedicated to her business as much as she is to her family. She would like to study English and accounting; her dream is to brand her farm as a rural tourist destination where individuals interested in organic foods could come to observe her methods of production. Sonia is very knowledgeable about agriculture and she hopes to use this loan to exploit the benefits of her home-made organic fertilizer. Occasionally, Sonia offers workshops to people interested in agriculture and farming.

Sonia has cited communication problems as one of her main obstacles. At the moment, she is waiting to hear back from the government body in charge of phone installations to find out how she might go about getting a phone in her home. Another obstacle for her has been a lack of access to financial services. In the past, Sonia has not been able to obtain the economic resources necessary for the expansion of her poultry-selling business. This loan will fill the void in financial services that has existed in the past for Sonia and her family.

loans.use: To finance the purchase of chickens and animal feed as well as crop nutrients

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 42 años, es casada, de los cuales tiene dos hijos, independientes y con familia. Solo vive con su esposo en su casa. Su carácter emprendedor la empujaron a incursionar en diversos trabajos con su esposo, y con el correr del tiempo compraron su primer carro, siendo su pareja quien conduce el vehiculo, mientras ella lo administra y de las ganancias que obtuvieron, pudieron comprar su motocarro, en donde su hijo mayor lo trabaja. Maritza es una mujer muy ahorradora, pero a la vez, amante del trabajo, es por ello que se puso a trabajar como cocinera, en un convento, desde las 11am de la mañana hasta las 8pm de la noche, sin descuidar, la administración de sus vehículos. Su mayor anhelo de Maritza es comprarse otro carro, para uso exclusivo de ella. Éste es su séptimo préstamo  con MFP y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas, como en anteriores veces, asimismo le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, pagará el mantenimiento de su carro y cambiar algunos repuestos que requiera.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old and married; she has two grown children with their own families. She lives with her husband in their home. Her enterprising nature pushed her to tackle various jobs with her husband, and after some time, they purchased their first car. Her husband drives the vehicle, while she manages it. From the profits they earned, they were able to buy their "motocarro" (a three-wheeled, light delivery van), with which their older son works. Maritza is a very thrifty woman, but at the same time, she loves working. For that reason, she began to work as a cook in a convent, from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m., while continuing to manage their vehicles. Maritza's greatest desire is to buy another car for her own use. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she agrees to continue making her payments, as in previous cases. Likewise, she enjoys working with her communal bank. With the loan she is requesting, she will pay for the maintenance of her car and replace some of the parts it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for car maintenance and spare parts

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: La señora Dora Isabel  tiene 59 años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que tiene más de 10 años de tener esta actividad, algunas veces Dora se le hace muy difícil hacerse cargo de su actividad, por lo que tiene ciertos problemas de salud, pero el espíritu emprendedor que ella realiza con este trabajo la mantiene muy feliz. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, gaseosas y jugos. Su deseo siempre ha sido obtener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Isabel is 59, married, with 2 dependent children. Although she has worked in this business for more than 10 years, sometime she finds it difficult because of certain health problems. But her entrepreneurial spirit demonstrated in this work keeps her very happy. The loan that she is asking for is for working capital to buy basic grains, candies, natural drinks, soft drinks and juices. Her wish has always been to be able to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Gemelas lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. Una de ellas es la señora Mercedes Dominga M. Martínez quien desde hace diez años se dedica a la realización  de cosa de horno, delicioso bocadillo a base de  maíz, queso, leche y crema. 


Cuando inicio M. con el negocio no contaba con las herramientas necesarias según expreso en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido tiene su propio horno, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo de 12 años y dos personas que trabajan junto con ella. Esta invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materia prima como maíz, leche, queso y crema.

Mientras Paulina del Rosario L. M. luego de perder parte de su visión empezó a realizar tortillas y luego invirtió en la producción de postres nicaragüenses como buñuelos  y cajetas de leche, coco, piñonate, masa, coyolito, maní y papaya.  Y Martha Evelyn S.  otra de las integrantes del grupo hace cuatro años empezó vendiendo chiverías y con el tiempo fue surtiendo su pequeña venta.
texts.en:
The group "Las Gemelas" (the twins) consists of three women who are hardworking, spirited, and enterprising. One of them is Mercedes Dominga M., who for 10 years has been making and selling a delicious baked dish made of corn, cheese, milk, and cream.

When M. began this business she did not have the tools she needed, but today her business has grown and she has her own oven. She can depend on support from her 12 year old son and two people who work along with her. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials like corn, milk, cheese, and cream.

Meanwhile, Paulina, after loosing some of her sight, began to make tortillas and later began making Nicaraguan deserts such as doughnuts, toffee pudding, coconut, candied pine nuts, cake, masa, coyolito, peanuts and papaya. And Marta, the other group member, has been selling dairy products for four years and over time has been gaining sales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make deserts, and typical dishes with milk, corn, cheese and cream.

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad El Parque Industrial encontramos en banco Comunal Hermano Miguel formado por mujeres cabeza de hogar que buscan salir adelante junto a sus hijos y familia en general, esta localidad es reconocida por su actividad económica pues aquí se encuentra un gran número de fabricas y es el parque industrial de la  ciudad de Cuenca.

Rosa Ubaldina es socia de este banco hace 3 años,  incentivada por una ex socia del Bankito, ella vive en su casa propia con sus  cinco hijos de  20, 18, 15, 13, 10 años en el sector del Parque Industrial en la ciudad de Cuenca, ya que su esposo migró a otro país hace 10 años para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.

Nuestra socia tiene 42 años  y desde hace dos años se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en diferentes casas de la localidad  no tiene un horario fijo y solo trabaja tres días a la semana, el resto de días cuida a un bebe en su casa y realiza las actividades de su hogar.

Lleva varios ciclos en su banco comunal y el dinero obtenido ha utilizado para los gastos de su hogar como educación, alimentación entre otros, con el nuevo crédito solicitado  pagará las planillas de los servicios básicos como agua, luz y teléfono. Tiene como meta  viajar para reunirse con su esposo y trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Mónica tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un niño de dos años que si lo reconoció su padre y le ayuda económicamente para la manutención del niño, ella vive en la casa de un familiar con su hijo.

Se encuentra ocho  años trabajando con la fundación y fue su madre quien se enteró de los beneficios que ofrece la institución por la publicidad entregada en su comunidad,  con los créditos obtenidos ha solventado sus estudios, Mónica es profesora de educación primaria, profesión que ejerce hace ya tres años, labora de 07H30 a 12H30 del día  y por la tarde  se dedica a su hijo y en  la noche va a la  universidad para lograr su Licenciatura en educación básica, está concluyendo sus estudios y por ahora el crédito solicitado lo  invertirá en el desarrollo de su tesis.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio propio para compartir con sus otras actividades y dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the city of Cuenca in the community of El Parque Industrial (The Industrial Park), we find the Hermano Miguel (Brother Michael) Communal Bank, composed of women heads of households who hope to advance their children and families in general. This locality is recognized for its economic activity since here one encounters a large number of factories -- it's the industrial park for the city of Cuenca. Rosa Ubaldina has been a member of this bank for 3 years, motivated by an ex-member of the little bank. She has lived in her own house with 5 children, ages 20, 18, 15, 13, 10, in the Parque Industrial sector in the city of Cuenca, since her husband migrated to another country some 10 years ago to offer a better future for his family. Rosa is 42 years old and for the last 2 years, she has dedicated herself to domestic matters in different homes of the locality. She doesn't have a fixed schedule and only works 3 days a week.
