On the remaining days she cares for a baby in her own house and takes care of activities in her own home. She has benefited from various loan cycles in her communal bank and the money obtained was utilized for expenses such as education, basic food, etc. With her new loan request she will pay the bills for basic services such as water, lights, and telephone. Her goal is to travel in order to reunite with her husband and to work hard to advance her children. Mónica is 25 years old, the single mother of a 2 year old boy whom the father recognizes and helps maintain economically. She lives in a family member's house with her son. She has been working for 8 years with the Foundation and it was her mother who informed her of the benefits offered by the institution from the publicity available in her community. With past loans, she has paid for her studies. Mónica has been a primary school teacher for 3 years, working from 7:30 am until 12:30 pm, then afternoons she cares for her child, and at night goes to the university to obtain her degree in basic education. She is concluding her studies and at present, her requested loan will be invested in the development of her thesis. Her goal is to have her own business to conduct, along with other activities, and to dedicate more time to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING UTILITY BILLS, INCLUDING WATER, LIGHTS, AND TELEPHONE, AND PAYING COSTS OF AN EDUCATION THESIS

loans.name: Fabiola Del Monserrate

texts.es:
Fabiola Rodríguez de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es divorciada pero tiene 3 hijos que ya se han independizado. 

Fabiola comenzó con una pequeña tienda vendiendo chicles, snack y confites. Poco a poco incremento su tienda con papelería. En la actualidad ella tiene una papelería pequeña no muy surtida pero con cosas dispensables. También vende bebidas y confites para sus clientes. Algunas veces cuando no tiene suficiente dinero tiene que realizar costuras de ropa a sus vecinas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, carpetas, plumas para la temporada escolar ( en abril hasta diciembre tiene clases las escuelas y colegios). En el futuro quiere poner rejas a su local para más seguridad y vender también helado.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 52 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She lives in a cement home with all basic services. She is divorced and has three adult children. Fabiola started a small store where she sold gum, snacks, and candy. Little by little she began adding paper goods. Now she has a small stationary shop. It doesn't have much variety, but includes some necessary items. She also sells drinks and confectionary items to her customers. At times, she also needs to do some sewing for her neighbors when she needs extra money. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy notebooks, writing pads, and pens for the school year. (Classes run from April to December.) In the future she would like to put a fence up around her home to improve its security. She would also like to sell ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, writing pads, pens for resale

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Primero Dios está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellos es el señor Dámaso Abba V. G. quien es agricultor y sueña con poder tener su propio terreno. Este trabaja alquilando cuatro manzanas de tierra donde cultiva maíz, trigo y frijoles. El con el préstamo piensa pagar  el alquiler de dichas tierras.

Mientras sus compañeras de grupo María Luisa Mejía Rodríguez quien comercializa sandalias y Sandra L. Gaitán  vende ropa invertirán en mayor cantidad de mercadería especialmente veraniega por la temporada
texts.en:
The Primero Dios group is comprised of three hard-working people. One of them is Dámaso Abba V. G.. He is a farmer, and he dreams of being able to have his own land. He rents four blocks of land where he works growing corn, wheat, and beans. He will use the loan to pay the rent for that land. His group colleagues are María Luisa Mejía Rodríguez, who sells sandals, and Sandra L. Gaitán, who sells clothes. They will invest in greater quantities of merchandise especially for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent land

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María Cárdenas es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, ella  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector Don Bosco, Cuenca es muy conocida por su hermosa arquitectura colonial, y su gente que es muy cálida y amable y los diferentes atractivos turísticos que ofrece al visitante nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia es una mujer que siempre dibuja una sonrisa en su rostro y mantiene una buena amistad con todas sus amigas del bankito,  ella  tiene 27 años de edad,  labora en los quehaceares de su casa y cuidado de su familia mientras  su esposo es chofer profesional de un taxi de su propiedad, tienen una niña de diez  años que estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, y como aún  no tienen casa propia viven arrendando. 

Este es su segundo crédito en la fundación, con el dinero que pronto recibirá comprará   uniformes y textos escolares  que aun le hacen falta para la educación de su hija, tiene como  sueño ver a su hija ser una profesional en la especialidad que ella escoja.
texts.en:
María Cárdenas is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank. She lives in the Don Bosco sector of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is well-known for its beautiful colonial architecture, its warm and friendly people, and the various tourist attractions it offers to domestic and foreign visitors. María is a woman who always keeps a smile on her face and maintains good friendships with all of her fellow communal bank members. She is 27 years old and works as a homemaker, taking care of her family while her husband works as a professional taxi driver in a vehicle he owns. They have a ten-year-old daughter who is attending school in the city. They live in rented quarters, since they do not have a house of their own. This is María's second loan with the foundation. With the funds she will soon receive, she will buy school uniforms and textbooks which she still needs for her daughter's education. María's dream is to see her daughter become a professional in the field of her choice.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school uniforms and textbooks for her daughter

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gambwa Group 2, Mityana

texts.en:
L. Wilson, a married father of seven with twelve dependents, sells produce in Ggambwa trading center, Mityana district, to be able to shoulder the responsibility of taking care of his family.

Within a period of less than three years since Wilson began his business, adverse dry weather conditions have manifested themselves as his biggest letdown. He has had to grapple with a problem of less supplies from his farming distributors in the wake of such conditions.

Wilson envisages a new and improved chapter in his business after he gets this loan. He will be able to expand his capital base as he stocks more produce like maize, beans, rice, coffee and so on.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La Señora Juana María Amplié B., tiene la edad de 29 años, vive en el barrio San Ignacio, es casada y su esposo trabaja como conductor, apoyándole en los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene un hijo de 5 añitos,  ella trabaja como niñera desde hace 2 años, y dentro de sus principales objetivos en la vida está el terminar de construir su hogar.

Ella es una mujer joven, que con el apoyo de su esposo han podido estabilizar la economía del hogar, pero ahora ellos solicitan de un préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción que  les permita avanzar con los proyectos de culminación de su vivienda, esto les ofrecera mejores condiciones de vida para toda la familia, en especial para la pequeña, la cual se encuentra en una etapa en donde demanda mejores condiciones en su entorno debido a lo frágiles que son con su salud.
texts.en:
Señora Juana María Amplié B., 29, lives in the San Ignacio area. She is married, and her husband works as a driver, helping with the household expenses. They have one son, 5 years old. She has worked in childcare for 2 years, and one of her main life goals is to complete the construction of their house. She is a young woman, who with the help of her husband has been able to stabilize the household finances, but now they are requesting a loan to purchase construction materials so they can move ahead with the projects to complete their home. This will provide better living conditions for the whole family, especially for the little one, who needs a better living environment due to some health problems.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Nubia Fernández C. tiene 46 años y  vive en el barrio Campestre de Cartagena de Indias, se dedica  venta de productos capilares y cosméticos en su negocio llamado el punto de la Belleza, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 16 y de 18 años, su crédito por valor de $2.000.000 será invertido en capital de trabajo para comprar productos capilares cosméticos  como cremas,  protectores solares, champús y reforzar la parte de accesorios femeninos  como  collares, pulseras, que diseñan en familia.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación y su interés es que el negocio siga creciendo y que sea reconocido como el lugar donde se consigue todo lo requerìdo para crear una buena imagen.
Como quiere crear su propia marca de  accesorios que ella diseña, su principal desafío es precisamente reforzar esta línea  y posicionarla en el mercado. aprendió a trabajar con productos capilares cuando  fue  asesora comercial de una importante empresa; con su esfuerzo y tenacidad empezó a trabajar independiente e  inició con una vitrina y luego cuando tuvo más experiencia se cambió hacia un local justamente ubicado  muy cerca de su casa en el barrio campestre; la microempresa le ha permitido disfrutar  de más tiempo con su familia , ya que es ahora su propio jefe y sobre todo de acompañar a sus hijas  a practicar su deporte favorito :el patinaje,  a través del cual ha adquirido relaciones con las madres de sus compañeras  y ha logrado incrementar su clientela, porque  su negocio está ubicado en  cerca de los  escenarios deportivos donde se practica esta disciplina.
Ella en su negocio  ha involucrado a su familia y quiere que éste sea una gran empresa, por eso cuando  escuchó hablar de la Fundación a sus amigas, pensó en su sueño de  seguir creciendo y de ampliar la gama de productos, pues teniendo en cuenta que  su hija empezó a estudiar administración de empresas y diseña también accesorios  como collares, aretes, pulseras, empezó a ofrecerlos y han tenido mucha aceptación entre la clientela.La señora Nubia ha identificado en su hija talento para el diseño de joyas por eso está impulsando su espíritu empresarial; por eso espera sea apoyada en su financiamiento, para seguir adelante en su propósito y con su natural dinámica poder enfrentar los desafíos del mercado.
texts.en:
Nubia Fernández C. is 46, and she lives in the Campestre de Cartagena de Indias neighborhood. She sells hair products and cosmetics in her business, which is called El Punto de La Belleza. She is married and has two daughters, 16 and 18 years old. Her loan for 2,000,000 COP will be invested in working capital to buy hair products and cosmetics like creams, sunscreen, and shampoos. She will also use the money to enhance her women’s accessories like necklaces and bracelets that her family designs. This is her first loan with the Fundación, and she wants her business to keep growing. She wants it to become recognized as the place to go to get everything needed to create a good image. As she wants to create her own brand of accessories that she designs, her main challenge is to strengthen this line and position it in the market. She learned to work with hair products when she was a commercial advisor in an important business. With her effort and tenacity she started to work independently. She started with a display case. Then, when she had more experience, she moved to a place located very close to her house in the country neighborhood. The move allowed this small businesswoman to enjoy more time with her family. She is now her own boss. Above all, she goes with her daughters to practice their favorite sport, skating. Through this activity she has gotten to know the mothers of their friends, and she has increased the number of customers she has. The business is located close to the sporting places where they practice this discipline. She has involved her family in her business. She wants this to be a great business. Therefore, when she heard her friends talking about the Fundación, she thought of her dream of continuing to grow and expanding her range of products. Keeping in mind that her daughter started studying business administration, and that she also designs accessories like necklaces, earrings, and bracelets, she started selling them. They have been widely accepted among her customers. Nubia saw that her daughter had a talent for designing jewelry. So, she is promoting her business spirit. That is why she hopes to be helped with a loan, to get ahead with her proposal. She will use her dynamic nature to be able to meet the challenges of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair products and cosmetics like creams, sunscreen, shampoo, and to boost the part of her business with women's accessories like neckalces and bracelets that her family designs

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
María Cruz tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo ya a sus tres hijos en el sector Muy Finca, una zona rural netamente dedicada a labores agrícolas y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especificamente aves de corral. Ella cría mayormente pavos en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los vende a los negociantes que visitan regularmente el lugar. Este negocio le ayuda a solventar los gastos diarios del hogar, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

María Cruz desea mejorar la calidad de las aves que comercializa para así poder obtener mayores ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y que siempre entrega todo de si para sacar adelante a los suyos. Las personas que la conocen la estiman mucho y la consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
María Cruz, 40, is married and living with her husband and their three children in the Muy Finca area, a rural community dedicated to agricultural work, located in the Mochumí district, Lambayeque Province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Her business is raising and selling small animals, specifically penned birds. She mainly raises turkeys in pens located in the rear part of her house, and sells them to the businesspersons who come regularly to this place. This business helps her to take care of the daily household expenses, since her husband's income as an agricultural worker are not sufficient to cover them. María Cruz hopes to improve the quality of the birds that she sells, in order to earn greater profits. For this reason, she sees the need of requesting a loan of $300 for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to use to purchase a balanced feed in order to achieve her objective. She is quite a responsible woman who always gives 100% of herself to get her family ahead. The people who know her think very highly of her, considering her somebody they can put their trust in.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 34 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Anteriormente se dedicaba a su hogar, sin embargo el sueldo de su esposo, que trabaja como cerrajero, no le daba abasto para mantener su familia. Es por eso que ayudaba a bordar a una vecina, y con el correr del tiempo y con la ayuda de su esposo, puede ella ahora realizar sus propios bordados, por lo que le fue bien este trabajo, es así que lleva cinco años, teniendo dos personas que le ayudan a bordar, pagándoles un porcentaje por su trabajo. María esta contenta con lo que hace, aplicando bordados a los polos, eso la mantiene muy ocupada,  hilando y cosiendo. Ahora con la habilidad que adquirido en estos años, puede ahora elaborar rápidamente estos bordados, dándole más ventaja en las ganancias. En el futuro, ella y su esposo, anhelan instalar una cerrajería, a la vez independizarse con su negocio, ya que espera ofrecer un mejor beneficio a sus hijos. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP, en donde se compromete a cumplir puntualmente sus pagos, puesto que desea contar con nuevos crédito mas adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar diversos colores de hilos, para que pueda terminar a tiempo los bordados que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
María is 34, married, and living with her husband and their three children in the home of her in-laws. Previously she worked in the home, but her husband's wage as a locksmith did not provide enough to support the family. This is why she helped a neighbor to embroider, and over time and with the help of her husband, now she creates her own embroideries. This work has been going well for her, over the last 5 years, with two persons helping with the embroidery, paying them a percentage for their work. María is happy with what she does, embroidering polo shirts, which keeps her very busy threading and sewing. Now, with the abilities she has acquired in these years, she can rapidly create these embroideries, giving her an advantage in her earnings. In the future, she and her husband hope to install a locksmith shop, becoming independent businesspersons, hoping to provide greater advantages to their children. This is her first loan through MFP; she commits herself to punctual payments, since she hopes to have additional credit in the future. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy various colors of thread, so she can complete her current embroidery projects in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase embroidery thread

loans.name: El Clavel Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Clavel está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Yohana del Socorro Velásquez L. de 24 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en alimentos fritos. Ella inicio hace cinco años con la venta de helados, frescos y pan y conforme fue creciendo empezó a realizar tacos, enchiladas, tajadas con queso hasta crear su negocio.

Sus compañeros de grupo Ever Antonio C. comercializa piñas y naranjas y Maricela Auxiliadora F. tiene una pequeña fritanga. Estos invertirán el préstamo en mejorar sus negocios con la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The El Clavel group is composed of three hard-working persons. One is señora Yohana del Socorro Velásquez L., 24, who has a popular restaurant specializing in fried foods. She started five years ago selling frozen treats, soft drinks, bread and the like, and as she grew she started making tacos, enchiladas, and cheese tajadas to develop her business. Her group companions are Ever Antonio C., who sells pineapples and oranges, and Maricela Auxiliadora F. who also has a small fried food stand. They will invest the loan funds to improve their businesses, purchasing raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
el grupo Luz Divina esta ubicado en la colonia los Llanos del Tablon en la ciudad de Danli, departamento de El Paraiso, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
la sra. Celsa de Jesus M. T. se dedica al comercio desde hace cinco años, su actividad principal es Pulpería y moler Maíz.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle principal de la Colonia Los Llanos del Tablón, sus clientes potenciales son los vecinos de la misma colonia donde ella reside.
Doña Celsa, tiene gran cantidad de ventas al crédito, ya que la mayoría de las personas son obreras que trabajan en fincas de Tomates y Chiles Dulce ubicadas en ese sector.
Doña Celsa, es casada y de su matrimonio dependen tres hijos a los cuales le brinda los estudios, vestuario y todo lo que necesiten.
Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio, ya que posee un carrito en el cual sale a comprar y vender productos.

la sra. Maria Marleny B. G. tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de granos básicos (Maíz y Frijoles), venta de paletas, chocobananos y enchiladas. Dicha actividad la realiza en su casa de habitación.
Doña María B. vende a diario los frijoles, maiz, las paletas y los chocobananos, pero los días sábados y domingos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de enchiladas.
La Sra. B., utilizara el credito para comprar granos basicos (maiz y frijoles.)
Maria vive en unión libre, su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura y es maestro de construcción de vivienda (albañil) es madre de cuatro hijos los cuales dependen a un 100% de su matrimonio.

la sra. Eva Zulema M. se dedica a la venta de comidas (almuerzos), la elaboración de Pinol y venta de Arroz de Maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años. Eva sale a vender su producto de manera ambulante y su punto estratégico para la venta es la Terminal de buses de esta ciudad, doña Eva se sube a los autobuses a ofrecer sus productos y son los viajeros los que más compran el mismo.
Doña Eva es soltera y ya no tiene personas que dependan de ella, todo lo que su negocio le genera solo es para cubrir sus gastos personales.
eva utilizara el credito para comprar los materiales para hacer su pinol, arroz de maiz y sus almuerzos.
texts.en:
The Luz Divina group is located in the los Llanos del Tablon neighborhood in the city of Danli, El Paraiso department. Their different activities are listed below: Mrs. Celsa de Jesus M. T. has been a merchant for five years. Her main activity is a local store and grinding corn. Her business is located on the main street of the Los Llanos del Tablón neighborhood. Her potential clients are the neighborhood from the same neighborhood where she lives. Celsa has a lot of sales on credit, since most of the people are workers from the tomato and sweet chile farms in that area. Celsa is married and there are three children in her family for whom she provides education, clothing and anything they need. Her husband works in farming and as a merchant, since he has a little cart he uses to purchase and sell products. Maria Marleny B. G. has been a merchant for three years. Her main activity is selling basic grains (corn and beans), lollipops, chocobananas and enchiladas. She does this activity from her home. María B. sells beans, corn, lollipops and chocbananas weekdays. On Saturdays and Sundays, she makes and sells enchiladas. Mrs. B. will use the loan to buy basic grains (corn and beans). Maria has a common law marriage. Her partner works in agriculture and he is a mason. She is a mother of four children who are 100% dependent on her and her husband. Eva Zulema M. sells food (lunches). She makes toasted corn meal and sells corn with rice. She has been doing this for five years. Eva goes out to sell her product as a street vendor and her strategic spot is at the city bus terminal. Eva gets onto the buses to sell her products and the passengers are the ones who buy the most. Eva is single and has no dependents. Everything she makes from her business is to cover personal expenses. Eva will use the loan to buy the ingredients for her toasted corn meal, the corn with rice and her lunches.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, sugar, lard, oil, corn, corn with rice, bread, soda

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maritza del Socorro J. Ramírez, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, tiene la edad de 55 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad y casados. Ella trabaja como cocinera en casas particulares.

Solicita un  préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para la edificación de un cuarto en su vivienda, esto le permitirá mejores comodidades de habita de la familia, ella es una mujer sola y que ha conseguido brindarles la educación a sus hijos gracias a su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Maritza del Socorro J. Ramírez lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is 55 years old. She is a single mother of three, who are all grown and married. She works as a cook in private homes. Maritza is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to build another room in her home. A new room will allow for greater comfort in her family's living situation. She is a single woman and was able to give her a children an education due to her own effort.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room in her house

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
CAMINANDO JUNTOS
Sabina es L. representante del grupo Caminando Juntos, las socias L. escogieron porque es una persona que inspira confianza ademas es puntual y responsable. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. comida en su casa pero eso no es sufieciente para elL. asi que aperturo una bodega en donD. atienD. con sus 6 hijos. ElL. es una pieza fundamental en su familia asi como tambien en el grupo.
Evelyn es L. tesorera D. grupo, se dedica a L. elaboracion, creación y venta D. dibujos para tareas en los colegios  D. L. zona D. Huaycan con diferentes tipos D. materiales, asi; como corospum cartulina y otros. ElL. tiene mucha demanda en las meses D. abril y mayo que es L. epoca del comienzo del año escolar. L. social invertira el prestamo para incrementar su stock D. materiales.
Con mucho esfuerzo Sara pudo adquirir maquinas D. costura y remalle para su propio taller D. confecciones donD. trabaja realizando servicios para terceros y asi poder mantener a su familia. Sus 3 hijos son su motor para salir adelante. Su actual pareja L. apoya  con  los gastos en casa ya que es viuda D. su primer compromise.  El objetivo D. Sara es poder brindar trabajo a sus compañeras en su taller. 
L. Alcancia Comunal D. L. zona alta D. Huaycan esta conforme con los creditos y desean continuar trabajando con KIVA y EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
Sabina is the representative of the group Caminando Juntos ("Walking Together"). The group members chose her as representative because she is someone who inspires confidence in addition to being punctual and responsible. Sabina works selling food from her home but it does not proviD. sufficient income, so she opened a bodega where she works with her six children. She is a fundamental part of her family as she is in the group. Evelyn is the group's treasurer. She develops, creates, and sells the drawings used in homework at local schools in the Huaycan zone. They are done in different types of material, such as plastic foam and cardboard among others. There is high demand for her work in April and May, since it is the beginning of the school year. Evelyn will invest her loan in buying more materials for her work. Through a lot of effort, Sara was able to get sewing and mending machines for her dressmaking shop. By doing services for third parties, she is able to support her family. Her three children are her motivation for getting ahead. Her current partner helps her with household costs as she is a widow from her first engagement. Sara's goal is to be able to proviD. work for her companions in her shop. The Huaycan area's community piggy bank is happy with its loans and hopes to continue working with Kiva and Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for businesses

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana R., vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca, llamada Chinas Unidas, tiene dos niños los cuales se encuentran bajo su custodia, fue operada de la vesicula, y tras esto se le ha dificultado la convivencia diaria con sus hijos por sus achaques, que le han impedido una vida cotidiana, su compañero de vida le apoya económicamente

Es por esta razón que solicita un pestamo para la culminación de la construcción de su hogar, especificamente desea construir un muro en la parte lateral de su casa, esto les favorezera  a la familia a habitar en un espacio mas digno y sobretodo seguro para todos.
texts.en:
Ana R. lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She works in a company in a tax-free zone called Chinas Unidas. She has two children who are under her care. She had gallbladder surgery, which has made her family life difficult because her ailments hindered her daily life. Her partner supports her economically. For this reason, Ana is asking for a loan to finish building her house. Specifically, she wants to build a wall on the side part of her house. This will allow the family to live in a more dignified and--more than anything--safe space for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building side wall in home

loans.name: Fautino

texts.es:
El Sr. Fautino P. M. tiene diez años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de colas, ganchos para pelo, ganchos de ropa, binchas, colas para pelo y ropa nueva.
esta actividad la lleva a cabo los días jueves y viernes en la feria del agricultor, mas conocida en nuestra ciudad como el “Mayoreo”.
Los días de semana don Fautino sale a vender de manera ambulante a diferentes lugares como ser El Paraíso, Santa María Jamastran, Teupasenti y Trojes.
Don Fautino es una persona luchadora a pesar de su edad ya que él pasa de los 75 años, pero tiene muchas ganar de trabajar y seguir adelante.
El Sr. Pérez vive en unión libre. Utilizara el credito para la compra de ganchos, ropa, colas.
texts.en:
Mr. Fautino P. M. has been a merchant for ten years and his main activity is selling ribbons, barrettes, clothes hangers, clips, hair ribbons and new clothes. He does this activity Thurdays and Fridays in the agricultural fair, better known in our city as the 'Mayoreo". On weekdays Fautino sells as a street vendor in different places such as El Paraíso, Santa María Jamastran, Teupasenti and Trojes. Fautino is a fighter despite his age; he is over 75. He has a lot of enthusiasm to work and get ahead. Mr. Pérez has a common law marriage. He will use the loan to buy hangers, clothes, and ribbons.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ribbons, hooks, clips,  t-shirts, clothes hangers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maryol Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Maryol Marcelina, ella tiene 28 años, tiene 1 hijos de 4 años que está a su cargo. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en esto incluye venta de ropa de cama, camisas, pantalones, los cuales distribuye generalmente de forma ambulante, también en su casa realiza ventas, las cuales en su mayoría son a crédito. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Este negocio le ha servido como fuente de ingresos para ella y para la manutención de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercaderías principalmente ropa usada ya que debido a la crisis es la que más se vende. Ella posee el sueño de hacer que el negocio crezca lo suficiente para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maryol Marcelina is 28 years old and takes care of her 4-year-old child. She sells new and used clothes, which include bedclothes, shirts, and pants, which she generally distributes by foot. She also makes sales from her home, which are mostly done on credit. She began this business because she didn't have a way to support herself, nor could she find work. This business has served her well as a source of income and a way to provide for her family. She is requesting a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, particularly used clothing since this is what sells the most due to the crisis. She dreams of growing her business enough so that in the not so distant future, she can make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 57 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Pacora, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la renovación de calzado desde hace mas de 10 años. Posee un taller instalado en la vivienda de su madre y alli atiende a los clientes que recurren a solicitar sus servicios, la experiencia que posee en el rubro ha hecho que su negocio tenga una clientela fija que gusta de la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo. Esta es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para solventar sus gastos personales, hacerse cargo de sus hijos y de su madre, que es de edad avanzada.

Debido a la constante demanda por sus servicios Eduardo tiene que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirir materiales que le permitan seguir realizando su labor. A pesar de que cuenta con un stock permanente, siempre tiene que renovarlo. Precisamente por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en hilos, zuelas y piezas de cuero.

Eduardo es un hombre bastante trabajador y que se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes y de las personas que lo conocen. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de realizar sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 57-years-old and has 2 children. He lives with his mother in the Pacora district of the Lambayeque province, which is one hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been repairing footwear for more than 10 years. He has a workshop set up in his mother's house and there he receives customers who have need of his services. His experience in this area has led to his business having a regular client base who appreciates the quality of his work. This is the only source of income that he has to cover his personal expenses and to take care of his children and mother, who is elderly. Due to the constant demand for his services, Eduardo has to constantly travel to the city of Chiclayo to obtain materials which allow him to continue doing his work. Despite the fact that he relies on a permanent stock, he always has to refill it. It is for exactly this reason that he feels the need to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to invest in thread, soles and pieces of leather. Eduardo is a very hardworking man and he has earned the trust of his customers and of the people who know him. He has previously worked with our institution and demonstrated timeliness and responsibility when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoemaker materials to maintain his business.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 43 años, es separada y tiene cinco hijos, los tres mayores ya tiene su propia familia y elL. vive con los dos menores y su madre, en un populoso barrio en el cono sur D. L. ciudad D. Lima. L. historia D. Giovanna se inicia una tarD. cuando sentada en L. puerta D. su casa, junto a su madre, tejía las chompas D. sus hijos pequeños porque no tenía dinero para comprarles. Entonces pasó por allí una mujer extranjera y se enamoró D. sus tejidos. DesD. entonces pactaron que elL. le daría L. lana y los modelos y Giovanna se encargaría D. tejer. Lleva 15  años tejiendo juntamente con su madre en un sofá D. su casa cuidando que los hilos no se ensucien, ya que las prendas serán exportadas a Italia. Le va muy bien y está muy contenta con lo que hace, ya que con esas ganancias mantiene y educa a sus hijos, asimismo con los excedentes viene invirtiendo en L. compra D. productos D. belleza, ya que su finalidad es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para cubrir L. educación D. sus hijos en el futuro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, donD. hace el compromiso D. pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y cumplir todos los acuerdos D. su grupo, ya que su anhelo es contar con posteriores préstamos. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará agujas D. tejer en diversos números y con el resto adquirirá más productos D. belleza.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 43 years old, separated and has five children. The three oldest have their own families and she lives with the two minors and her mother in a highly populated neighborhood in the southern part of Lima. Giovanna's story begins one afternoon when she was sitting in the doorway of her home with her mother. She was knitting sweaters for her young children because she didn't have the money to buy them instead. Then, a stranger passed by and fell in love with her knitting. Since then, they agreed that she would give her yarn and patterns and Giovanna would take care of the knitting. She has spent 15 years knitting with her mother on the sofa in their home, making sure the thread does not get dirty, since the garments will be exported to Italy. She feels good about her work and is content with what she does, since these earnings help proviD. for her children. Likewise, she invests the surplus in the purchase of beauty products, since her goal is to increase her income in order to pay for her children's education in the future. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has promised to pay on time for her knitting needles of various sizes and she will buy more beauty products with the rest of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy knitting needles and beauty products.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
la sra. Adriana B. A. se dedica a la caficultura, tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Cuando Adriana supo de este proyecto de instalacion de plantas electricas las cuales les iban a generar energia electrica en su casa de habitacion se mostro muy interesada y a la vez muy feliz ya que tiene 25 años de vivir en esa comunidad y nunca penso contar con luz electrica en su casa y poder tener algunos aparatos electricos y por las noches tener iluminada su casa facilitando las labores domesticas y de estudio de los niños por la noche permitiendoles aprovechar el tiempo ya que por los momentos se alumbraban con un candil o lamparas de gas, candelas o leña. ahora sera muy diferente nos comento doña Adriana pues no tendremos que levantarnos a obscuras por las noches o madrugada.
antes tampoco se imagino que tendria telefono y con los celulares ya tienen este servicio, el problema que tenian era que no podian cargar los aparatos pero ahora su calidad de vida esta mejorando con todos estos servicios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana B. A. grows coffee. She has been doing this for more than 30 years. When Adriana found out about this project of installing electrical plants that were going to generate electricity in her house, she was very interested and happy. She has been living in the community for 25 years and she never thought she would have electricity in her house and be able to have appliances and illumination at night. This makes her domestic labors and the children's studies easier. They can take advantage of the time in the evening, since at the moment they use oil or gas lamps, candles or firewood. Now it will be very different, Adriana tells us. They will no longer have to get up in the dark at night or in the early morning. She also never imagined that she would have a telephone and with cell phones they have that service now. The problem was that they were unable to charge the phones, but now her quality of life is improving with all of these services.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a solar plant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando, tiene 34 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, él socio estudió en la escuela de bellas artes del cusco “Diego Q. Ttito” y se especializó en pintura al óleo, el socio es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que las ingenió para tener ingresos económicos propios por lo cual decidió abrir un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde confecciona su arte, el también vende sus pinturas en un pequeño espacio del las galerías “Intipakari”. Ya son 14 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales pre determinados, acuarelas y pintura contemporánea. El anhelo del socio es tener tres galerías donde pueda vender sus pinturas, comprarse un carro y estudiar ciencias políticas.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rolando is 34 years old and belongs to the "Sacsayhuaman" communal bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association. He studied at the Cusco School of Fine Arts “Diego Q. Ttito” and majored in oil painting. He is an enterprising and hardworking young man who has harnessed his skills to earn his own income. Thus, he decided to open a small shop in his home where he does his art. He also sells his paintings in a small space at the "Intipakari" galleries. He has spent 14 years working at his craft and things have gone well for him. He requests this loan to buy predetermined materials, watercolors and contemporary paint. His aspiration is to have three galleries where he can sell his paintings, to buy a car and to study political science. He is thankful for the opportunity granted through this organization and promises to adhere to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy predetermined materials, watercolors and contemporary paint.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Estefania  De Jesus

texts.es:
Estefanía P. R. , tiene 61 años y vive en el barrio Los Calamares al suroccidente de Cartagena de Indias; ella está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 30 años, que actualmente se encuentran trabajando; tiene un negocio de Confecciones para el cual  solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000, pues necesita reparar 2 máquinas de coser semiindustriales y adquirir insumos como telas, botones ojales, de modo que pueda cumplir oportunamente con pedidos que tiene ;  este es su  cuatro créditos con la Fundación Santo Domingo, inició con $1.400.000 gradualmente aumentado hasta llegar al que actualmente aplica.   
Inició su negocio en el año 1978 cuando adquirió su primera máquina de coser aprovechando la liquidación que recibió de una empresa de camarones , Estefanía  aprendió estudiando confección de ropa interior, ejercicio que le sirvió para elaborar unos trabajos pequeños a sus amigas y vecinas; al quedar sin trabajo por efectos de un despido masivo y sin la  posibilidad de acceder a una pensión , decidió no dejarse vencer por esta situación y se dedicó a la confección pero continuó capacitándose en  elaboración de adornos y muñecos navideños, lencería, elaboración de ropa interior y en conjunto esta formación le ha permitido salir adelante, pues su negoció ha sido fuente importante  de manutención de su familia. Sueña con aprovechar al máximo los conocimientos que tiene,  por eso más adelante quiere abrir diversas líneas de productos que actualmente no maneja y con los ingresos que este negocio le siga proporcionando,  poco a poco construirá el segundo piso de su vivienda. Su mayor desafío lo presentó al inicio del negocio porque comenzó con muy poco capital  y cuando trabajó muy duro para conseguir su clientela.
texts.en:
Estefanía P. R. is 61 years old and lives in the Los Calamares neighborhood, southwest of Cartagena de Indias. She is married and has 2 children who are 20 and 30 years old and are working. She has an apparel business for which she is requesting a loan of $2,000.00 because she needs to repair 2 semi-industrial sewing machines and buy supplies such as fabric and eyelet buttons, so that she can fill orders in a timely manner. This is her fourth loan with the Santo Domingo Foundation. She began with $1,400.00 and gradually increased it until arriving at what she is currently applying for. She began her business in 1978, when she bought her first sewing machine, having taken advantage of a shrimp business sale. Estefanía learned by studying how to make undergarments, a skill that has served her well when completing small jobs for her friends and neighbors. When she was left without a job due to a massive layoff and without access to a pension, she decided not to be defeated by this situation and she started working on apparel and also making Christmas ornaments and dolls, lingerie, and undergarments. This training has allowed to her to progress, since her business has been an important means of providing for her family. She dreams of taking full advantage of the knowledge she possesses and in the future she wants to offer additional product lines, which she currently cannot manage. With the income that this business will continue to provide, little by little she will build a second floor for her home. She faced her greatest challenge at the outset because she began with very little capital and worked very hard to establish a customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair 2 semi-industrial sewing machines and buy supplies such as fabric and eyelet buttons

loans.name: Janeth Jakeline

texts.es:
Janeth V. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su rica cultura, sus tradiciones, sus iglesias y su Centro Histórico, nuestra socia es una persona alegre y carismática. Tiene como profesión Tecnóloga Medica en rehabilitación respiratoria la  cual ejerce solo cuando se le presenta una emergencia ya que  se dedicó  a la picantería de su madre  de jueves a domingo y el horario depende de la cantidad de pedidos que tenga para entregar. 

Janeth es soltera tiene 40 años de edad  vive con sus padres en su casa  propia donde ayuda económicamente en los gastos del hogar, su papá por su avanzada edad solo ayuda en el cuidado de sus nietos que quedaron huerfanos porque su  madre  falleció  hace ocho años producto de un cáncer y entre los abuelos y la tía buscan sacarlos adelante.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y con el dinero del crédito  va a comprar arroz, azúcar, papas, aceite, etc. para la preparación de su exquisita comida  y un poco para solventar algunos gastos de su casa,  tiene como meta arreglar poco a poco  la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Janeth is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank and lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its rich culture, its traditions, its churches, and its historical center. Our associate is a happy charismatic person. She is a respiratory medical technician by profession, but is called upon only during emergencies, since she has dedicated herself to taking care of her mother's errands and other needs from Thursdays to Sundays and her schedule depends on how many request she must fill. Janeth is single. She is 40 years old and lives with her parents in their home, whom she helps with the household expenses. Her father, because of his age, is only able to help with the care of his grandchildren. They were orphaned when their mother passed away eight years ago due to cancer. She and their grandparents do everything they can to help them get ahead. She is in her second cycle and she will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc, in order to prepare delicious food and also use a bit of the money to pay some household expenses. Her goal is to fix up her parents' home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de su abuelo, ya que sus padres son separados.Desde que tiene quince años, vende ambulatoriamente en el mercado de la zona donde vive. Y durante este año se ha propuesto  trabajar formalmente, por esta razón  alquiló un puesto dentro de este mercado, en sociedad con un familiar,  por lo tanto él paga  $ 70.0 dólares y el resto su socio. Vende los productos de acuerdo  a la temporada, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.  Como en el Perú  se inicia la época escolar, optó por vender  mochilas, por ser  muy cotizadas durante  estos meses, y  así sucesivamente cambiará su mercadería. A Héctor le gusta adquirir  sus cosas  propias, y  sabe lo rentable que es comercializar en su negocio,  y con las ganancias que obtenga  juntará  dinero y postulará a la marina, ya que su mayor anhelo es servir a su patria.Es el primer préstamo  que tiene, y agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero solicitado, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, y a los integrantes de su grupo, promete no defraudarlos, ya que anhela contar con posteriores préstamos, para seguir creciendo como empresario.Con el dinero solicitado  comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, para continuar  en el mercado competitivo de las ventas.
texts.en:
Héctor, age 19, is unmarried and has lived with his grandmother ever since his parents separated. From the age of 15, he has been a street vendor at his local market. This year, he has set to working in a formal manner, and with this in mind, he has rented a space at that market along with an acquaintance where he pays $70, and his partner pays the rest. From 9 in the morning until 8 at night, he sells products that are in demand according to the season. Since the school year is beginning in Peru, he has opted to sell backpacks as they are heavily requested in these months, and from here on, he will be changing his selection of merchandise. Hector likes to obtain his own things, and he knows how profitable it will be to market his business. With the earnings he will make, he plans save his money and join the Navy, as he has a great desire to serve his homeland. The is the first loan he will be granted, and he thanks all of the people who will make it possible for him to realize this request. Also, he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner, and to the fellow members of his group, he promises not to disappoint them, since he is counting on obtaining future loans in order to continue growing as a businessman. With these requested funds, he plans to buy a larger quantity of goods in order to keep his sales competitive at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Kanyinya Beekeepers Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
T. Philmon is 34 years old and is the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is a friendly, hardworking and determined man who is married with two wives with seven children aged 14 to 6 years and all in primary schools. Philmon also helps to take care of three dependents.

Philmon has operated a drugstore in Kanyinya A trading centre for thirteen years. Ever since he started his drugstore, his business has progressed and he has been able to make 300,000/= as monthly profits.

Philmon says that he has been able to attract his customers because of the good services offered and he would like to continue having a stable and successful business as well as a well-established family.

Philmon needs a loan to be able to increase the stock in his business by buying more drugs for resale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for increased sales

loans.name: Nerys Amarilis

texts.es: Nerys Amarilis tiene  26 años, es casada.  tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 4 años, por lo que aquí ofrece productos del consumo del hogar por lo que el inicio poco a poco pues los financiamientos fueron lo más importante para llevar a cabo su objetivo, con las ganancias que obtenía logro obtener mucho más productos, por lo que su negocio le ayudo mucho ahora tiene mucha experiencia con esta actividad. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y jugos. Ella sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nerys Amarilis is 26-years-old and married. She has a small grocery store located in her home. She began her business four years ago and was able to start it bit by bit with loans which were the most important part of achieving her goal. With the money she obtained she was able to purchase more products and this has helped her business a lot over the years. Nerys is asking for a loan so she can buy products such as basic grains, sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, and juices. She dreams of being able to increase her income and have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy grains, sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, and juices

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, el señor Carlos L. es propietario de su negocio de venta de carne y abarrotes donde los ofrece a diario a los clientes que visitan el mercado.

Él actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de vacas para proceder al destace y extraer la carne para su respectiva comercialización. Con el crédito se beneficiará grandemente y garantizará llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr.Carlos L. is the owner of a store in the wholesale market of Managua where he sells meat and groceries to the customers that go see him. He is currently asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of cows for slaughter and meat for sale. The loan will benefit him greatly as it will help him provide for his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Joaquin Exequiel

texts.es:
el sr. Joaquin Exequiel L. T. tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de comidas.
El Sr. L. tiene un restaurante recreativo ubicado en el Municipio de Jacaleapa a orillas de la carretera Panamericana el cual opera bajo el nombre de “TIPICOS EL CARAL” donde vende una gran variedad de comidas como ser: Almuerzos, Cenas, Pescado, Carne Asada, Chilaquiles, Tajaditas, Enchiladas, Papas, Sopa de Jaiba, etc…
El lugar en donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio es de un ambiente agradable, saludable y de muy buena higiene.
La atención especial que les brindan a sus clientes es una caracteristica principal de su negocio.
El Sr. L. nos comento que sus clientes potenciales son personas de la ciudad de Danlí y su mayor volumen de ventas los tiene los fines de semana, ya que los fines de semana pone un ambiente a su negocio contratando un sonido musical los días sábados por la noche; además de eso para esta época de verano como el local es amplio instala unas piscinas para que los clientes puedan comer y bañar a la mismo tiempo. 
El Sr. Joaquín vive en unión libre y su compañera de hogar le ayuda en el negocio a preparar las comidas que venden, tienen una niña la cual esta empezando con sus estudios primarios. 

Don Joaquín utilizara el credito en la compra de 20 sillas plásticas, 1 DVD, y una piscina grande, para darle una mejor presentación a su negocio y que los clientes se sientan satisfechos por el servicio que les brinda.
texts.en:
Joaquin has been selling food for tha past three years. He has a restaurant, called “Tipicos El Caral,” located in Jacaleapa alongside the Pan-American Highway. He sells a variety of meals such as breakfast, dinners, fish, grilled meats, chilaquiles, chops, enchiladas, potatoes, crab soup, etc… His location is clean and friendly and the special attention that he gives his clients is one of its characteristics. He tells us that his potential customers are people from the city of Danlí and that he makes most of his sales on the weekend. He hires a band to play on Saturday nights. And, since summer is coming, he also plans to add some pools so that his customers can eat and sit in the pools at the same time. Joaquin lives with his domestic partner and she helps him prepare the food they sell. They have a daughter who is beginning elementary school. He will use the money from this loan to buy 20 plastic chairs, one DVD player, and a large pool, in order to present a better impression so that his customers feel more satisfied with the service.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chairs, DVD player, pool

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lidia Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia C. se dedica a elaborar tortillas en el Mercado Iván Montenegro en Managua donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella elabora las ricas tortillas y son puestas a la venta para que sus clientes las lleguen a comprar.

Ella actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de materia prima como maíz, carbón y leña y por tal razón solicita el crédito para así proceder con la elaboración de las tortillas en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia C. works making tortillas in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. She goes there very early every morning to prepare the delicious tortillas and sell them to the customers who come to buy. Currently she needs to purchase basic ingredients such as corn, coal and kindling. That is why she is requesting the loan- to continue making the tortillas in her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coal, kindling and corn

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana J. tiene su propio negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua. Ella inició el negocio desde hace 20 años y ha ido mejorando su condición ya que ella es una dama muy trabajadora.

Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de los repuestos de bicicleta para continuar ofertándolos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana J. has her own business; she sells bicycle spare parts in the Iván Montenegro Market of Managua. She started this business 20 years ago, and ever since she has been working hard to improve her economic situation. Juana is requesting a loan for the purchase of bicycle spare parts so that she can continue to sell them, thus allowing her to get by and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle spare parts

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La señora  Maria Rosario C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad emblemática por su hermosa arquitectura, su parque natural  protegido como el Cajas, su gastronomía, su gente, etc. atractivos turísticos de ésta hermosa ciudad del callejón interandino.

María Rosario  tiene cincuenta  años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal  concibió cinco hijos que se encuentran de 31, 29, 27, 24, 16 años, los  cuatro primeros  son casados y viven independientes  en sus hogares, su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo no se encuentra en el país el viajó  al extranjero para brindar  a su familia un mejor futuro y gracias al esfuerzo conjunto cuenta con su casa propia de lo que se siente muy orgullosa.

Ella es una mujer muy activa le gusta criar pollos que luego los  vende a sus vecinos de la comunidad y también para el consumo de su hogar compartiendo con las actividades propias de su hogar,  es una señora muy carismática y alegre y lleva  tres años en su banco comunal, con los créditos accedidos  inició su negocio de pollos y con el nuevo credito solicitado comprará más crías de pollos, vitaminas y su alimento para criarlos y venderlos.
 
Su sueño es ver que  todos sus hijos  se superen en el ámbito personal y económicamente.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario C. is a member of the "Mujeres con Decisión" community bank. She lives in the urban city of Cuenca, a place known for its beautiful architecture, protected El Cajas nature park, culinary offerings, people, etc. -- tourist attractions in this beautiful Andean city. María Rosario is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children ages 31, 29, 27, 24, and 16. The first four children are married and live in their own homes. Her last child attends a city high school. Her husband doesn't live in the country; he traveled abroad in order to provide the family with a better future. Thanks to their joint efforts, she is very proud to have a house to call her own. She is a very active woman who enjoys raising poultry that she later sells to neighbors in her community and also uses for home consumption. In addition to taking part in household activities, she is a very charismatic and joyful woman who has participated for the last three years in her community bank. With the loans she has been granted, she began her chicken business, and this new loan she is requesting will be used for the purchase of more chicks, vitamins, and chicken feed so as to raise and sell her flock. Her dream is to see all of her children excel in their personal and economic lives.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks, vitamins, and chicken feed

loans.name: Delmi Marbeli

texts.es:
la sra. Delmi Marbeli U. M. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Golosinas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace once años,  es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar ya que sus condiciones de vida son favorables.
También nos comento y nos dimos cuanta a la vez de que ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de las compañías AVON, ARABELLA, ZELSA.
Delmi se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la atención que les brinda, el local es de un ambiente muy agradable e higiénico.
Delmi es casada pero su esposo emigro para USA en busca de mejores condiciones de vida y Delmi nos comento que las remesas que recibe de su esposo han sido para mejorar su casa de habitacion, en la cual viven con sus 2 hijos, ellos ambos jóvenes cursando sus estudios secundarios. 

Doña Delmi, utilizara el  crédito para comprar: refrescos, platos, verduras, carnes etc.
texts.en:
Delmi has been selling snacks out of her home for the past 11 years. It’s evident that she’s been able to manage her business well over the years, as her living conditions have improved. She tells us and we have seen that she also sells products via catalogs, such as Avon, Arabella, and Zelsa. Delmi has been able to gain customers because of the attention she gives them and her place of business has a clean and friendly atmosphere. Delmi is married, but her husband has emigrated to the United States in search of a better life and she tells us that the money she receives from him she uses to make improvements to their home. Her two children live with her and both of them are completing junior high school. She will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, plates, vegetables, meats, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia P. tiene su propio negocio ferretero en el Mercado Iván Montenegro donde ofrece gran variedad de productos de ferretería siendo visitada por los clientes a diario.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de bujías, candelas, lámparas, tomacorrientes, cepos y otros productos. Por esta razón está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en esta compra y de esta manera abastecer a sus clientes con los productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia P. has her own hardware business in the Iván Montenegro Market. She offers a wide variety of hardware products to her customers on a daily basis.

Lidia is currently requesting a loan to buy candlesticks, candles, lamps, sockets, clamps, and other products. By making this investment, she hopes to supply her customers with these products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of hardware products

loans.name: Alonso Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Alonso C. tiene su propio negocio de panadería donde elabora el pan y luego lo distribuye en diferentes mercado de Managua transportándolo en un pequeño microbús.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mantequilla, harina, azúcar y empaque de reposterías para elaborar el pan dulce y el pan simple y así continuar distribuyéndolo para obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Alonso C. has his own bakery business; he bakes bread and then distributes it to various markets in Managua, transporting it in a small microbus. He is currently requesting a loan in order to invest in buying butter, flour, sugar and packages of pastry ingredients to prepare regular and sweet breads. This will allow him to continue distributing his products and obtaining the income he needs to maintain his household.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Carmen Lorena

texts.es:
la sra. Carmen Lorena R. M. tiene tres años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación y en su negocio le ayuda a moler o elaborar las tortillas una hija.
Doña Carmen muele a diario 16 medidas de Maíz mismas que son distribuidas en comedores y pulperías del municipio de Jacaleapa.
Doña carmen vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar trabaja como administrador de una finca de ganado en el departamento de Intibuca, el viaja cada 8 días o cada 15 días para visitar la familia y estar al cuidado de la misma,actualmente tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.

Doña Carmen utilizara el préstamo para comprar 12 sacos de maíz, 20 cargas de leña, 30 bolsas de cal.
texts.en:
Carmen Lorena R. M. has spent three years making and selling corn tortillas from her house. Her daughter helps her to grind the corn and make the tortillas. Carmen grinds 16 measurements of corn every day which are distributed to small restaurants and local grocery stores in the municipality of Jacaleapa. Carmen lives with her de facto, who works as an administrator of a cattle farm in the department of Intibuca. He travels from Intibuca every one to two weeks to visit the family and be looked after by Carmen. At the moment Carmen has two children who depend on her and her de facto. Carmen will use this loan to purchase 12 sacks of corn, 20 loads of firewood and 30 bags of lime.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, lime and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gary Francisco

texts.es:
Gary B. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa es comerciante informal ellos tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años. 

Hace años atrás el padre de Gary tenia una furgoneta y hacia expreso a una escuela, desde pequeño Gary quiso hacer la misma actividad y ser como su padre. Cuando el creció y su padre falleció decidió retomar la actividad de chofer. 

Ahora el tiene una furgoneta expreso trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 11:00 am de lunes a viernes el colegio que hace expreso se llama “Juan Montalvo”. En ocasiones hace viajes para la playa o ciudades del Ecuador. Los caminos no pavimentados son de dificultad para que siga laborando. 

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para el arreglo de la furgoneta y así poderles dar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros. En el futuro quiere afiliarse a una cooperativa de buses.
texts.en:
Gary B., 35, lives in a suburban area in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and is equipped with all basic services. His wife is an informal shopkeeper and together they have to children who are 7 and 5. Years ago, Gary's father had a bus and would drive it express to school. Since he was small, Gary wanted to have the same livelihood and be like his father. When he was grown and his father had passed away, he decided to take over his father's job as a driver.

Now Gary has an express bus that he drives from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 am, Monday through Friday. The school that he drives to is called Juan Montalvo. He also occasionally makes trips to the beach or to other cities in Ecuador. The unpaved roads make it difficult for him to continue working. The loan will be used to fix his bus so that he can provide better service to his passengers. In the future he wants to join a bus cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix his bus

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es: Rossi tiene 36 años, es feliz viviendo con su pareja y su único hijo, en su casa que es propia y hecho de madera, ubicado en un cerro empinado al sur de Lima. Desde hace cuatro años trabaja, como niñera, de una joven pareja profesional, que queda a media hora de su casa, empezando desde las 8.00am de la mañana hasta las 5.00pm de la tarde. Pero antes de ir a trabajar, se levanta muy temprano para dejar listo el almuerzo de su esposo, que trabaja como chofer y a su hijo, que aún esta en etapa escolar. La actividad que realiza, no le es muy pesado, sin embargo anhela tener su propio negocio, es por eso que ella y su esposo se han propuesto comprar un carro, en el cual su pareja lo conduce, es así que continúan hasta la fecha pagando la letra de su vehiculo. Rossi sólo espera que llegue la electrificación a su casa, para dedicarse a vender helados de fruta y gaseosas, y de las ganancias pueda ahorrar para construir su casa y mejorar su condición de vida. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que una vez más, promete ser bien cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Además manifiesta que se lleva bien con sus compañeras de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo derivará para terminar de pagar la letra de su carro, además de dejar en regla todos los documentos, para que pueda trabajar tranquilamente sin tener problemas con el ministerio de transporte.
texts.en:
Rossi is 36 years old and is happily married with one child. She lives in a wooden house that her family owns. It is located on a steep hill to the south of Lima. For about four years she has worked as a nanny for a young professional couple that live a half hour from her house. She works from eight in the morning until five in the evening. She gets up early before she goes to work in order to prepare lunch for her husband who is a driver and her son who is in school. Her work is not very hard but she still would like to have her own business. It is with this goal in mind that they bought a car, which the husband hopes to drive for work. To this date they have paid the loan on this vehicle. Rossi hopes that her house will get electrical service. She would like to sell ice cream, fruit and sodas from her house. She would be able to save her earnings to use to build improvements to her house and in this way improve their lives. This is her sixth loan from MFP. One more time she promises to pay her loan payments. Also she would like to say that she gets along well with the members of the community group. With the loan that she is asking for, she will finish paying the payments on their car. If they finish paying off their loan they will receive documents which will allow them to work without problems from the ministry of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the loan for their car and thus obtain the documents necessary to use the car for work

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, tiene 58 años y tiene ocho hijos. Celia es una madre responsable y trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de artesanía de tipo muñequería, ella tiene un pequeño taller donde confecciona sus productos, ella nos cuenta que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después sale a vender sus productos. Ya son de 8 a 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, la socia esta sacando adelante a sus hijos y quiere darles una profesión para que ellos se puedan defenderse mejor en la vida. Celia nos cuenta que por esta oportunidad le hicieron una contrata de 50 a 100 artesanías para mandar a la ciudad de Lima y en otras ocasiones exportó sus productos al país de Estados Unidos, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tela, algodón, lana y mantas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia, age 58, has 8 children. She is a responsible and hard-working mother who sells handmade dolls. She has a small workshop where she makes her products. She wakes up very early in order to do work around the house and later leaves to sell her wares. It has been 8 or 10 years since she has been in business, and it has served her well thanks to all of the effort she applies to her work. This community bank member has been able to move her children forward and hopes to see them in jobs where they can get by better in their lives. Celia says that this opportunity has given her a contract to send 50 to 100 pieces of work to the city of Lima and, on other occasions, export her products to the United States. She is requesting this loan in order to buy materials for her work, such as cloth, cotton, wool, and fabric. This member considers herself grateful for the opportunity made available in this way and likewise pledges to make her repayments in accordance with her timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the puchase of materials needed for her work -- for example, cloth cotton, wool, and fabric

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora María C. se dedica a elaborar tortillas en el mercado Iván Montenegro donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia la elaboración y venta de estas deliciosas tortillas  que elabora desde hace 18 años.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y así ofertarlas y obtener los respectivos ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora María C. makes tortillas in the Iván Montenegro market, where she goes every day, in the early hours of the morning, to begin the preparation and sale of these delicious tortillas, which she has made for 18 years.

She is now applying for a loan for the purchase of the basic ingredients to make tortillas, so that she can offer them for sale and obtain the income to maintain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Edit

texts.es: Edit, de 43 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, pero solo vive con el último en su casa, ubicada al  sur de la ciudad. Se dedica a venta de frutas frescas, en un mercado de  comerciantes, donde ya cumplió un año. Esta contenta con  sus ventas, porque la actividad le es muy rentable, es  por esta razón que acude a diario a las 3 de la madrugada  al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, para proveerse de frutas, y así ofrecer lo mejor a sus compradores. Todos lo días  atiende en su puesto amablemente, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3  de la tarde, y las ganancias que obtiene  son para la manutención de su hijo. Es por eso que  su hijo le ayuda en las ventas, durante los fines de semana, porque ella debe  dedicarle un tiempo a las labores del  hogar. El mayor anhelo de Edit  es construir su casa, para mejorar su calidad de vida.Es el  octavo préstamo que tiene, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su puesto   de frutas y además quiere comprar una balanza nueva.
texts.en:
Edit is 43 years old and a single mother. She has three children but only the youngest lives at home, located in the south of the city. Edit has been selling fresh fruit in a market for over a year. She is happy with her sales because it's a very profitable business. To ensure this continues, she goes to the city's wholesale market to buy her fruit, so that she can offer the best to her buyers. She serves her customers with care from 7am to 3pm every day, and with her daily earnings she is able to raise her son. Her son helps her at the market on the weekends because Edit needs to attend to the household chores then. Edit's greatest wish is to build her own house to improve her quality of life. This is the eighth loan she has applied for and she is very grateful to everyone who made her previous loans possible so that she could continue working. She plans to invest this loan in re-stocking her stall's fruit supplies, and she would also like to purchase a new set of scales.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and a new set of scales

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa C. se dedica a la venta de bebidas en su cafetín que tiene en el Mercado Mayoreo donde a diario vende café, gaseosas, jugos y agua a los clientes que a diario le visitan.

Ella actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra las bebidas tales como gaseosas, jugos, agua y el café en polvo. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque logra adquirir las bebidas y comercializarlas en su establecimiento y así obtener los ingresos para su mejoramiento del negocio y por ende de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa C. sells beverages in her cafe in the Mayoreo Market. Every day, she sells coffee, soft drinks, juices, and water to the customers who visit her.

She is now applying for a loan which she will invest in purchasing drinks such as soft drinks, juices, water, and instant coffee. The loan will benefit her greatly, because she will be able to acquire beverages and sell them in her cafe and thus obtain income for the improvement of her business and for the use of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de doce años a la confección de vestidos y blusas.
