El confecciona estas prendas para luego vendérselas a un comerciante mayorista que le hace pedidos por temporadas, este negocio es una fuente importante de ingreso a la economía de su familia, adicionalmente cría y vende animales para ayudar a solventar los gastos familiares.

La calidad con la que realiza su trabajo le ha hecho muy conocido y cada vez tiene más pedidos por realizar, por este motivo el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de hilos y telas para seguir confeccionando prendas y poder satisfacer la demanda por sus servicios.

Marcial es un padre responsable y bastante entregado a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza. En la imagen aparece junto a su esposa y una de sus hijas mostrando los productos que suele confeccionar.
texts.en:
Marcial is 37 years old, married and responsible for 3 children. He lives with his family in the Muy Finca sector of the Mochumí disctrict, in the Lambayeque province which is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over twelve years, he has sewn blouses and dresses. He makes the garments and sells them at a major shopping center that assigns him seasonal orders. This business is an important source of income for his family. In addition, he also raises and sells animals in order to help pay the family’s expenses. The quality of his work has made him very well known and each time he receives more and more orders. For this reason he is soliciting a loan of 800 Nuevos solves from Edpyme Alternativa. He is thinking to use the loan to buy thread and fabric in order to continue sewing and be able to satisfy the demand for his services. Marcial is a responsible father and is very devoted to his family. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and consider him a trustworthy person. In the photo, he appears next to his wife and one of his daughters and is showing the products he makes.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dressmaking materials (fabric and thread) in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Jenny Susana

texts.es:
Jenny G. es una de las  socias activas  del banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión, ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca parroquia donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente maíz y legumbres propias de la zona, tienen una gastronomía rica en proteínas como es el consumo del cuy asado.

Nuestra socia vive en la parroquia Ricaurte con su esposo  que labora como chofer de un taxi y sus dos hijos de cuatro   y dos  años respectivamente en una casa arrendada porque aún no cuentan son su casa propia.

Jenny  es maestra en belleza hace ocho años, estudio en una academia de belleza y ahora cuenta con su propio gabinete  donde labora de lunes a sábado de 9 a.m. a 7 p.m.,  es una socia que tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del  banco y siempre está  dispuesta a colaborar con ellas, es socia del banco  hace un año y medio gracias a su mamá que  también es  socia activa y la motivo a formar parte de éste grupo ameno de mujeres,   los créditos le han beneficiado en los gastos de su hogar y con el nuevo crédito solicitado utilizará para los estudios de su hijo que va a primero de educacióm básica  y comprará uniformes y utiles escolares y una parte para adquirir algunos productos de primera necesidad para su hogar.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia que espera sea pronto.
texts.en:
Jenny G. is one of the active members in the Mujeres con Decisión (Women with Determination) Communal Bank which is located in the city of Cuenca. The people of the area are livestock farmers as well as producers of corn and local legumes. The diet is rich in proteins such as roasted guinea pig. Our member lives in the Ricaurte parish district with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and their two children ages 4 and 2. They rent their house because they still don’t have a house of their own. Jenny is a beautician with 8 years of experience. She studied in a beautician academy and now has her own salon where she works Monday through Saturday from 9am to 7pm. She is a member who is great friends with all the other members of the bank and is always available to collaborate with them. She has been a member of the bank for one and a half years thanks to her mother who is also an active member and motivated her to be part of this group of pleasant ladies. The loans have been put towards household expenses and this new loan will be used to acquire a few basic supplies for her home and for her sons schooling. He is in the first year of basic education and needs uniforms and school supplies. Her dream is to have her own house and she hopes it will be soon.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy uniforms and school supplies for her son and a few basic household supplies.

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro, la señora María M. se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como queso y crema siendo comercializados por ella misma a diario desde muy temprano en el mercado.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los lácteos como el queso y la crema para ofertarlo y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Iván Montenegro market, Señora María M. sells dairy products such as cheese and cream, which she prepares for sale herself early in the morning in the market.

She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of dairy products such as cheese and cream so that she can offer them for sale and thus obtain income for the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and cream

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
LOS GIRASOLES
La Alcancia Comunal LOS GIRASOLES  cursa el ciclo 17, esta conformado por 11 socias responsables, puntuales y preocupadas por el bienestar D. sus familias.
Como es el caso D. Dilma ella empezo un negocio en el Mercado D. San Luis el cual quedaba distante D. su casa, pero deseaba estar cerca a sus hijos asi que con la ayuda D. una amiga emprendio el negocio D. venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo este negocio le permitio disponer D. tiempo y estar cerca a sus hijos que para ella era primordial. Con el prestamo obtenido comprara productos en oferta para exibirlos venderlos y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
Hace muchos años Gina estudio cosmetologia oficio que ahora lo pone en practica ya que con la ayuda D. un prestamo pudo aperturar un Centro D. Estetica. Este negocio ayudo mucho a Gina ya que pueD. pagar la educacion y manutencion D. sus 3 hijos 
Luz es casada tiene 7 hijos y al igual que Dilma se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo y D. puerta en puerta en diversos lugares.  Ella y su esposo trabajan para los gastos en casa y tienen un objetivo que es la educacion y bienestar D. su familia.  LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL  LOS GIRASOLES ES LEAL A EDAPROSPO Y VIENEN DESD. EL AAHH  HORACIO ZEVALLOS GAMEZ HASTA LA OFICINA DEL PROGRAMA PROSPERIDAD D. EDAPROSPO UBICADA EN HUAYCAN.
texts.en:
LOS GIRALSOLES (the Sunflowers) The communal bank LOS GIRASOLES is in its 17th cycle and is maD. up of 11 members who are responsible, punctual and concerned for the wellbeing of their families. Such is the case with Dilma. She began a business in the San Luis market which is located far from her house. She wished she could be closer to her children so with the help of a friend she learned how to sell cosmetics via catalogue. This business allows her more time to be near her children which for her is crucial. With the loan she will buy sale items in order to display them and sell them and in this way obtain greater earnings. Gina has been studying the cosmetology traD. for many years and now she is putting it into practice. With the help of a loan, she was able to start an Esthetics Center. This business has help Gina greatly as now she can support her 3 children and pay for their education. Luz is married with 7 children and like Dilma sells cosmetics via catalogue and from door to door in various areas. She and her husband work to meet the household expenses and have their family’s education and wellbeing as their goal. THE COMMUNAL BANK LOS GIRASOLES IS A LOYAL SUPPORTER OF EDAPROSPO AND COMES FROM THE AAHH HORACIO ZEVALLOS GAMEZ TO THE OFFICE OF THE PROSPERITY PROGRAM OF EDAPROPO LOCATED IN HUAYCAN.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Rosandra Maria

texts.es: Rosandra María tiene 37 años de edad y  Tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella. La actividad económica es un taller de costura. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante por lo que siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan con sus preñadas. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues al día tiene 2 o 5 pedidos. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de tijeras, tela, hilo, botones, agujas y encajes. Ella desea seguir adelante con este medio de vida que es lo único que tiene para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old and has three children that are dependents. She works as a seamstress. For more than 22 years she has been working in this business. She began this business in order to progress. She is always worried about providing for her customers’ needs. She gets up very early as each day she has between two and five requests for her services. This is why she is asking for a loan for working capital, which she will use to buy scissors, thread, fabric, buttons, needles and lace. Rosa hopes to progress in this line of work which is the only way that she has to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Reyna Ester

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna Ester L. P. tiene siete años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de donas.
ha sabido administrar su negocio porque se a convertido en una micro empresa donde paga dos empleados para que le ayuden a la produccion de las donas. una mujer que le  ayuda a la elaboración del producto y un hombre quien es el encargado de distribuir el producto.
Su especialidad es fabricar Donas con cerezas tambien fabrica Donas con Azúcar de diferentes tamaños, y los Relámpagos, todas de un sabor exquisito.
Doña Reyna ya tiene los clientes con quienes tiene contrato permanente y todo el producto que elabora solo lo entrega y no sale a venderlo. algunos de sus clientes son las dueñas de casetas de algunos centros de estudio de nuestra ciudad.
Doña Reyna vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar trabaja como guardia de seguridad de la Armería con quien procreo 5 hijos pero 2 ya se le casaron y otros 2 trabajan y ya solo tienen la obligación de una niña a la cual le cubren todos los gastos.

Doña Reyna, invertira el crédito en la compra de: Harina, manteca, azúcar, choco , huevos, polipel, margarina, sal y levadura
texts.en:
Reyna has been making and selling donuts for the past seven years. She has done a good job managing her business, and has grown it into a small company. She has two employees who help her make her products and one gentleman who delivers them. Her specialty is cherry donuts. She also makes different sizes of sugar donuts and éclairs. All are delicious. Reyna has contracts with customers to whom she delivers her entire production, so there is no need for her to go out and sell. Some of her clients own kiosks in schools within the city. She lives with her domestic partner who works as a security guard. They have had five children, two of which are married and on their own, and two others work. They only need to support their daughter. Reyna will use the money from this loan to buy flour, lard, sugar, chocolate, eggs, margarine, salt, and yeast.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Carmen R. se dedica a vender productos varios como productos de plástico y otros productos que también sale a vender ambulantemente con dos canastos donde guarda los productos que vende.

Hoy en día, ella está solicitando un crédito para aprovechar la temporada donde se acerca el verano y requiere la compra de piscinas plásticas para niños ya que en esta temporada muchos son los que van al mar y ella requiere adquirir las piscinas plásticas para venderlas y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market, Señora Carmen R. sells various products, such as plastic products and other products that she can go out and sell as a walking vendor, using the two baskets where she keeps the products that she sells.

Now she is applying for a loan to take advantage of the season when summer is coming. This requires the purchase of plastic pools for children, since in this season many people go to the sea. She needs to acquire plastic pools so that she can sell them and in this way obtain income for her development.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic products

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene L. tiene 50 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Marlene tiene 2 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Marlene es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y se da por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos pues  han sido muy importante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para comprar queso, cuajada, crema y leche. Sueña con mejorar cada día para obtener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Marlene is 50 years old. She is married and has two adult children, both independent. Maria sells milk products. She started this business six years ago, out of need for an income. This is not her first experience with financing and it has been important. This loan will provide working capital that she will use to buy cheese, milk curd, cream, and milk. She hopes to improve things each day in order to obtain another means of income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Veronica De La Concepcion

texts.es: Verónica de la Concepción tiene 33 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la vena de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que le gusta su actividad y conversa con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, colonias, bolsos, calzado y ropa interior. El deseo de Verónica es terminar de construir su casa que por proporcionarla a sus hijos lo necesario no ha podido comprar los materiales.
texts.en:
Verónica de la Concepción is 33 years old and a married woman who has three children under her care. She has been selling merchandise for over seven years; she is a hardworking woman who enjoys her line of work and chatting with her customers. The loan that Verónica is applying for will be used as working capital to purchase clothing, colognes, bags, footwear and underwear. Verónica's wish is to finish building her house; due to having had to provide for her children, up until now she has not had any extra money to purchase the necessary materials to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  María Carmen J. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión, vive en la Urbe de la Ciudad en el sector San Pedro del Cebollar  desde  donde se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, ella es una socia muy alegre y tiene una amistad muy grande con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal,  tiene 40 años esta  casada y en su unión procreó  tres hijos que se encuentran de 21, 15 y 8 años, su primer hijo trabaja como latonero junto a su padre que también realiza esta actividad y estudia en la noche, su hija de 15 años no le gusta el estudio y trabaja como niñera, su último hijo estudia en una escuela de la localidad, aún no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de sus padres en un departamento independiente.

María Carmen se dedica al bordado de polleras labor que realiza hace 13 años y aprendió sóla  y por su habilidad en el bordado,  su horario va de  10 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. de lunes a sábados  y también elabora prendas para  alquiler de ropa  y disfraces hace tres años.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con los  créditos que otorga la Fundación  sintiéndose beneficiada en su negocio y le agradece a su comadre que es quien la invito a este grupo de mujeres luchadoras,  con el dinero de su crédito va a  comprar  telas, hilos, lentejuelas, etc para confeccionar  disfraces para las fiestas tradicionales  como son el pase del niño viajero el 24 de Diciembre,  las procesiones que se realizan el Viernes Santo etc., y  una pequeña parte comprara víveres para su hogar.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio más grande de alquiler de disfraces.
texts.en:
María Carmen is a member of the “Mujeres con Decisión” (Decisive Women) communal bank. She lives in the urban part of the city in the San Pedro del Cebollar sector, where one can look over a large area of the city of Cuenca. She is a very happy associate and is good friends with her fellow associates in the communal bank. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children, ages 21, 15, and 8. Her oldest son works as a brass craftsman/dealer with his father and goes to school in the evenings. Her 15 year old daughter doesn’t like school and works as a nanny. Her youngest son attends a local school. He does not have his own home and lives in a separate apartment at his parents’ home. María Carmen embroiders shirts, something she taught herself and has been doing for the past 13 years. She works from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm, Monday through Saturday. She has also been making clothing items to rent out as costumes for the past three years. She’s been working with the Foundation for three cycles, and feels that it has helped her with her business and she is grateful to her friend who invited to join this group of women. She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, threads, spangles, etc, to make costumes for the traditional festivals like the passing of the travelling child on December 24, the processions that are done on Holy Friday, etc. She will also use a small part to buy provisions for her home. Her goal is to have a larger costume rental business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costume making supplies

loans.name: Alida Sulay

texts.es:
la sra. Alida Sulay L. M. tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la repostería,  su especialidad es la elaboración de donas con azúcar de diferentes tamaño ademas hace donas con chocolate, relámpagos, hamburguesas, pan, semitas, marquesotes y bollitos; todo estos productos de buen tamaño y de buen gusto.
Es notable que durante este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio, tiene un empleado varon que es el que reparte el producto.
El lugar donde elabora sus productos se mantiene con buena higiene.
Doña Alida ya tiene los clientes con quienes tiene contrato permanente y todo el producto que elabora solo lo reparte diariamente. muchos de sus clientes son personas que tienen cafeterias en colegios y escuelas de la ciudad de Danli.
Doña Alida es una mujer Soltera que a trabajado fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos de los cuales ya solo depende uno de ella.

Doña Alida utilizara el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser: Harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, vainilla, canela molida, margarina, huevos.
texts.en:
Alida Sulay L. M. has had a pastry business for 18 years. Her specialty is making sugared donuts of various sizes. In addition she makes chocolate donuts, eclairs, hamburger buns, bread, coffee cake, syrup cake, and scones. All of her products are of a good size and taste great. It is notable that during all this time she has managed the business herself. She has a male employee who distributes her products. She maintains the place where she makes her products with good hygiene. Alida has customers with permanent contracts, and everything she makes is distributed daily. Many of her customers are people who have cafeterias in schools in the city of Danli. Alida is a single woman who has worked hard to succeed for her children, who depend only upon her. She will use this loan to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, vanilla, ground cinnamon, margarine and eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, vanilla, ground cinnamon, margarine and eggs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 45 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos ya independientes y con familia, en el que viven juntos en un barrio al sur de Lima.Por muchos años trabajaba vendiendo comida, hasta que cayó enferma, por lo que tuvo que dejar ese negocio. Con el tiempo, siendo sus hijos adultos y con la ayuda de ellos, pudieron comprar un carro. Desde entonces realizan el servicio de transporte interurbano, desde las 5:00am de la mañana hasta la media noche,  en donde su hijo mayor es el chofer,  y el segundo realiza la cobranza de pasajes, de esa manera evitarían gastos extras de cobrador a otras personas. De las ganancias que obtiene puede cubrir las revisiones técnicas de su vehículo, además del cambio de llantas, así como el pago de permiso y el seguro, al mismo tiempo que necesitan pagar los gastos diarios para la familia. Es así que se siente con mucha responsabilidad, además que le gusta la actividad que realiza a lado de sus hijos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se compromete a no retrazarse ninguna cuota, de ese modo no logrará perjudicar al resto de sus compañeros a quienes mucho aprecia. Con el crédito que solicita, lo derivará en la compra de llantas para su carro, puesto que ya las tiene muy deterioradas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old. She is a single mother and has two independent adult children. They have their own families now. They live together in a south Lima neighborhood. [Carmen] sold food for many years until she fell ill and had to leave the business. Over time she and her children were able to buy a vehicle. Since then they have been providing intercity transportation from 5:00 am to midnight. Her oldest son drives and the second oldest collects payment for the service. This way they are able to save the cost of hiring someone else to collect. The income covers the cost of vehicle maintenance (less the cost of tires), registration, and insurance. They also pay for the family's daily expenses. She feels that she has a lot of responsibility, but likes working alongside her children. This will be her sixth loan through MFP and she promises not to fall behind on any payments, so that she will not shed a bad light on her colleagues, whom she appreciates very much. She will use the money from this loan to buy tires for her car because the ones on it are already much deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tires

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, tiene 44 años, tiene cuatro hijos, es una madre responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos y quiere darles una profesión para que puedan defenderse mejor en la vida. 

Antonia es mujer trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo al tallado de piedra y confección de chompas de lana, ella tiene un pequeño taller donde confecciona sus productos y nos cuenta que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después sale a vender sus productos. Ya son 13 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
 
Antonia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana y piedra fina. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antonia is 44 years old and has four children. She is a responsible mother who succeeds on behalf of her children so that they will be able to pursue a profession and have a better life.

Antonia is a hardworking woman who sells crafts such as stone carvings and handmade wool sweaters. She has a small workshop where she makes her products. Antonia says she wakes up very early to complete her household activities and then leaves to sell her products. She has been in this business for 13 years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work.

Antonia needs a loan in order to buy materials for her work, such as wool and fine stone. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & fine stone

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Martínez de Oviedo tiene 59 años tiene un hijo de 30 años que trabaja y viven en el barrio Los Calamares al suroccidente de Cartagena de Indias.  
Ella vende pescado y con su conyuge tiene una carpintería, dos razones por las cuales aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000, para comprar una cantidad suficiente de pescado para venderlo en la semana santa y madera para elaborar muebles solicitados.  
Inició su negocio en el año 2001 cuando adquirió un congelador y empezó a trabajar con $200.000 de ahorros, que logró guardando en una alcancía moneda a moneda. Se inclinó por la venta de este producto sin experiencia y con dificultades de salud de su madre y con el agravante de un hijo desaparecido.  Gradualmente logró sacar adelante este negocio y también  respaldar a su cónyuge en la carpintería, quien conoce ese oficio, por eso decidió hacer un crédito a la Fundación  y fortalecer paralelamente las dos actividades que se han ampliado, en especial la carpintería que aunque tiene dos años de estar funcionando, es en la actualidad el negocio familiar principal, .
Este es su séptimo crédito con la Fundación inició con $1,200,000 y ha llegado a recibir  hasta  $2.800.00, vive agradecida con esta organización porque le ha respaldado  simultáneamente estos dos negocios familiares y con ellos ha podido crecer desde su primer crédito, mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda y hasta ayudar a su hijo quien ya formó su familia.
Ella sueña con que su carpintería crezca y poder dedicarse plenamente a  ella, porque en la actualidad complementa este trabajo y  el de vender pescado, con su actividad de trabajar en un hotel, con el que obtiene unos ingresos adicionales, pero ella reconoce que esto ocurrirá cuando la carpintería genere el dinero suficiente para sostener plenamente su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Martínez de Oviedo is 59 years old and has a 30 year old son who works. They lives in the neighborhood of Las Calamares in the southwestern section of Cartagena de Indias.

She sells fish while her husband works as a carpenter. Therefore, she has two reasons why she is applying for a loan worth 2,000,000 COP. She plans to buy a sufficient quantity of fish to sell during Holy Week as well as wood to make furniture requested by her husband’s customers.

Ana started her business in 2001 when she bought a freezer. She began with 200,000 COP of savings, which she accumulated coin by coin and kept in a piggy bank. Ana was determined to sell her products even though she had no experience and had to deal with her mother’s health problems and a child who left home. Slowly she was able to move forward with her business and also support her husband with his carpentry, since he is well-known for his trade. Ana decided to apply for a loan from the Foundation in order to strengthen both businesses at the same time by expanding them, especially the carpentry business since it had been in operation already for two years. It is now the primary family business.

This is Ana’s seventh loan with the Foundation. She began with a loan of 1,200,000 COP and has received as much as 2,800,000 COP. Ana is grateful to the organization because it has helped to simultaneously support two family businesses that have grown since receiving the first loan. This has also improved her conditions at home and helped her son who has now started his own family.

Ana hopes that the carpentry business will grow so that she can work with it full-time. At the moment, she supplements this work by selling fish and with a job working at a hotel to earn additional income. She recognizes that her goal will be achieved when the carpentry business generates enough income to fully support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for her carpentry business & enough fish to sell during Holy Week

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, tiene 40 años, tiene dos hijos, es una madre responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos y quiere darles una profesión para que puedan defenderse mejor en la vida. 

Alejandrina es mujer trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo confección de niños manuelitos de yeso, ella tiene un pequeño taller donde confecciona sus productos y nos cuenta que se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después vende sus productos en especial en el mes de diciembre en las fiesta de Navidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Antonio también se dedica a la venta de verduras en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado.  
 
Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo yeso, tiza, lijar, cabello y pintura.   
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 40 years old and has two children. She is a responsible mother who succeeds on behalf of her children so that they will be able to pursue a profession and have a better life.

Alejandrina is a hardworking woman who sells crafts such as figurines of the Christ child made of plaster. She has a small workshop where she makes her products. Alejandrina says she wakes up very early to complete her household activities and then leaves to sell her products. Most of her sales are made during the month of December around Christmas. She has been in this business for several years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work.

Alejandrina needs a loan to buy materials for her work such as plaster, chalk, sandpaper, hair, and paint. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plaster, chalk, sandpaper, hair, and paint

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas en su casa, ubicada  al pie de un cerro, al sur de la ciudad.Es una mujer muy trabajadora, enseña diversos tipos de danzas a niños de su barrio, en su tiempo libre;  además paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, de una reconocida marca. Este trabajo lo  realiza  caminando por los cerros cercanos al lugar donde vive, buscando nuevas clientes. Durante  el verano es muy tedioso, ya que el calor es sofocante, pero  tiene éxito en sus ventas, ya que trabaja mediante  crédito, aunque muchas veces no le pagan oportunamente, pese a eso sigue en la lucha diaria, pues quiere salir adelante. Para el futuro se ha propuesto instalar  una  librería en su casa, donde viene alistando el puesto  con la ayuda de su esposo, que es  albañil, ya que desea iniciarse  inmediatamente en este negocio al que le tiene mucha confianza, y claro sin dejar la venta de cosméticos. Está segura que le irá muy bien, ya que es muy conocida por la zona donde vive.Es el  sexto préstamo que tiene y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible  el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además se compromete a seguir liderando a sus demás compañeras de crédito; para motivarlas a que no se atrasen en los pagos de sus cuotas.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  útiles escolares, para que siga adelante  el proyecto de su librería.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters at home, which is located at the foot of a hill in the southern part of the city. She is a hardworking woman who teaches different forms of dance to the children in her neighborhood. In her free time, she sells a well-known brand of beauty products. This work requires that she walk through the hills where she lives in order to find new customers. During the summer the work can be very tedious and the heat is suffocating. Nonetheless, she is successful with her sales. Since she offers products on credit, her customers often do not pay on time so every day is a struggle for her to get ahead. In the future, she plans to open a bookstore in her home and will enlist the help of her husband, who works as a mason. Martha wants to start this business immediately and is very confident about pursuing it without having to abandon her cosmetics sales. She is sure that it will go well because she is very knowledgeable about the area where she lives.

This is the sixth loan Martha has received and she is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue to work. She also promises to continue leading the other members of her Communal Bank and motivating them not to fall behind in their payments. Martha plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of school supplies so that she can move forward with her bookstore project.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to stock her new bookstore

loans.name: Zadi

texts.es: Zadi tiene 39 años, separada del padre de sus dos hijos, actualmente vive con sus hijos, en la casa de su  segundo compromiso. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa, pero tras la separación de su esposo, tuvo que dejar el negocio. Con el tiempo se dedicaría a vender refrescos, golosinas, galletas y demás dulces, en un puesto de venta dentro de un colegio privado. Es entonces que desde las 7:00am de la mañana hasta las 7:00pm de la noche trabaja sin parar, siendo el horario de refrigerio que no se da abasto, por faltarle ayudante. Sin embargo le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que de ese modo se siente una mujer muy útil haciendo lo que mejor sabe hacer. En el futuro espera comprarse otras vitrinas, en donde pueda exhibir sus productos y puedan incrementar más sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que desea contar con posteriores créditos, puesto que los considera de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas, además de una vitrina.
texts.en:
Zadi is 39 years old and separated from the father of her two children. She currently lives with them in her second home. Zadi previously worked as a clothing vendor, but after separating from her husband she decided to leave the business. At the moment she sells soft drinks, candies, cookies, and other sweets from her vending post inside of a private school. She works nonstop from 7am until 7pm supplying refreshments without the help of an assistant. Zadi enjoys her work because it makes her feel like a useful woman who is able to perform at what she does best. In the future, she hopes to buy more display cases so that she can exhibit her products in order to increase her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP. Zadi commits to making her payments on time because she wants to become eligible for future loans that will be of great help to her business. With the money she requested, Zadi will invest in the purchase of more candy as well as a display case.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy & a display case

loans.name: Esmeralda Auxiliadora

texts.es: Esmeralda Auxiliadora tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Además tiene 1 hija que tiene discapacidad y esta a su cargo. Esta actividad se da por iniciativa propia, por lo que tenía que mantener a su hijo. Ella es una persona muy humilde y disfruta de su trabajo por lo que siempre está al tanto de los que sus clientes le solicitan. Anteriormente ella de dedicaba a la venta de comida, pero debido a los diferentes problemas de salud que presentaba decide dedicarse a la pulpería. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas y refrescos naturales. Su deseo es seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esmeralda Auxiliadora is 54 years old and has been managing a grocery store for more than nine years. She has a daughter who has a disability and is in her care. Esmeralda started this business of her own initiative in order to support her child. She is a humble person who enjoys working for she is always aware of what her customers are requesting. Esmeralda previously sold prepared foods, but due to various health problems she decided to devote herself to running a grocery store.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, candy, and natural beverages. Her wish is to continue improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, and natural beverages

loans.name: Angel Edisson

texts.es:
Ángel M. de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposa atiende el local de repuestos ellos tienen 3 hijos de 19, 12, 5 años. 

Hace 13 años atrás el trabajo en un taller como mecánico automotriz pero lo pocos ingresos que tenia y  la frustrante idea de tener su propio taller mecánico le fueron de empuje para invertir sus pocos ahorros en repuestos para carros.

En la actualidad el tiene un taller con venta de repuestos y con los bueno ingresos que ha tenido en estos años ha contratado empleados para que le ayuden. Con el préstamo quiere comprar repuestos para carros, como válvulas, inyectores, rulemanes etc. 

En el futuro quiere tener mas surtido su almacén y más empleados para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángel M. is 45 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and receives all the basic services. His wife attends to their parts store. They have three children (ages 19, 12, and 5).

Ángel has been working at a repair shop as an auto mechanic for 13 years. He has always had the idea to open his own garage, but he has been frustrated by the fact that he has very little income. Therefore, he decided to invest his small savings in automobile parts.

He currently has an auto parts shop. Revenues have been so good in recent years that he has hired employees for help. With this loan he will buy auto parts such as valves, injectors, bearings, and other items. Later on, he wants to acquire more inventory for his store and hire more employees so that he can ensure his children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto parts such as valves, injectors, bearings, and other items

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana Del Socorro tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven. Cuando inicio fue por los conocimientos de su Mama así fue que Ana logro aprender lo necesario y adquirir experiencia para fortalecer su trabajo, pues ella siempre sea preocupado por su familia como son sus 2 hijos que les proporciona el alimento diario y además mejorar su condición de vida. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de cosméticos, sabanas, ropa y trajes. Su deseo es poder proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Del Socorro is 52 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. Ever since she was a young woman, she has always enjoyed working. When she started, Ana relied on her mother’s knowledge and learned everything she needed to know and gained the experience to strengthen her business. She has two children and is always concerned about providing for her family’s daily needs and improving their living conditions.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and suits. Her wish is to be able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and suits

loans.name: Urania

texts.es:
Urania J. L. es una joven trabajadora dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio cuando trabajando en el mercado vio la necesidad que había en su comunidad para adquirir ciertos productos como granos básicos, verduras, jabones etc. y  empezó a traer dichos productos para comercializarlos. Luego de ello decidió poner una pulpería la cual con el tiempo ha mejorado considerablemente.

Esta joven madre de un niño de cinco años y quien espera con amor, anhelo e ilusión a su nuevo bebe  tiene la meta de tener una pulpería completa. Ella que invertirá el crédito en adquirir mayor cantidad de productos y variedad.
texts.en:
Urania J. L. is a hardworking young woman who owns a small grocery store. She came up with the idea for this business when she was working at the market. Urania saw the need in her community to provide certain products such as basic grains, vegetables, soaps, and other items. She began bringing these products in order to sell. Later she decided to open a shop which has improve considerably over time.

This young mother has a five year old son. With love and hope, she is waiting to have her next child and also has the goal of having a full grocery store. She will use this loan to acquire a larger quantity and greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Vicente Manuel

texts.es: Vicente Manuel tiene la edad de 41 años. El es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. La actividad económica de Don Vicente es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio con muy pocos productos, pues no tenía el capital suficiente pues decide recurrir a los financiamientos los que fueron de mucho apoyo, además en esos momentos el no tenía trabajo y encontró este medio de vida, el ofrece sus productos en un pequeño termo en donde prepara sus deliciosos ceviches. El financiamiento está destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que podrá comprar conchas, camarones, pescados y termos. El siempre tiene el sueño de obtener su propio local.
texts.en:
Vicente Manuel is 41 years old. He is a hardworking gentleman who has been partnering with Fundación León 2000 for quite some time. Don Vicente has been in the business of selling seafood for more than nine years. He began with very little inventory since he did not have sufficient capital. This is why he decided to utilize the loans, which have been of great help.

There is not enough work for him at the moment. Since this is how he must make a living, he started offering his products by preparing his delicious ceviches and offering them in small cups. This loan will be used as operating capital to buy clams, shrimp, fish, and cups. He always dreams of having his own vending location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy clams, shrimp, fish, and cups

loans.name: Bertha Verónica

texts.es: Bertha Verónica A. es comerciante de frutas y verduras cuyo oficio realiza desde su niñez cuando ayudaba a su madre quien también comercializaba estos productos. Ella con el préstamo comprara frutas y verduras de temporada como aguacate, jocote, mango, grocea…etc.
texts.en:
Bertha Verónica A. has been selling fruit and vegetables since she was a child; she used to help her mother who also sold produce. Betha plans to use her loan to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables such as avocado, mango and other typical regional fruits such as jocote and grocea.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase harvests of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora María Auxiliadora tiene 40 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Tiene todo el empeño de salir adelante con su negocio. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues los financiamientos son su ayuda. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante por lo que todos los días carga sus productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Actualmente el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo y este será invertido en productos como ropa interior, pantalones, faldas, trajes de baños porque se acerca la temporada de verano. Su deseo es tener su propio establecimiento.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and has two children. She has the motivation with which to get ahead with her business. She has been working with Fundación for a long time and the loans have been a great help to her. She sells general merchandise and has been doing so for the past eight years. She sells her items on foot and carries them as she sells. She will use the money from this loan to provide working capital to buy undergarments, pants, skirts, and swimsuits because the summer is approaching. Someday she hopes to have her own establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase comestibles to open a grocery store

loans.name: Agustin Guillermo

texts.es:
Agustín S. E., quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado siete crédito con CEPRODEL durante siete  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para el sistema eléctrico de su casa ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustín works as a sanitation engineer in the Roberto Huembes market in Managua. He is married has a school-aged son who he cares for. He has had seven previous loans through CEPRODEL over a seven year period and has used the loans to improve his home. He is asking for this loan in order to buy parts and material for the electrical system in his home, which is in need of repair. He wants to provide better living conditions for his family and a better life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica María M. Ríos, quien  Labora como Aseador en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. Unan, ella tiene seis hijos a su cargo,  y  dos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado nueve crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura para una parte del techo de su casa ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angélica María M. Ríos works as a cleaning lady for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. With her husband, she has 6 children in her care, 2 of whom are school-aged. She is married, and has taken 9 loans with CEPRODEL over 9 years. Over this period of time she has invested the loans in improving the home where she lives, thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to buy construction materials such as: corrugated metal sheets for roofing, support beams and paint, to repair a part of the roof of her home that is in bad condition. She does all of this with the objective of having better security and providing better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve and expand her home

loans.name: Cinthia Raquel

texts.es:
Cinthia Raquel B. E., quien  Labora como EDUCADORA en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, ella tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL durante este  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines para su casa de habitación .
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cinthia, who works with ECUADORA, in the Eastern Market of Managua, is married and has a school-aged son. This is her first loan through CEPRODEL this year and she will use the money to improve her home. She will use the money to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting and gutters for her home. She wants to provide greater security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Gonzalo Jacobo

texts.es:
Gonzalo Jacobo S., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado trece  crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de electricidad por lo que cambiara todo el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Jacobo S. works as a janitor in the Israel Lewites Market in Managua. He has a son in his care who is school-aged. He is married, and has taken 13 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 9 years. Over this time he is used the loans to improve the home that he lives in, thanks to the financings provided by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to buy electrical supplies to change the entire electrical system in his home. He does this to increase security and to provide better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José Andrés R. Velazquez, quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado siete crédito con CEPRODEL durante siete  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de Persianas de Vidrio para su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Andrés R. Velazquez works as a collector at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children who are in school. José Freddy has received seven loans with CEPRODEL over a seven year period and invested the proceeds in making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy venetian blinds to install throughout his house. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase venetian blinds

loans.name: Jose Freddy

texts.es:
José Freddy A., quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cinco crédito con CEPRODEL durante cinco  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, hierro y piedra para la construcción  de un cuarto para sus dos hijos.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Freddy A. works as a collector at the Wholesale Market of Managua. He is married and has two dependent children who are in school. José Freddy has received five loans with CEPRODEL over a five year period and invested the proceeds in making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and stone to build a room for his two children. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, iron, and stone to build a room for his two children

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José Israel R. M., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos crédito con CEPRODEL durante dos  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines, pintura para una parte del techo de su casa ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Israel R. M. works as a janitor at the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has four dependent children who are in school. José has received two loans with CEPRODEL over a two year period and invested the proceeds in making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, and paint to repair part of the roof of his house because it is in bad condition. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, crossbeams, and paint to repair part of the roof of his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel Chavarría García, quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado once crédito con CEPRODEL durante once años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: arena y cemento para reforzar las paredes de su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José works as a security guard in the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has two school aged children. He has had 11 loans through CEPRODEL over 11 years. He will use the money to make improvements to his home and will buy building materials such as sand and cement to reinforce the walls of his home. He wants to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José Estaban M. A., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cuatro crédito con CEPRODEL durante cuatro  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques para la construcción de un muro en la parte delantera de su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José works as a custodian in the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has three school aged children. He has had four loans through CEPRODEL over four years. He will use the money to make improvements to his home and will buy building materials such as cement, iron, and cinder blocks in order to build a wall in front of his house. He wants to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
Juan Alejandro Téllez Méndez, quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado quince crédito con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás del patio de su casa. y.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan works as a security guard in the Eastern Market in Managua. He is married and has three school aged children. He has had 15 loans through CEPRODEL over eight years. He will use the money to make improvements to his home and will buy building materials such as cement, sand, and stone in order to build a wall behind his house. He wants to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Soth T. sells a few types of vegetables at a local market in the province, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She is married and resides with her young child in Takeo province, Cambodia. The family is also supported by her husband who operates his tuk tuk (motorbike with compartment attached), earning $4 US per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have started these businesses. Soth T. is requesting a loan of $800 US to purchase a new motorbike. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. T. is shown with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C. sells pigs, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She is married and lives with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has six children. The family is also supported by her husband who is a farmer earning $3 US per day. Their standard of living has improved since they started these businesses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1200 US to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth L., age 39, is married and resides with her husband in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has no children. She is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a farmer growing rice and earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. 

L. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a mechanical plow to help with the farming business. By doing so, she hopes that her husband will be able to produce more output from his farmland. This is L.’s first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a mechanical plow

loans.name: Preab

texts.en:
Preab S. is married and resides with her children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has five children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S. is married and resides with her children in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has five children. She and her husband are engaged in the agriculture sector as farmers on their own plots of farmland, earning an income of $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by four of S.’s children, who are currently working at a local garment factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more plots of farmland to expand her agricultural output for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S. sells various kinds of groceries, earning $3  US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She is married and lives with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two young children. The family is also supported by her husband who is a farmer, earning $2 US per day. Their standard of living has improved since they started these businesses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum C. is married and resides with his wife in Takeo province, Cambodia. He has a one-year-old child. He is engaged in the business of sewing and designing clothes, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by his wife who always helps him in the business. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had this business. C. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a new sewing machine to expand his sewing business and generate a better income. This is his first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn M. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of producing cow ties to sell to the villagers, earning an income of USD 2.30 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who operates his motorbike to provide transportation services, earning an income of USD 4.60 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. M. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase cows in stock for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has five children. She is engaged in the business of selling clothes, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who produces cow ties for sale in his village, earning an income of USD 1.80 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. M. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more clothes for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi L. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of selling Cambodian traditional silk products, earning an income of USD 6.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a cameraman, earning an income of USD 4.30 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. L. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase more supplies for the camera and video business of her husband. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. L.'s husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the camera and video business

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en:
Jean Marie C. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jean Marie is single. To make a living, Jean Marie owns & operates a business buying & selling fish to the local community members. Jean Marie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Marie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jean Marie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Big

texts.en: Big Y. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children. She and her husband grow vegetables to sell, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. This couple tries to work hard everyday to ensure a good standard of living for the family. Y. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en:
Marchie J. is from the village of P-3 Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Marchie is single. To make a living, Marchie operates a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marchie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marchie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is the first loan of Marchie from GDMPC. Marchie is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marchie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Hum S., age 29, is married and resides with her child in Daoun Keo District, Takeo province, Cambodia. She has a young child. She is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of groceries at home in her village, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who always helps his wife in the business. Their standard of living has improved since they have had this business. S. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a machine to cut firewood and pigs to raise for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a machine to cut firewood and pigs to raise

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei H. is 45 years old and she lives in Preaek Ta Sau village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srei H. is a congee seller in local village and her husband is a corn middleman who can earn a small income to support their family. They have a problem because they do not have enough money to support their business. Thus, Mrs. Srei H. decided to apply for a loan to make more money to buy more corns to re-sell corn. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a staff member in Pencil market, and the other is attending the local public school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cornfield to re-sell corn

loans.name: Neth

texts.en: Neth C., age 49, is married and resides with her children in Daoun Keo District, Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in growing rice and raising pigs, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband (pictured) who sells palm wine, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. Neth C. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Marng

texts.en: Marng N., age 40, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children. To help cover the family expenses, she buys mangoes to resell when the price is good, ad is able to earn about USD 7 per day. The family is also supported by her husband (pictured) who is a farmer and earns USD 4 per day. One of N.’s children is employed in a local garment factory and also helps to support the family. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more mangoes for resale. She hopes she will able to generate a better income to reach her goals of building a nice house and sending her children to a good school.

loans.use: To buy mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en: Mrs. Yamuna M. lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Purna M. and their son. Her husband works in a steel shop. Her son is studying in primary school.  Mrs. Yamuna M. opened a grocery shop two years ago to help improve the living conditions of her family.  Currently they can't provide a better education for their son because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. To overcome this problem she opened the grocery shop.  Due to lack of capital she can’t buy goods to sell in her shop, so she is requesting for her first loan of 15000 NPR to buy goods like rice, dhal, and noodles. She wants to earn more income to provide a better education for her son and wishes to help her husband upgrade the quality of life for their family.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem C., age 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Daoun Keo District, Takeo province, Cambodia. She and her husband are in the business of selling chickens and ducks, earning a gross income of about USD 60 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since they have started this business. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more chickens and ducks for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks for sale.

loans.name: March

texts.en: Mrs. March C. was born in 1960. She lives in Preaek Ta Sau village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeurn Met are farmers who own more than 1-hectare of land to grow vegetables and rice for selling to support their family.  They try to work hard in the field, yet they still fall short in income. Because they do not have enough money to support the family from farming, Mrs. March C. has decided to ask for a loan to grow more vegetables and to hire laborers to harvest and transport rice. This couple has a child who is a laborer. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To grow vegetables and hire laborers.

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Cristina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cristina is married and has 3 school-aged children. Cristina owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Sinuorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sinuorn T. was born in 1963.  She lives in Kampong Trea village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Haut Broek, are farmers who lease 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for selling to support their family. This family tries to work hard but they don't earn enough income. Thus, Mrs. Sinuorn T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy supplies for making white wine and also to buy three piglets for breeding to start a new business.  She is the mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers, and the other is attending in local public school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy some supplies for making white wine.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. (0) is a 62-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a fourteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Satya Laksana Group (MUK-0014). Ni Ketut is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** ni ketut S. (0) merupakan 62 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota melaya-bali. ni ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah satya laksana (MUK-0014). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. ni ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, ni ketut menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, ni ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. ni ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: 03.01.0027 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ram N. T. is a 57-year-old femaL. living in Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Ram is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
