The official name of this borrowing group is Hoang Hoa-Thanh Hoa (03.01.0027 Hoang Hoa).

Ram is married and has 9 adult children.  To making a living, Ram provides furniture rentals to local community members.  Ram has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, Ram joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ram has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.000.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and she is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND.  This will be her 12th loan through Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Ram plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  L. T. Tiem is a 42-year-old femaL. requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.
2.  L. T. Lan is a 48-year-old femaL. requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan for raising livestock.
3.  N. T. Gai is a 25-year-old femaL. requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan for raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her furniture rental business.

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Flora U. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Gud, San Isidro, Isabela. Flora has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Flora is the leader of a 12 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Flora U.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokhoerun

texts.en: Mr. Sokhoerun K. lives in Phum Thum village in Kandal province and he was born in 1972. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to support his family. He is a widower who lives with two members of his household. He wants to grow cucumbers, but he did not have enough money to grow them. Thus, in order to improve productive cucumber, Mr. Sokhoerun K. decided to request a loan to buy bamboo, fertilizer, and fuel. With the rest of the loan, he would like to hire farm laborers to plow his field.

loans.use: To buy bamboo, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Mrs. Savan S. is a villager in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province and she is 45 years old. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow vegetable to sell to support their family. They have some problems because their field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Savan S. decided to seek a loan to buy a water machine and hose for doing farming. She is a mother of five children. One of her children is a furniture maker, one is a seamstress in the garment factory, and the others are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and hose

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mr. Soun M., 58 (is in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Vanda Vuth, 51, have been married since 1979. They have six children; four sons and two daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two work in the garment factory and another one assists his father in the business. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Soun has been growing mushrooms since 2006 and his wife is a cleaner. He is requesting his first loan of $300 to use for growing mushrooms.

loans.use: To use for growing mushrooms.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en: Ni Made Arini (0) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tunas Mekar Asih Group (MUK-0015). Ni Made is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Made joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets. Ni Made is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Ni Made arini (0) merupakan 37 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota melaya-bali. Ni Made adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah tunas mekar asih (MUK-0015). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni Made bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mr. Khom C. and his wife, Mrs. Phal Sok, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children has full time employment and the other children study in the local school.

Khom has been growing rice and vegetables since he was married and his wife is a garment factory worker. Besides farming, he also raises chicken at home. By the way, his house is old and breaks down. It’s difficult for family members to live, so Khom is asking for another loan of $1,000 to buy wooden materials to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: 03.02.02 Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nguyen T. T. (03.02.056) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nguyen T. T. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.02.02 Hoang Hoa -Thanh Hoa (03.02.02 Hoang Hoa).


Nguyen T. T. is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Nguyen T. T. operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale.  Nguyen T. T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1.700.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Nguyen T. T. joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nguyen T. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nguyen T. T. from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nguyen T. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Dang T. N. (03.02.018) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Cao T. H. (03.02.021) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Le T. L. (03.02.028) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nguyen T. T.(03.02.056) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nguyen T. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.02.02 Hoang Hoa -Thanh Hoa (03.02.02 Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Nguyen T. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyen T. T. kiếm được khoảng 1.700.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Nguyen T. T. đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nguyen T. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Dang T. N. (03.02.018) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Cao T. H. (03.02.021) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Le T. L. (03.02.028) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un L., 52 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Yeun Yin, 58, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have ten children: eight sons and two daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, three have full-time employment and the other four attend school.  

Sam-un has been farming for 30 years. Her husband is a retired policeman, who now drives a horse cart in his village. Sam-un is asking for her first loan of $300 USD to purchase a water pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mr. Pon C., 60 and his wife, Mrs. Ky Phon (pictured together), 60, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have five childrens. Three of the children are married and live in separate homes, one is a security guard and another one is a farmer. The couple is old; however, they are still strong enough to work. 

Pon has been selling cows for 35 years, a skill he learned from his father. His wife has been running grocery store in front of her house for two years. He is asking for his first loan of 600 USD to help his capital to purchase cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. (pictured with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Chen Sot, have been married since 2005 and have three children: two daughters and a little son. They are living in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saren has been a silk weaver for more than 15 years. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is applying for her second loan of $200 to add to her own money to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong C. is 49 years old and his wife, Mrs. Pon Chhum, is 44 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, two are construction workers, one works in a garment factory and the other three attend school. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Kong was not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead. 

Kong is a fisherman and his wife sells meatballs. Besides these businesses, the couple also grows rice on their farmland in the village. Kong is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 64-year-old Mr. Un O.'s daily routine. Rice is an essential product, vital to Cambodian people. He learned to do this from his grandmother and he has been very widely known in this sector since before he was married. He was married a lot of years to Bou Hing, age 59, who assists him with the farm work. This couple has seven children; three of the children are married and the other four are single. In the past, Un O. hired a cow from a villager in order to help plow his farmland and right now, he wants to own a cow. Because Un O. has no money, he is applying for a loan to buy a cow to facilitate his field plowing.

loans.use: To buy a cow to facilitate field-plowing.
